original: @192b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @192b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: m'a y'a dz'a la ma h'a tantra r'a dza t'i k'a khya /
analyzed: m'a y'a dz'a la ma h'a tantra r'a dza t'i k'a khya /
translated: Maṇḍalopāyikā-mahātantrarājatīkā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: The Extensive Explanation of the Great Tantra of the Magical Net

original: bcom ldan 'das ngag gi dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ngag gi dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Lord of Speech.🔽The five perfect Buddhas,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lnga rnams dang // legs sbyangs rigs pa brgyad pa ni //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas lnga rnams dang // legs sbyangs rigs pa brgyad pa ni //
translated: The eight accomplished clans,🔽The four goddesses who are the mothers,🔽The ten wrathful ones of great strength,

original: yum gyur lha mo bzhi po dang // stobs chen khro bo bcu po dang // stong du bzhis ma tshang ba'i stong //
analyzed: yum gyur lha mo bzhi po dang // stobs chen khro bo bcu po dang // stong du bzhis ma tshang ba'i stong //
translated: And the thousand less four hundred,

original: byang chub sems rnams phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: byang chub sems rnams phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage to the Bodhisattvas.

original: rgyud bzang snying po sbas pa yi //
analyzed: rgyud bzang snying po sbas pa yi //
translated: The essence of the good continuum is hidden,

original: bdag gis 'grel pa gsal bar bya //
analyzed: bdag gis 'grel pa gsal bar bya //
translated: But I shall clarify it in this commentary.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs ba 'di'i brjod bya ni gang yin /🔽'brel pa ni gang yin //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs ba 'di'i brjod bya ni gang yin / 'brel pa ni gang yin //
translated: In the words Thus have I heard, etc., what is the subject matter?🔽What is the connection?

original: dgos pa ni ci zhig yod /
analyzed: dgos pa ni ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the purpose?

original: dgos pa'i yang dgos pa ni ci zhig yod ce na de brjod par bya ste de la brjod par bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgos pa'i yang dgos pa ni ci zhig yod ce na de brjod par bya ste de la brjod par bya ba ni /
translated: What is the ultimate purpose? That should be stated.

original: bcom ldan 'das sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste dngos po thams cad @193a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste dngos po thams cad @193a * //
translated: The Bhagavān is the net of magical emanations, since he emanates as the nature of all things.

original: kyi ngo bo nyid du sprul pas rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: kyi ngo bo nyid du sprul pas rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: Vairocana Vajra, the Tathāgata, is what should be expressed.

original: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud la yang de skad ces bya ste skyes pa'i rabs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud la yang de skad ces bya ste skyes pa'i rabs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: And the tantra that teaches that is also called that, like the Jātakas, etc.

original: 'di dag ni rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: These are the characteristics of the expression and the expressed,

original: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: or the method and the arisen from the method.

original: gdul bya rnams dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su btang ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa rjes su gnang bas mngon par 'dod pa bskyed pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su btang ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa rjes su gnang bas mngon par 'dod pa bskyed pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is the generation of the desire for the permission to enter the maṇḍala, etc., preceded by the disciples being sent for refuge to the Three Jewels, etc.

original: mngon par 'dod pa yang dag par skyes pa rnams dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rnam pa thams cad kun du bzang po'i ye shes thob pa ni de'i dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa yang dag par skyes pa rnams dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rnam pa thams cad kun du bzang po'i ye shes thob pa ni de'i dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin no //
translated: The ultimate purpose is the attainment of the gnosis of the universal excellence of all aspects by those who have generated the desire for perfect enlightenment, through the stages of entering the mandala, etc.

original: rgyud 'dir rgyud kyi bdag po ni dpal rnam par snang mdzad de'i yon tan ston pa'i gleng gzhi ting nge 'dzin gsum ston par byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas brtsams te rgyud ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin ston pa mthar thug pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud 'dir rgyud kyi bdag po ni dpal rnam par snang mdzad de'i yon tan ston pa'i gleng gzhi ting nge 'dzin gsum ston par byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas brtsams te rgyud ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin ston pa mthar thug pa yin no //
translated: In this tantra, the lord of the tantra is glorious Vairocana. The nidana that teaches his qualities, the teaching of the three samadhis, begins with The Blessed One... and concludes with the teaching of the samadhi that teaches the tantra.

original: de nas brtsams te bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa ni rgyud yin no //
analyzed: de nas brtsams te bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa ni rgyud yin no //
translated: Then, beginning with Then, the Blessed One... and concluding with having spoken thus..., is the tantra.

original: de sdud par byed pa ni lcang lo can gyi pho brang na gnas pa sa bcu'i dbang phyug rdo rje 'chang gi rang gi dkyil 'khor na gnas pa kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs rnams la 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs
analyzed: de sdud par byed pa ni lcang lo can gyi pho brang na gnas pa sa bcu'i dbang phyug rdo rje 'chang gi rang gi dkyil 'khor na gnas pa kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs rnams la 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs
translated: The one who gathers them is Vajradhara, the lord of the tenth stage, who resides in the palace of Aḍakavatī.🔽

original: pa smras pa yin te /
analyzed: pa smras pa yin te /
translated: The one who collects it is Vajradhara, the lord of the tenth stage, who resides in the palace of Aḍakavatī, and he says this to the assembly of bodhisattvas, such as Samantabhadra, who reside in his maṇḍala.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba 'dis ni bdag nyid kyi thos pa'i shes pas mngon du gzung ba ste rgyud kyi don nges par gzung bas na rgyud kyi don phyin ci log pa nyid du smras pa yin te 'di ni 'di skad ces pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba 'dis ni bdag nyid kyi thos pa'i shes pas mngon du gzung ba ste rgyud kyi don nges par gzung bas na rgyud kyi don phyin ci log pa nyid du smras pa yin te 'di ni 'di skad ces pa'o //
translated: In this regard, “thus” indicates that the meaning of the tantra is ascertained by the direct perception of one’s own hearing consciousness.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid khas len pa'i tshig gis na mngon sum du thos pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid khas len pa'i tshig gis na mngon sum du thos pa'o //
translated: “I” is a word of self-assertion, and “heard” is direct perception.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag nyid kyis khong du chud pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag nyid kyis khong du chud pa ni med pa'o //
translated: “Hearing” is not understood by oneself.

original: gang gi tshe gang las gang du 'khor ci 'dra ba dang ci zhig thos zhes 'dri ba las /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang las gang du 'khor ci 'dra ba dang ci zhig thos zhes 'dri ba las /
translated: When asked, “When? From whom? Where? What kind of retinue? What was heard?”

original: ci rigs par lan 'debs pa'i phyir smras pa ni dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni lan cig gis dus na zhes bya ba'i don te dus gcig na 'di thos kyi gzhan gyi tshe na ni gzhan dag go zhes pa ste /🔽'dis ni sdud par byed pa bdag nyid thos pa mang bar ston pa yin no //🔽yang na dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig la zhes bya ba'i @193b don de rnam par thar pa'i sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa la dbang thob pas bdag gis thos par bya ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad skad cig ma
analyzed: ci rigs par lan 'debs pa'i phyir smras pa ni dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni lan cig gis dus na zhes bya ba'i don te dus gcig na 'di thos kyi gzhan gyi tshe na ni gzhan dag go zhes pa ste / 'dis ni sdud par byed pa bdag nyid thos pa mang bar ston pa yin no // yang na dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig la zhes bya ba'i @193b don de rnam par thar pa'i sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa la dbang thob pas bdag gis thos par bya ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad skad cig ma

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa 'am dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das gnas rnam par snang mdzad de de bzhugs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa 'am dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das gnas rnam par snang mdzad de de bzhugs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The Blessed One is so called because he has conquered the four demons or because he possesses lordship and so forth. Vairocana is the abode, and he resides there.

original: de ni 'di skad ston pa yin te gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das gnas gtsang ma'i steng khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzhal yas khang byang chub sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams kyis bskor te bzhugs pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das las gnas de nyid du
analyzed: de ni 'di skad ston pa yin te gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das gnas gtsang ma'i steng khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzhal yas khang byang chub sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams kyis bskor te bzhugs pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das las gnas de nyid du
translated: This is what is being taught: when the Blessed One resides in the multi-storied palace above the Pure Abodes, surrounded by an assembly of great bodhisattvas and so forth, at that time, from the Blessed One, in that very place,

original: 'khor de rnams dang lhan cig tu bdag gis rgyud 'di dus gcig na thos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor de rnams dang lhan cig tu bdag gis rgyud 'di dus gcig na thos zhes pa'o //
translated: together with that assembly, I heard this tantra at one time.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i steng na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa thugs su chud pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni gtsang ma ste de rnams kyi bzhugs gnas yin pas gnas so //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i steng na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa thugs su chud pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni gtsang ma ste de rnams kyi bzhugs gnas yin pas gnas so //
translated: The upper part of the Pure Abode, etc. The Blessed Buddha is pure because he has realized the perfection of wisdom. He is the abode because he is the place where they abide.

original: de bas na gnas thams cad de las mchog tu gyur pas na steng na ste gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnas thams cad de las mchog tu gyur pas na steng na ste gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the upper part, because it is superior to all abodes, and it is the best part, because it is the foremost.

original: de yang yi ge bhr'um las nges par 'byung ba rang gi dam tshig la kun du chags pa'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma yongs su gyur pa rin po che sna bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi mchod rten no //
analyzed: de yang yi ge bhr'um las nges par 'byung ba rang gi dam tshig la kun du chags pa'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma yongs su gyur pa rin po che sna bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi mchod rten no //
translated: Moreover, it arises from the syllable bhrūṃ, and it is the transformation of Vajradhātvīśvarī, who is passionately attached to her pledge, and it is a stūpa made of the nature of the four precious substances.

original: de la khang pa brtsegs ma zur bzhi la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni de nyid kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de la khang pa brtsegs ma zur bzhi la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni de nyid kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: The many-storied palace has four corners, etc., and it is the particular feature of that.

original: rin po che sna tshogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni padma r'a ga la sogs pa'i rin po che sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che sna tshogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni padma r'a ga la sogs pa'i rin po che sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The various jewels are various jewels such as rubies, etc.

original: bkod pa ni de rnams kyi tshogs te rig pa'i khyad par dang bcos bas gang bzhugs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bkod pa ni de rnams kyi tshogs te rig pa'i khyad par dang bcos bas gang bzhugs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The array is the collection of those, and that which is filled with the particular knowledge and the creation is called that.

original: de bas na de nyid du'o //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid du'o //
translated: Therefore, it is just that.

original: 'di ni rgyud phyi ma yin pas nges par gsang ba 'dus pa las shes par bya ste de las 'di nyid gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyud phyi ma yin pas nges par gsang ba 'dus pa las shes par bya ste de las 'di nyid gsungs pa ni /
translated: Since this is the continuation of the tantra, it should definitely be known from the Guhyasamaja, and it is taught there:

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi btsun mo'i bha ga la dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhir byin gyis brlabs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi btsun mo'i bha ga la dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhir byin gyis brlabs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, the Tathagata Akshobhya consecrated the bhaga of the queen of all the Tathagatas as the mandala of the great commitment, with four corners, and so forth.

original: gzhal yas khang gi khyad par 'di yang nam mkha'i khams thams cad pa gzhan 'phrul dbang byed na dbang sgyur gyi lha rnams kyi gnas na yod pa yin par shes par bya ste /🔽'dod chags la spyod @194a * //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang gi khyad par 'di yang nam mkha'i khams thams cad pa gzhan 'phrul dbang byed na dbang sgyur gyi lha rnams kyi gnas na yod pa yin par shes par bya ste /🔽'dod chags la spyod @194a * //
translated: This particular celestial mansion should be understood to exist in the realm of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods, who are in all the realms of space.🔽The particular celestial mansion should be understood to exist in the realm of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods, who are in all the realms of space.

original: pa'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ston par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ston par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught for the sake of taking care of sentient beings who are to be converted.

original: de bas na de nyid ni gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i gnas kyi steng ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid ni gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i gnas kyi steng ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not above the abode of the gods of the Pure Abodes.

original: gzhan yang gzhal yas khang de nyid kyi khyad par bstan pa ni shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te shin tu rnam par mdzes pa yang yin zhing rnam par phye ba ste gcig la gcig ma 'dres pa yang yin la de
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhal yas khang de nyid kyi khyad par bstan pa ni shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te shin tu rnam par mdzes pa yang yin zhing rnam par phye ba ste gcig la gcig ma 'dres pa yang yin la de
translated: Moreover, the special features of that very celestial mansion are indicated by “very well-arranged,” etc. It is very well-arranged and also well-separated, i.e., not mixed with one another.

original: yang rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi ka ba ste ka ba brgyad kyi tshul du des nye bar mdzes pa ni brgyan pa ste der zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi ka ba ste ka ba brgyad kyi tshul du des nye bar mdzes pa ni brgyan pa ste der zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, it is adorned with eight pillars, i.e., pillars made of vajras, in the manner of eight pillars.

original: gzhal med khang chen po'i mchog gi bkod pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs brgyad du bskor ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhal med khang chen po'i mchog gi bkod pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs brgyad du bskor ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The arrangement of the supreme great celestial mansion is that which is surrounded on all sides.

original: rdo rje dril bu sgra sgrogs pa ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'i sgra dang bcas par yang dag par byung ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu sgra sgrogs pa ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'i sgra dang bcas par yang dag par byung ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The vajra and bell are sounded, which means that they are produced together with the sound that teaches the reality of phenomena just as it is.

original: yid las byung ba'i mchod pa'i khyad pa chen pos shes par bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis te des brgyan pa ni spud ba'o //
analyzed: yid las byung ba'i mchod pa'i khyad pa chen pos shes par bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis te des brgyan pa ni spud ba'o //
translated: It should be known as having the great ornament of mental offerings, by means of emanations of Buddhas, etc.

original: 'khor lo ni 'og nas bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni 'og nas bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The wheel is a mandala having the characteristics to be explained below.

original: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'o //
translated: The vajra is indivisible.

original: spras pa ni de'i don du spras par byas pa de ru ste nye bar mtshon pa 'dis na de bzhin du sgo dang sgo khyud dang mtshams rnams su yang rdo rje la sogs pas spras shing brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: spras pa ni de'i don du spras par byas pa de ru ste nye bar mtshon pa 'dis na de bzhin du sgo dang sgo khyud dang mtshams rnams su yang rdo rje la sogs pas spras shing brgyan pa'o //
translated: The ornament is the adornment for that purpose, in that place. By this indication, in the same way, the doors, door-lintels, and intermediate spaces are also adorned with vajras, etc.

original: cha byad sna tshogs 'chang ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku ston pas sam rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas cod pan la bkod pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste de rnams kyis brgyan pa zhes bya bar snga
analyzed: cha byad sna tshogs 'chang ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku ston pas sam rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas cod pan la bkod pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste de rnams kyis brgyan pa zhes bya bar snga
translated: The wearing of various costumes is the display of the bodies of all the Buddhas, or the array of the Buddhas of the five families on the crown, and so it is called Vajrasattva, etc.

original: ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The adorned is to be connected with the previous by those.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos sku'i ngo bo ste bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos sku'i ngo bo ste bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po'o //
translated: The Tathagata is the essence of the Dharma Body, the Lord Great Vairocana.

original: de'i sprul pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'chang ba rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje'i de bzhin gshegs pa ste bdag po de las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sprul pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'chang ba rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje'i de bzhin gshegs pa ste bdag po de las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: His emanation is the Enjoyment Body, the Tathagata Vairocana-vajra, because it definitely arises from that Lord.

original: des gang du gdul bya rnams kyi don bya ba byas shing bskyod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des gang du gdul bya rnams kyi don bya ba byas shing bskyod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the one who has done and stirred the work for the sake of those to be trained.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam par snang mdzad 'og min na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam par snang mdzad 'og min na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Or else, the Tathagata is the Enjoyment Body Vairocana dwelling in the Akanistha heaven.

original: de'i sprul pa ni de las gzhan pa'i rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje'i de bzhin gshegs pa ste des zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin ni //
analyzed: de'i sprul pa ni de las gzhan pa'i rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje'i de bzhin gshegs pa ste des zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin ni //
translated: His emanation is the other Vairocana Tathagatas, the Vajras, and so on.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gnas @194b las g-yo ba mi mnga'o //
analyzed: gnas @194b las g-yo ba mi mnga'o //
translated: he does not move from his place.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ni sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ni sku rdo rje'o //
translated: Vairocana is the Vajra Body.

original: de'i snying po ni skye gnas so //
analyzed: de'i snying po ni skye gnas so //
translated: His essence is the place of birth.

original: yang dag par byung ba ni bla na med pa'i ye shes thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par byung ba ni bla na med pa'i ye shes thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who has arisen is the one who has realized the unsurpassed intuition, and he is so called.

original: sna tshogs pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The various is Amoghasiddhi.

original: rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The vajra is Akshobhya.

original: rin po che ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: rin po che ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The jewel is Ratnasambhava.

original: 'od dpag med ni tshe dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag med ni tshe dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Amitabha is Amitayus.

original: de yang 'dir spyod pas bskyod nas zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i spyod pa spyad pa de smon lam gyi grogs dang bcas pas bskyod pa ni gdul bya rnams kyi spyod yul la 'jug pa zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir spyod pas bskyod nas zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i spyod pa spyad pa de smon lam gyi grogs dang bcas pas bskyod pa ni gdul bya rnams kyi spyod yul la 'jug pa zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, here, “having been moved by conduct” means that the conduct explained above, together with the companion of aspiration, is the uncontaminated engagement in the sphere of activity of those to be trained.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te 'og min zhes bya ba'i gzhal yas khang ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyi bzhugs gnas yin pa las gzhan du bzhugs pa ni gdul bya'i 'gro ba rnams kyi ngor mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o //🔽sgo bzhi'i sgo skabs las byung ba //
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te 'og min zhes bya ba'i gzhal yas khang ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyi bzhugs gnas yin pa las gzhan du bzhugs pa ni gdul bya'i 'gro ba rnams kyi ngor mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o // sgo bzhi'i sgo skabs las byung ba //
translated: This is what is being taught: The immeasurable palace called Akaniṣṭha is the abode of the tathāgatas themselves. Abiding elsewhere is done for the sake of those to be trained.🔽The four doors are the four gateways to liberation.

original: zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi'o //
translated: The four doors are the four gateways to liberation, such as emptiness.

original: de nyid 'jug par dka' bas go skabs dang 'dra bas na go skabs te de'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid kyang gdong bzhi pa lto ba 'phyang ba phyag rgya gnyis byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya can yang g-yas na 'khor lo bsnams pa
analyzed: de nyid 'jug par dka' bas go skabs dang 'dra bas na go skabs te de'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid kyang gdong bzhi pa lto ba 'phyang ba phyag rgya gnyis byang chub mchog gi phyag rgya can yang g-yas na 'khor lo bsnams pa
translated: Since it is difficult to enter into that, it is an opportunity, like an occasion. The reality of the mandala that has that nature is also the four-faced one with a hanging belly, having the two mudras of supreme enlightenment, holding a wheel in the right hand

original: / g-yon dril bu dkur brten pas 'dzin pa la yang nye bar gdags pas de skad ces bya pa'o //
analyzed: / g-yon dril bu dkur brten pas 'dzin pa la yang nye bar gdags pas de skad ces bya pa'o //
translated: and holding a bell to the side with the left hand. It is also designated as that.

original: de las byung bas ni de las 'thon pa ste de'i gzugs su yongs su gyur pa de yang sgo bzhi skabs ni byung ba yin pas na de skad ces bshad de khang pa brtsegs mar zhes de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung bas ni de las 'thon pa ste de'i gzugs su yongs su gyur pa de yang sgo bzhi skabs ni byung ba yin pas na de skad ces bshad de khang pa brtsegs mar zhes de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Arisen from that means emerged from that, and that transformation into that form is also explained as arisen from the four doors, so it should be applied in the same way as “in the multi-storied building.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i phyag rgya khyad par ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i phyag rgya khyad par ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the special mudra of that Bhagavān?

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said “the great bodhisattva” and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i tshogs ni byams pa la sogs pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i tshogs ni byams pa la sogs pa'i tshogs so //
translated: The assembly of great bodhisattvas is the assembly of Maitreya and so forth.

original: rig pa'i lha mo rnams ni spyan la sogs pa ste da rnams kyis brgyan pa ni 'khor du gyur pa nyid du gnas pas so //
analyzed: rig pa'i lha mo rnams ni spyan la sogs pa ste da rnams kyis brgyan pa ni 'khor du gyur pa nyid du gnas pas so //
translated: The goddesses of knowledge are Locanā and so forth. They are adorned with these goddesses, who abide as the retinue.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa ste khro bo de'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyang yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa ste khro bo de'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyang yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: The kings of wrath are Yamāntaka and so forth. It should be understood that the pledge seals of those wrathful ones are also present.

original: bran po ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa la sogs pa'i khro bo'o //
analyzed: bran po ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa la sogs pa'i khro bo'o //
translated: The male servants are the wrathful ones Aparājitā and so forth.

original: bran mo ni de'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //🔽pho nya ni rta mgrin la sogs @195a * //
analyzed: bran mo ni de'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o // pho nya ni rta mgrin la sogs @195a * //
translated: The female servants are the pledge seals of those.

original: pa'i khro bo'o //
analyzed: pa'i khro bo'o //
translated: The messengers are the wrathful ones Hayagrīva and so forth.

original: pho nya mo ni de'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: pho nya mo ni de'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The female messengers are the pledge seals of those.

original: phyag brnyan ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la sogs pa'i khro bo'o //
analyzed: phyag brnyan ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la sogs pa'i khro bo'o //
translated: The attendants are the wrathful ones Amṛtakuṇḍali and so forth.

original: phyag brnyan ma ni de'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: phyag brnyan ma ni de'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The female attendants are the pledge seals of those.

original: bskor ba zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bskor ba zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor du byas pa'o //
translated: The retinue is the one who has made the maṇḍala.

original: mdun gyis bltas pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis 'di'i spyan sngar btud par byas pa ste de la mngon du phyogs pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mdun gyis bltas pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis 'di'i spyan sngar btud par byas pa ste de la mngon du phyogs pas gnas pa'o //
translated: Facing forward means that all bow down in his presence, and he abides facing them.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the perfection of the supramundane retinue.

original: bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin te des de'i rang bzhin du byas pa ni gang gis bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid du byas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin te des de'i rang bzhin du byas pa ni gang gis bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid du byas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The meditative concentration of great bliss is the meditative concentration of great bliss. That which is made of that is that which is made of the nature of great bliss.

original: de nyid kyis na ye shes de la dmigs pa yin te rnam pa thams cad du kun du bzang po'i ye shes thob pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na ye shes de la dmigs pa yin te rnam pa thams cad du kun du bzang po'i ye shes thob pa'o //
translated: That itself is the object of that wisdom, which is the attainment of the wisdom of Samantabhadra in all aspects.

original: de nam ma bral ba ste rtag tu yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de nam ma bral ba ste rtag tu yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: That is never separated, but always perfectly endowed.

original: thugs rje chen po ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is non-apprehending.

original: sems can rnams la mnyes gshin pa ni byams pa'i spyod pas de rnams kyi don mdzad pa'i dgongs pa bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la mnyes gshin pa ni byams pa'i spyod pas de rnams kyi don mdzad pa'i dgongs pa bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Being affectionate to sentient beings is the intention to accomplish their aims through the practice of love.

original: de yang 'di ni thugs rje chen po'i mnyes gshin pa yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di ni thugs rje chen po'i mnyes gshin pa yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, this is the affection of great compassion, so it is called that.

original: de bas na 'di ni sems can bsgral ba la mngon par brtson par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ste bdag la sogs pa mngon par zhen par lhung ba'i sems can rnams bsgral ba'i phyir chos bdag med pa la sogs pa ston par mdzad pa la mngon par brtson
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni sems can bsgral ba la mngon par brtson par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ste bdag la sogs pa mngon par zhen par lhung ba'i sems can rnams bsgral ba'i phyir chos bdag med pa la sogs pa ston par mdzad pa la mngon par brtson
translated: Therefore, this is called “striving to liberate sentient beings,” because it is the striving to teach the selflessness of phenomena and so on in order to liberate sentient beings who have fallen into the extreme of attachment to self and so on.

original: zhing rab tu 'bad pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhing rab tu 'bad pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called that because it is endowed with the special striving and exertion.

original: lha dang klu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten pa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ston pa yin te lha la sogs pa brgyad kyi dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi snying pos dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du rang gi phyogs su bsam🔽par bya'o zhes bya ba ni man ngag go //
analyzed: lha dang klu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten pa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ston pa yin te lha la sogs pa brgyad kyi dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi snying pos dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du rang gi phyogs su bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni man ngag go //
translated: By gods, nagas, etc., he shows the perfection of the worldly retinue. The maṇḍala of the eight gods, etc., should be imagined in their own places outside the maṇḍala, with their own essence mantras. This is the instruction.

original: bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa rnams kyis gdul bya rnams kyi yid 'phrog par byed par mdzad nas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa rnams kyis gdul bya rnams kyi yid 'phrog par byed par mdzad nas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: By abiding, he shows that they abide, captivating the minds of the disciples through their miracles, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs so //
translated: Then means at that time.

original: phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje sems dpa' la gzigs pa mdzad nas 'dzum par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje sems dpa' la gzigs pa mdzad nas 'dzum par gyur pa'o //
translated: With regard to Vajrapāṇi, etc., he smiles, gazing at Vajrasattva.

original: de la gzigs par mdzad pa ni phyag na rdo rje ni sras kyi thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de la gzigs par mdzad pa ni phyag na rdo rje ni sras kyi thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The gazing is because Vajrapāṇi is the eldest son.

original: @195b slob dpon dang slob ma'i yul la yang 'dri ba'i rim pa de nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dir 'dzum par mdzad pa ni dgongs pa dang bcas pa ste gzigs pa ni de'i rang bzhin shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @195b slob dpon dang slob ma'i yul la yang 'dri ba'i rim pa de nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dir 'dzum par mdzad pa ni dgongs pa dang bcas pa ste gzigs pa ni de'i rang bzhin shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The same sequence of questions is also for the master and the disciple. Therefore, the smile here is intentional. The seeing is for the sake of knowing the nature of that.🔽By that means by the cause of the smile and the seeing that causes the Blessed One to smile, one should understand that he performs the quality of wonder.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni gang gis na bcom ldan 'das bzhed par mdzad pa dad gzigs par mdzad pa'i rgyu des ni ngo mtshar gyi chos su gyur pa mdzad do snyam du shes nas bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar du gyur lags te rmad du byung bar gyur
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni gang gis na bcom ldan 'das bzhed par mdzad pa dad gzigs par mdzad pa'i rgyu des ni ngo mtshar gyi chos su gyur pa mdzad do snyam du shes nas bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar du gyur lags te rmad du byung bar gyur
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One is wondrous, marvelous.

original: to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de'i slad du de bka' stsal du gsol zhes bya ba ste rnam pa gang gis sems can rnams la phan pa dang rjes su mthun pas bzhad par gang ston par mdzad pa de bzhin du de nyid kyi rnam pas de'i dgongs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal
analyzed: de'i slad du de bka' stsal du gsol zhes bya ba ste rnam pa gang gis sems can rnams la phan pa dang rjes su mthun pas bzhad par gang ston par mdzad pa de bzhin du de nyid kyi rnam pas de'i dgongs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal
translated: Therefore, please explain it means that in whatever way the Blessed One teaches the smile that is beneficial and agreeable to sentient beings, in just that way, by that very method, the Blessed One should explain his intention.

original: du gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: du gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: Please explain it.

original: seng ge chen po'i sgra'i sgra bsgrags pas zhes bya ba ni seng ge chen po'i sgra nyid kyis sgra sgrogs shing skad 'byin pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: seng ge chen po'i sgra'i sgra bsgrags pas zhes bya ba ni seng ge chen po'i sgra nyid kyis sgra sgrogs shing skad 'byin pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The lion's roar is the lion's own sound, the nature of which is to roar and make a noise.

original: de lta bu'i 'jigs pa med cing thogs pa med pa'i gsungs des zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'jigs pa med cing thogs pa med pa'i gsungs des zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: With that fearless, unobstructed speech, up to this point.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de nas de ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig gi 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de nas de ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig gi 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Then, and so forth.  Then means immediately after that, the Lord said is to be connected with the following words of indication.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po ni khyad par du gyur pa ste de bstan par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po ni khyad par du gyur pa ste de bstan par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The great king of tantras is the special one, that should be taught, is to be connected.

original: ye shes chen po ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Great wisdom is the wisdom of omniscience.

original: rnam par bsgyings pa ni rnam par rol pa ste sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs stobs kyis gang du dkyil 'khor sprul pa la sogs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bsgyings pa ni rnam par rol pa ste sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs stobs kyis gang du dkyil 'khor sprul pa la sogs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The display is the sport of the power of the former vows, and that is so called because of the emanation of the mandala and so forth.

original: de yang 'dir sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes kyang 'di nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes kyang 'di nyid la bya'o //
translated: And that is also called the net of illusion here.

original: rgyud thams cad ni 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa rtsa ba'i rgyud rnams so //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad ni 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa rtsa ba'i rgyud rnams so //
translated: All the tantras are the root tantras such as the Compendium of Principles and so forth.

original: de'i phyi ma ni dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i rgyud do //
analyzed: de'i phyi ma ni dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i rgyud do //
translated: The later ones are the tantras such as the Great Commitment Principles and so forth.

original: de las kyang rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di phyi ma yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de las kyang rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di phyi ma yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: And since this king of tantras is the later one of those, it is called that.

original: thabs bde zhes bya ba ni 'di las shes rab dang thabs bde ba nyid kyi thabs kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don myur du thob pa nyid ston pas so //
analyzed: thabs bde zhes bya ba ni 'di las shes rab dang thabs bde ba nyid kyi thabs kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don myur du thob pa nyid ston pas so //
translated: The easy method is the method of the easy wisdom and method, which is taught because of the swift attainment of the desired goal.

original: de bas na 'di nyid ni bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid ni bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the practice.

original: rdo rje ye shes rol pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa pha rol pa zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni sgeg pa'i gzugs so //🔽des rol cing mnyes @196a * //
analyzed: rdo rje ye shes rol pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa pha rol pa zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni sgeg pa'i gzugs so // des rol cing mnyes @196a * //
translated: The play of the vajra intuition, etc., is the form of the dance, etc.

original: par byed pa ste de nyid kyi thabs gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: par byed pa ste de nyid kyi thabs gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He plays and delights with that, and the one who has that method is so called.

original: de kho na nyid thams cad ni 'og nas bshad pa'i de kho na nyid bcu ste de rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin pas de kho na nyid thams cad kyi 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid thams cad ni 'og nas bshad pa'i de kho na nyid bcu ste de rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin pas de kho na nyid thams cad kyi 'byung gnas so //
translated: All reality is the ten realities explained below, and since it is the source of those, it is the source of all reality.

original: ci zhig mdzad nas rgyud kyi rgyal po ston par mdzad ce na ;
analyzed: ci zhig mdzad nas rgyud kyi rgyal po ston par mdzad ce na ;
translated: Having done what, does he teach the king of tantras?

original: stang stabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te stang stabs ni yan lag gi rnam par 'gyur ba tsham dam la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid can te des bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: stang stabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te stang stabs ni yan lag gi rnam par 'gyur ba tsham dam la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid can te des bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The dance, etc., are the characteristics of the arrangement of the gestures, such as the threatening gesture, etc., and the one who is victorious over the four demons by that is so called.

original: thabs dang shes rab dag ni dam tshig dang phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid du bskyed pa ste de'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba chen po'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ste de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dag ni dam tshig dang phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid du bskyed pa ste de'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba chen po'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ste de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The method and wisdom are generated as the nature of the pledge and great seal, and the great bliss of that nature is Vajrasattva and so forth.🔽Or else, here the method and wisdom are called the great bliss vajra, and the one who liberates by that is the one who acts for the welfare of migrating beings who have fallen into the three lower realms and so forth.

original: yang na 'dir thabs dang shes rab bde ba chen po'i rdo rje zhes bya ba de la de skad ces bshad de des bsgral ba ni ngan song gsum la sogs par lhung ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don mdzad pa ste de'i don rol pas bzhad pa'i rang bzhin
analyzed: yang na 'dir thabs dang shes rab bde ba chen po'i rdo rje zhes bya ba de la de skad ces bshad de des bsgral ba ni ngan song gsum la sogs par lhung ba'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don mdzad pa ste de'i don rol pas bzhad pa'i rang bzhin
translated: The one who is the nature of the smile that is the play of that meaning

original: gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang yin pa'o //
translated: is the one who has the nature of the smile that is the play of that meaning.

original: de'i rnam par bsgyings pa ni rnam par rol pa ting nge 'dzin gang gis yid la byed pa'i don 'di nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ming gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par bsgyings pa ni rnam par rol pa ting nge 'dzin gang gis yid la byed pa'i don 'di nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ming gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who is the dance of that is the one who has the name of the samadhi that is the dance, the one who goes after the meaning of the mental activity of just this.

original: de nas snyoms par zhugs pa ni thugs la mngon par mdzad pa ste sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud ston pa'i rnam pa la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas snyoms par zhugs pa ni thugs la mngon par mdzad pa ste sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud ston pa'i rnam pa la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, the “entering into union” is the manifestation in the mind, which means that he focused his mind on the aspect of teaching the Tantra of the Magical Net.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i dam tshig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyud kyi bsdus pa'i don gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po'i dam tshig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyud kyi bsdus pa'i don gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The “pledge of the great king of tantras of the Magical Net” and so forth state the summarized meaning of the tantra.

original: de dag nyid ston pa'i rgyud ngas bshad par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de ni 'di skad du bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyems par zhugs nas rgyud kyi rgyal po sgyu 'phrul dra ba de'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o
analyzed: de dag nyid ston pa'i rgyud ngas bshad par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de ni 'di skad du bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyems par zhugs nas rgyud kyi rgyal po sgyu 'phrul dra ba de'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o
translated: “ I will explain those very tantras” and so forth, which means that after entering into the meditative concentration of explaining, I will explain the mandala and so forth of that king of tantras, the Magical Net.

original: // de bas na ting nge 'dzin mchog de la snyoms par zhugs la zhes bya ba ni shin tu mnyam par gzhag par gyis la rgyud kyi rgyal po nyon cig ces de skad du gsungs so zhes nye bar sbyar te thams cad du yang dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i
analyzed: // de bas na ting nge 'dzin mchog de la snyoms par zhugs la zhes bya ba ni shin tu mnyam par gzhag par gyis la rgyud kyi rgyal po nyon cig ces de skad du gsungs so zhes nye bar sbyar te thams cad du yang dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i
translated: Therefore, “having entered into that supreme samādhi” means “having become well equipoised, listen to the king of tantras.” Thus it is stated.

original: tshul yin no //
analyzed: tshul yin no //
translated: In all cases, this is the way to listen to the holy Dharma.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: ji ltar 'og min du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa la sogs pas yongs @196b su bskor te ji skad du bshad pa'i gnas su bab pa 'di ni dang po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ste ting nge 'dzin dang po'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'og min du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa la sogs pas yongs @196b su bskor te ji skad du bshad pa'i gnas su bab pa 'di ni dang po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ste ting nge 'dzin dang po'o //
translated: Just as the perfect, complete Buddha Akṣobhya and so forth are surrounded by the retinue in Akaniṣṭha, this is called “the first application,” which is the first samādhi.

original: ye shes kyi lha'i 'khor gyis bskor ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi lha'i 'khor gyis bskor ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa'o //
translated: Surrounded by the retinue of gnosis deities is the second samādhi, called “the supreme maṇḍala.”

original: las kyi mchog ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gsum pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi mchog ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gsum pa'o //
translated: The “supreme activity” is the third samādhi.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byams pa la sogs pa bstan pa ni rgyud gzhan dag dang rjes su mthun par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byams pa la sogs pa bstan pa ni rgyud gzhan dag dang rjes su mthun par shes par bya'o //
translated: The teaching of love and so on arisen from karmic maturation should be understood to be in accordance with other tantras.

original: de ltar 'jug pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa la spyod pa rnams kyi don mdzad nas ji skad du gsungs pa'i gnas su ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis dkyil 'khor bskyed cing der mngon sum du 'jug pa la sogs pa skal pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa la spyod
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa la spyod pa rnams kyi don mdzad nas ji skad du gsungs pa'i gnas su ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis dkyil 'khor bskyed cing der mngon sum du 'jug pa la sogs pa skal pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa la spyod
translated: Thus, having benefited those who experience form and formlessness through engagement, in the place as stated, the three samadhis generate the mandala and enter it.

original: pa rnams kyang 'jug pa la sogs par bya ba'i phyir bskyed cing de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa mthong ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa'i phyir rgyud gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin te /
analyzed: pa rnams kyang 'jug pa la sogs par bya ba'i phyir bskyed cing de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa mthong ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa'i phyir rgyud gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin te /
translated: In order to engage those who enjoy the desire realm, who are fortunate to enter and so on, the tantra was taught in order to benefit those sentient beings who are fortunate to see the tathagatas and so on. This is the general meaning.

original: de dag thams cad kyang gleng slong bar byed pa'i rgyud kyi sdud pa pos rang bzo spang bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa yin la gdul bya rnams kyis kyang rtag tu gus pas mnyam pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang gleng slong bar byed pa'i rgyud kyi sdud pa pos rang bzo spang bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa yin la gdul bya rnams kyis kyang rtag tu gus pas mnyam pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The disciples should always be respectful, attentive, and so forth.

original: de la re zhig ces bya ba ni de'i 'og tu slob dpon dang ldan na 'grub par 'gyur gyi de dang bral bas bsgrub pa ni dngos grub tu mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig ces bya ba ni de'i 'og tu slob dpon dang ldan na 'grub par 'gyur gyi de dang bral bas bsgrub pa ni dngos grub tu mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Among those, first means that after that, one will be successful if one has a master, but accomplishment without that [master] will not be successful.

original: dang por zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi yon tan bshad pa brjod dgos te /
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi yon tan bshad pa brjod dgos te /
translated: The first is the explanation of the qualities of the master that must be stated.

original: 'di ltar dkyil 'khor la sogs pa gang yon tan dang ldan pa'i slob dpon la bsnyen bkur byas nas dkyil 'khor bris te gsang sngags yongs su gzung bar byas nas ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes kyi man ngag la sogs pa yang mnos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dkyil 'khor la sogs pa gang yon tan dang ldan pa'i slob dpon la bsnyen bkur byas nas dkyil 'khor bris te gsang sngags yongs su gzung bar byas nas ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes kyi man ngag la sogs pa yang mnos te /
translated: Thus, having served a master who is endowed with good qualities, such as a maṇḍala, and having drawn the maṇḍala, having taken up the mantra, and having received the esoteric instructions of samādhi and wisdom,

original: sgrub pa pos dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na tshul 'dis ni le'u'i go rims kyang bstan to //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na tshul 'dis ni le'u'i go rims kyang bstan to //
translated: Since the adept is to accomplish the powers, this method also teaches the sequence of the chapters.🔽Listen, O Essence of Wisdom!

original: ye shes snying po khyod nyon cig / ces bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje la bos pa ste des gsol ba btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes snying po khyod nyon cig / ces bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje la bos pa ste des gsol ba btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This addresses Vajrapāṇi, because he made the request.

original: brtan zhing zhes bya ba ni lus bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: brtan zhing zhes bya ba ni lus bsdams pa'o //
translated: Firm means restrained body.

original: du lab zhes bya ba ni ngag bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: du lab zhes bya ba ni ngag bsdams pa'o //
translated: Silent means restrained speech.

original: blo gros ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yid bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yid bsdams pa'o //
translated: Intelligent and so on refers to restrained mind.

original: gsang sngags rgyud kyi sbyor ba shes //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyud kyi sbyor ba shes //
translated: Knowing the application of mantra tantra.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngags dang sman dag gis bgegs byung ba bzlog par @197a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngags dang sman dag gis bgegs byung ba bzlog par @197a * //
translated: This means that through mantras and medicines one is able to avert the arising of obstacles.

original: nus pa'o // de nyid bcu ni yongs shes shing //
analyzed: nus pa'o // de nyid bcu ni yongs shes shing //
translated: Fully knowing the ten realities.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i de kho na nyid bcu shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i de kho na nyid bcu shes pa'o //
translated: This means knowing the ten realities that will be explained below.

original: theg pa che la rtag dga' ba //
analyzed: theg pa che la rtag dga' ba //
translated: Always delighting in the Great Vehicle.

original: zhes bya ba ni theg pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rigs pa'i tshul gyi sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni theg pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rigs pa'i tshul gyi sgrub pa ste /
translated: The term vehicle refers to the establishment of a system of reasoning.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The path of the Bodhisattva together with its result is the Great Vehicle.

original: de la dga' ba ni mngon par bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni mngon par bzhugs pa'o //
translated: To delight in that is to abide in it.🔽The path of the Sravakas is going,

original: nyan thos rnams kyi lam 'gro dang // zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i lam gyis 'gro ba ste thabs dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi lam 'gro dang // zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i lam gyis 'gro ba ste thabs dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the path of the Sravaka Vehicle is going, which means it is devoid of means.🔽Not knowing the Great Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po mi shes dang // zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po mi shes dang // zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par mi shes pa'o //
translated: means not knowing the nature of Mantra.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference?

original: gsang ba de nyid bsdus pa yi //
analyzed: gsang ba de nyid bsdus pa yi //
translated: The secret is collected in the Tattvasamgraha,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te don gyi sgrar ni gsang ba shes par bya ste de rnams gang du bsdus pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te don gyi sgrar ni gsang ba shes par bya ste de rnams gang du bsdus pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: means the secret should be understood as the meaning, and that in which they are collected is called that.

original: bstan bcos rnams la smod pa min //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnams la smod pa min //
translated: Not disparaging the treatises,

original: zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi tshul gyi mtshan nyid la rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi tshul gyi mtshan nyid la rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
translated: means not harming the nature of the Mantra Vehicle.

original: gong du bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i slob dpon sgrub pa pos gzung zhing mnyes par bya ba 'os pa yin no //🔽bla ma sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon la nan tan bya ba gsungs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnam pa lnga la yang rang gi rigs kyi bdag po bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ste sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam zhes bya
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i slob dpon sgrub pa pos gzung zhing mnyes par bya ba 'os pa yin no // bla ma sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon la nan tan bya ba gsungs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnam pa lnga la yang rang gi rigs kyi bdag po bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ste sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam zhes bya
translated: The phrase as taught above and so on refers to the master who is fit to be taken and propitiated by the adept who possesses the characteristics of the teacher and so on.

original: ba la sogs pa'i tshig rkang lnga ni bshad pa'o //🔽skyon rnams kyis ni dngos grub nyams //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i tshig rkang lnga ni bshad pa'o // skyon rnams kyis ni dngos grub nyams //
translated: The phrase the guru is equal to all the buddhas and so on teaches the necessity of honoring the master, and one should view the five types of families, such as the Tathagata family, as one's own family lord. The five lines beginning with equal to all the buddhas are the explanation.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir skyon bzung ba ni dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir skyon bzung ba ni dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase the accomplishments are lost due to faults means that because the faults are grasped, the accomplishments are lost.

original: rmi lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni slob dpon la smod pa shin tu yang kha na mtho ba che bar bstan te dam pa'i bdag nyid ni brnyas par byed pa dang gdug pa'i bsam pa can dag go //
analyzed: rmi lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni slob dpon la smod pa shin tu yang kha na mtho ba che bar bstan te dam pa'i bdag nyid ni brnyas par byed pa dang gdug pa'i bsam pa can dag go //
translated: By in a dream and so on, he shows that it is a very great sin to disparage the master, and that those who are of the nature of the good and those who have a malicious intention are to be avoided.

original: dad pa zhes bya ba ni gus pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dad pa zhes bya ba ni gus pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis so //
translated: By with faith he means with devotion.

original: sngags kyi tshul la sogs pa slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel pas 'jug pas na 'jug pa ste de ston pa'i gzhung gi le'u la yang 'jug pa'i rim par phye ba'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul la sogs pa slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel pas 'jug pas na 'jug pa ste de ston pa'i gzhung gi le'u la yang 'jug pa'i rim par phye ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The entry is the engagement in the master-disciple relationship and so on in the manner of mantra. The chapter of the treatise that teaches that is called the chapter on the stages of entry.

original: le'u dang po'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u dang po'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the first chapter.

original: // / slob ma dang slob dpon 'brel bar gyur na ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya dgos @197b te de bas na de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis pa dkyil 'khor gyi le'u gsungs so //
analyzed: // / slob ma dang slob dpon 'brel bar gyur na ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya dgos @197b te de bas na de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis pa dkyil 'khor gyi le'u gsungs so //
translated: Once the disciple has become connected to the master, he must enter the mandala. Therefore, the second chapter, the mandala chapter, is stated with then and so on.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu ste bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje 'chang la bka' stsal pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu ste bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje 'chang la bka' stsal pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Then, means immediately after, and the Bhagavān spoke to Vajradhara, is to be supplied.

original: ci zhig mdzad nas she na sgyu 'phrul chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sgyu 'phrul chen po'i yo shes ni lha rnams sprul pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ci zhig mdzad nas she na sgyu 'phrul chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sgyu 'phrul chen po'i yo shes ni lha rnams sprul pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Having done what? He says the great magic knowledge, etc. The great magic knowledge is the knowledge of the emanation of the deities.

original: de'i rnam par bsgyings pa ni rnam par 'phrul pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par bsgyings pa ni rnam par 'phrul pa'o //
translated: Its display is its emanation.

original: gsang ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i tshul te de dang lhan cig byin gyis brlabs shing bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gsang ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i tshul te de dang lhan cig byin gyis brlabs shing bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The secret is the method of the pledge seal. That which is empowered and generated together with that is called the mandala.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽Place the liṅga in the bhaga,

original: bha ga la ni lingga gzhag / yang dang yang du sngags bzlas shing //
analyzed: bha ga la ni lingga gzhag / yang dang yang du sngags bzlas shing //
translated: and repeat the mantra again and again.🔽The yogin should always emanate

original: dkyil 'khor dkyil 'khor 'dra bar ni //🔽rnal 'byor pa yis rtag tu spro //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dkyil 'khor 'dra bar ni //🔽rnal 'byor pa yis rtag tu spro //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: the mandala like a mandala.

original: de kho na nyid kyi gsang ba ste byin gyis brlabs pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi gsang ba ste byin gyis brlabs pas de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The secret of reality is the consecration, and it is so called because of that.

original: de nyid ni mchog gi rdo rje ste ye shes dam pa'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: de nyid ni mchog gi rdo rje ste ye shes dam pa'i gzugs can no //
translated: That is the supreme vajra, which has the form of the highest intuition.

original: de la dmigs pas na ming de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang gi yin pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pas na ming de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang gi yin pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa ste /
translated: Since it is the object of that, it is the samādhi called by that name. The one who has entered into union with it is the one who has realized it.

original: bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor 'dri ba ston pa'i rnam pa la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don te 'di ni mtshan ma thob nas dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor 'dri ba ston pa'i rnam pa la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don te 'di ni mtshan ma thob nas dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān is one-pointed in the aspect of teaching the drawing of the maṇḍala. This is the meaning. This shows that after attaining the signs, one should draw the maṇḍala.

original: gong ma'i yang gong ma zhes bya ba ni mchog tu gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i yang gong ma zhes bya ba ni mchog tu gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: The “highest of the high” is the most excellent and foremost.

original: ye shes chen po'i snying po 'bar ba rdo rje'i snying po'i 'byung gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i snying po 'bar ba rdo rje'i snying po'i 'byung gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The “blazing essence of great intuition, the source of the vajra essence”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'bar bas snying por byas pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'bar bas snying por byas pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: is so called because it is the essence made of the blazing intuition of the Tathāgata.

original: de bas na 'di nyid ni bgegs med pa'i phyir rdo rje'i snying po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid ni bgegs med pa'i phyir rdo rje'i snying po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called the vajra essence because it is free from obstacles.🔽One will become included in the number of those who are destined for Buddhahood in the Buddha-field of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sangs rgyas nyid kyi grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid du rgyud 'di nyid kyis grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sangs rgyas nyid kyi grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid du rgyud 'di nyid kyis grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one will become included in the number of those who are destined for Buddhahood by this very tantra.

original: rigs nges pa nyid du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs nges pa nyid du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one becomes definitely of the lineage.

original: rdo rje rtse mo'i rgyud las de skad du /🔽sa rnams thob kyang rgyal ba'i gzhi //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo'i rgyud las de skad du / sa rnams thob kyang rgyal ba'i gzhi //
translated: In the Vajra Peak Tantra it is said:

original: ying rton par mi 'gyur min te //
analyzed: ying rton par mi 'gyur min te //
translated: Even though one has attained the stages, one does not become a basis of the Victor🔽Because one is not confident.

original: ji srid sangs rgyas la gnas par //
analyzed: ji srid sangs rgyas la gnas par //
translated: As long as one is not confident in the Great Vehicle,

original: theg dman 'jigs pa de la yod //
analyzed: theg dman 'jigs pa de la yod //
translated: one has fear of the Lesser Vehicle.🔽But when one is well-established

original: gsang ba'i 'khor lo chen po 'dir //🔽rgyal ba'i sras po rab gnas na //🔽theg pa chen po la @198a * //
analyzed: gsang ba'i 'khor lo chen po 'dir // rgyal ba'i sras po rab gnas na // theg pa chen po la @198a * //
translated: in this great secret wheel,🔽one becomes confident

original: gzhol pas // yid rton par ni 'gyur ba yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhol pas // yid rton par ni 'gyur ba yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: because one is devoted to the Great Vehicle.

original: lha nyid kyi stang stabs su 'dug la zhes bya ba ni lha rnams kyi stang stabs su yan lag rnam par bzhag la rnal 'byor chen pos gnas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: lha nyid kyi stang stabs su 'dug la zhes bya ba ni lha rnams kyi stang stabs su yan lag rnam par bzhag la rnal 'byor chen pos gnas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Sitting in the posture of the deity means that one should sit in the posture of the deities, that is, one should arrange the limbs in the posture of the deities.

original: rdo rje'i 'gros kyis yongs su bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rkang ba'i 'og tu aa bkod pa las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje bsams la de'i tshul du byed cing yongs su bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i 'gros kyis yongs su bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rkang ba'i 'og tu aa bkod pa las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje bsams la de'i tshul du byed cing yongs su bskor bar bya'o //
translated: Circumambulating with the vajra gait means that one should imagine a variegated vajra arising from the syllable A placed under the feet, and one should do it in that way.

original: khro bo'i nga rgyal h'um sgrogs shing //
analyzed: khro bo'i nga rgyal h'um sgrogs shing //
translated: With the pride of wrath, shouting HŪṀ,

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba byas nas yi ge h'um brjod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba byas nas yi ge h'um brjod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: means that one should do it with the pride of wrathful Vajra-HŪṀ-kāra, and one should shout the syllable HŪṀ.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub rdzogs par bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa don du gnyer bas dkyil 'khor 'dri ba bkag pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub rdzogs par bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa don du gnyer bas dkyil 'khor 'dri ba bkag pa'o //
translated: For the sake of perfect enlightenment means that one should not draw the maṇḍala for the sake of gain.

original: dengs shig ces bya ba ni song shig pa'o //
analyzed: dengs shig ces bya ba ni song shig pa'o //
translated: Go away means go.

original: g-yas brkyang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: g-yas brkyang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The right leg extended and so forth.

original: gang g-yas gshol dbyibs lta bur ni //🔽g-yas kyi brla dang pus mo bsrangs //
analyzed: gang g-yas gshol dbyibs lta bur ni // g-yas kyi brla dang pus mo bsrangs //
translated: The right leg is like a plow.🔽The right thigh and knee are extended.

original: g-yon gyi byin pa brlar sbyar te //
analyzed: g-yon gyi byin pa brlar sbyar te //
translated: The left hip is joined to the thigh.

original: thad kar 'jog par byed pa dag //
analyzed: thad kar 'jog par byed pa dag //
translated: It is placed straight.

original: rgya ru mtho ldar byas pa ni //
analyzed: rgya ru mtho ldar byas pa ni //
translated: The width is made to be twenty-four finger breadths.

original: g-yas brkyang bar ni rab tu grags //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang bar ni rab tu grags //
translated: The right leg extended is well known.

original: de kho na nyid bzlog pa ni //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bzlog pa ni //
translated: The opposite of that

original: g-yon brkyang bar ni shes par bya //🔽rkang ba'i sor mo phyir bstan zhing //
analyzed: g-yon brkyang bar ni shes par bya // rkang ba'i sor mo phyir bstan zhing //
translated: is known as the left leg extended.🔽The toes of the feet are turned outward.

original: pus mo'i lha nga gnyis brkyang pa //
analyzed: pus mo'i lha nga gnyis brkyang pa //
translated: The two knees are extended.

original: rgyar ni nyi shu rtsa drug sor //
analyzed: rgyar ni nyi shu rtsa drug sor //
translated: The width is twenty-six finger breadths.

original: sa ga'i 'dug stangs yin par brjod //
analyzed: sa ga'i 'dug stangs yin par brjod //
translated: The sitting posture is called the peacock.

original: gang du pus mo gnyis 'jog pa'i //
analyzed: gang du pus mo gnyis 'jog pa'i //
translated: Where the two knees are placed,

original: nang du lag gnyis bcug nas ni //
analyzed: nang du lag gnyis bcug nas ni //
translated: the two hands are inserted inside.

original: nang pa'i gshog pa ltar byas pa //
analyzed: nang pa'i gshog pa ltar byas pa //
translated: It is made like the wings of an inner bird.

original: zlum po'i 'dug stangs yin par grags //
analyzed: zlum po'i 'dug stangs yin par grags //
translated: The circular sitting posture is well known.

original: rkang mthe ba dang ni rting pa dag //
analyzed: rkang mthe ba dang ni rting pa dag //
translated: The toes and heels

original: shin tu sbyar bas bcer ba dag / brtan pa mthun pa'i rkang thabs su //
analyzed: shin tu sbyar bas bcer ba dag / brtan pa mthun pa'i rkang thabs su //
translated: The tortoise step is very useful for those who are very flexible.

original: de nyid shes pa rnams kyis bshad //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa rnams kyis bshad //
translated: It is explained by those who know reality.

original: rus sbal gyi rkang thabs ni rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la mthe'u chung gnyis lcags sgrog gi rnam pa ltar bcings te mdzub mo gnyis rtse sbyar nas bzlog ste kha'i mdun du bzhag la rkang pa gnyis rus sbal gyi tshul du sa la 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: rus sbal gyi rkang thabs ni rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la mthe'u chung gnyis lcags sgrog gi rnam pa ltar bcings te mdzub mo gnyis rtse sbyar nas bzlog ste kha'i mdun du bzhag la rkang pa gnyis rus sbal gyi tshul du sa la 'jog pa'o //
translated: The tortoise step is as follows: Having formed the two vajra fists, one should bind the two little fingers in the form of a chain, join the tips of the two index fingers, turn them around, and place them in front of the mouth. One should place the two feet on the ground in the manner of a tortoise.

original: la la dag ni rus sbal gyi rkang stabs ni 'og nas bshad pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la dag ni rus sbal gyi rkang stabs ni 'og nas bshad pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the tortoise step is as will be explained below.

original: rdo rje brdeg pa ni g-yas brkyang ba'am g-yon brkyang ba dag gang yang rung bas gnas la rdo rje brdeg pa nas bsam gtan gyi tshul @198b gyi mthar thug pa'i bar bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje brdeg pa ni g-yas brkyang ba'am g-yon brkyang ba dag gang yang rung bas gnas la rdo rje brdeg pa nas bsam gtan gyi tshul @198b gyi mthar thug pa'i bar bcing bar bya'o //
translated: The vajra step is as follows: Having assumed either the right-extended or left-extended position, one should bind the vajra step from the beginning until the end of the meditative absorption.

original: la la dag ni g-yon dkur brten la g-yas kyis snying gar rdo rje bstod de 'jog pa ni rdo rje brdeg pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la dag ni g-yon dkur brten la g-yas kyis snying gar rdo rje bstod de 'jog pa ni rdo rje brdeg pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that placing the vajra on the heart with the right hand while resting the left hand on the hip is the vajra slap.

original: rdo rje'i 'jo tshul ni snying ga'i mdun du 'gying ba dang bcas pas rdo rje kun du bskor ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i 'jo tshul ni snying ga'i mdun du 'gying ba dang bcas pas rdo rje kun du bskor ba'o //
translated: The vajra flirt is to circle the vajra in front of the heart with a dance.

original: rkang pa ya gcig gi stang stabs ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pas rkang pa g-yas pa bteg ste brla g-yon pa la bzhag nas rkang pa gcig gis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: rkang pa ya gcig gi stang stabs ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pas rkang pa g-yas pa bteg ste brla g-yon pa la bzhag nas rkang pa gcig gis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The single-foot dance is to raise the right foot with the great seal of Vajra Humkara and place it on the left thigh, and to circle with one foot.

original: bung ba'i 'phur stabs ni lag pa gnyis kyis gar byas nas padma'i thal mo bcings la sor mo thams cad mthe bo nas rim bzhin bkrol bas phyogs thams cad du rdo rje thal mo byas pas yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: bung ba'i 'phur stabs ni lag pa gnyis kyis gar byas nas padma'i thal mo bcings la sor mo thams cad mthe bo nas rim bzhin bkrol bas phyogs thams cad du rdo rje thal mo byas pas yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The bee-flutter dance is to dance with both hands, form the lotus añjali, and release all the fingers in sequence from the thumbs.

original: la la dag ni lag pa g-yas pa dang g-yon gnyis kyis rang rang gi rkang pa'i mthe bo bzung ba sngon du 'gro bas rim bzhin du lus g-yas pa dang g-yon du bskor ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la dag ni lag pa g-yas pa dang g-yon gnyis kyis rang rang gi rkang pa'i mthe bo bzung ba sngon du 'gro bas rim bzhin du lus g-yas pa dang g-yon du bskor ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: One should first grasp the big toe of one's right foot with one's right hand and the big toe of one's left foot with one's left hand and then turn the body to the right and left.

original: seng ge'i stang stabs ni rang gi kha 'og tu bltas te gdangs la lag pa g-yon pa'i mkhrig ma'i steng du lag pa g-yas pa de bzhin du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i stang stabs ni rang gi kha 'og tu bltas te gdangs la lag pa g-yon pa'i mkhrig ma'i steng du lag pa g-yas pa de bzhin du sbyar ba'o //
translated: Some say that the lion’s posture is to hold the big toes of one’s feet with the right and left hands, respectively, and to turn the body to the right and left.

original: seng ge glal ba ni thams cad ma lus par lta ba sngon du 'gro ba las de nyid lce 'gul ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge glal ba ni thams cad ma lus par lta ba sngon du 'gro ba las de nyid lce 'gul ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The lion’s yawn is to look at everything without exception, and then to move one’s tongue in that same way.

original: rdo rje sgrog ni rang gi snying gar rdo rje bcing pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sgrog ni rang gi snying gar rdo rje bcing pa ste /
translated: The vajra fist is to bind the vajra at one’s heart.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bsdams la //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bsdams la //
translated: The two vajra fists are clenched.

original: mdzub mo bkug ste bcings nas su //
analyzed: mdzub mo bkug ste bcings nas su //
translated: The index fingers are bent and bound.

original: bskor ba'i tshul du byas pa ni //🔽lha rnams dgug pa'i dam pa'o //
analyzed: bskor ba'i tshul du byas pa ni // lha rnams dgug pa'i dam pa'o //
translated: The manner of turning

original: zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: is the best for summoning the gods.

original: rdo rje gsor ba ni rdo rje gsor ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas rdo rje gsor ba ste lag pa rdo rje'i 'og tu bskor la steng du sgeg dang bcas pas gsor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje gsor ba ni rdo rje gsor ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas rdo rje gsor ba ste lag pa rdo rje'i 'og tu bskor la steng du sgeg dang bcas pas gsor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The vajra toss is to toss the vajra while forming the mudra of tossing the vajra. The meaning is that one circles the vajra below the hand and tosses it above with a smile.

original: rdo rje'i stang stabs ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i stang stabs ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'phen pa'o //
translated: The vajra step is to throw the five-pronged vajra as explained below.

original: la la na re g-yon pa rdo rje khu tshur la mdzub mo bsgreng la sdigs mdzub tu byas nas g-yas pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la bsnun pa'i tshul byas pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: la la na re g-yon pa rdo rje khu tshur la mdzub mo bsgreng la sdigs mdzub tu byas nas g-yas pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la bsnun pa'i tshul byas pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: Some say that one should raise the index finger on the left vajra fist and make a threatening gesture, hold it with the right vajra fist, and make a stabbing motion.

original: rdo rje gar ni rdo rje'i khu tshur gnyis kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mad du gar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gar ni rdo rje'i khu tshur gnyis kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mad du gar byed pa'o //
translated: The vajra dance is to dance properly with both vajra fists.
