original: rdo rje 'jigs su rung ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgyas kha gdangs la srin lag sbyar nas mkhur ba mig gi tshul gyis 'jigs pa skyed pa ltar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs su rung ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgyas kha gdangs la srin lag sbyar nas mkhur ba mig gi tshul gyis 'jigs pa skyed pa ltar byed pa'o //
translated: The vajra terrifying is to open the mouth with the mudra of Vajrayaksha as explained below, join the ring fingers, and make a terrifying expression as if looking with the eyes.

original: rdo rje ro langs ma ni 'og nas bshad pa'i khro bo gshin rje gshed @199a * //🔽kyi phyag rgya bcings la ro za ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: rdo rje ro langs ma ni 'og nas bshad pa'i khro bo gshin rje gshed @199a * // kyi phyag rgya bcings la ro za ba'i tshul lo //
translated: Vajravetālī is the mudrā of the wrathful Yamāntaka explained below, in the form of devouring a corpse.

original: rdo rje thob ni g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis phur bu bzung ste bgegs kyi steng du bzhag la g-yas pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis thob ba bzung ste brdung ba'o //🔽sgo bzhi byin gyis brlab pa ni rdo rje skyil mo krung dang byang chub mchog gi phyag rgyar ldan pas yongs su bskor zhing shar la sogs pa phyogs bzhir sa gnon la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bcings la stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo
analyzed: rdo rje thob ni g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis phur bu bzung ste bgegs kyi steng du bzhag la g-yas pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis thob ba bzung ste brdung ba'o // sgo bzhi byin gyis brlab pa ni rdo rje skyil mo krung dang byang chub mchog gi phyag rgyar ldan pas yongs su bskor zhing shar la sogs pa phyogs bzhir sa gnon la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bcings la stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo
translated: Vajraśṛṅkhalā is holding a dagger with the left vajra fist, placing it on the obstruction, and holding a hammer with the right vajra fist.

original: bzhi bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi bsgom pa'o //
translated: The consecration of the four doors is to sit in vajra posture and the mudrā of supreme enlightenment, to completely surround the four directions such as east, to form the mudrās of earth-touching and so forth, and to meditate on the four doors of liberation such as emptiness.

original: rdo rje'i gdu bu ni 'og nas bshad pa'i bdud rtsi'i thab sbyor gyi phyag rgyas bgegs gsod pa'i tshul du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gdu bu ni 'og nas bshad pa'i bdud rtsi'i thab sbyor gyi phyag rgyas bgegs gsod pa'i tshul du byed pa'o //
translated: Vajra key is to kill obstructions with the mudrā of amṛtakuṇḍali explained below, in the form of killing obstructions.

original: bud med kyi sgyu 'phrul gyi stang stabs ni gar sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje sgeg mo'i phyag rgya bcings la mgo bo g-yon du cung zad 'dud par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bud med kyi sgyu 'phrul gyi stang stabs ni gar sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje sgeg mo'i phyag rgya bcings la mgo bo g-yon du cung zad 'dud par byas pa'o //
translated: The dance of the illusion of women is preceded by the dance, and so one binds the gesture of Vajra Lāsya and slightly bows one's head to the left.

original: rdo rje dral ba ni lag pa g-yon pa na gnas pa'i khro bo'i rdo rje'i nang na 'dug pa thams cad bsams la lag pa g-yas par gnas pa'i khro bo'i rdo rjes bsnun pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dral ba ni lag pa g-yon pa na gnas pa'i khro bo'i rdo rje'i nang na 'dug pa thams cad bsams la lag pa g-yas par gnas pa'i khro bo'i rdo rjes bsnun pa'o //
translated: The Vajra-slicing is as follows: imagining all [beings] within the wrathful vajra located in the left hand, one strikes with the wrathful vajra located in the right hand.

original: rdo rje stobs po che'i brdeg pa ni 'og nas bshad pa'i stobs po che'i brdeg pas gdug pa rnams skrag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje stobs po che'i brdeg pa ni 'og nas bshad pa'i stobs po che'i brdeg pas gdug pa rnams skrag par byed pa'o //
translated: The Vajra-Mahābala-trampling is as follows: the evildoers are frightened by the trampling of Mahābala explained below.

original: rdo rje mche ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i phyag rgya dang ldan pas ji lta ba bzhin du gdug pa thams cad za ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mche ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i phyag rgya dang ldan pas ji lta ba bzhin du gdug pa thams cad za ba'o //
translated: The Vajra-fanged is as follows: just as it is, all evildoers are eaten by the one endowed with the gesture of Kāmarāja explained below.

original: rdo rje'i gad mo ni ha ha zhes dgod pa'i tshul gyis yi ge ha bzhi brjod pa'i rjes thogs la stang stabs byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gad mo ni ha ha zhes dgod pa'i tshul gyis yi ge ha bzhi brjod pa'i rjes thogs la stang stabs byed pa'o //
translated: The Vajra-laughter is as follows: one performs the dance immediately after uttering the four syllables ha ha in the manner of laughing.

original: rdo rje'i sgra ni g-yon pa khro ba'i khu tshur gyi mdzub mo snying gar bsgreng la g-yas pa'i khu tshur gyis g-yas pa'i rna drung du dril bu 'khrol ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sgra ni g-yon pa khro ba'i khu tshur gyi mdzub mo snying gar bsgreng la g-yas pa'i khu tshur gyis g-yas pa'i rna drung du dril bu 'khrol ba'o //
translated: The vajra sound is to raise the index finger of the left wrathful fist to the heart and to ring the bell with the right fist near the right ear.

original: ral gri'i stabs ni 'og nas bshad pa'i mi g-yo ba'i phyag rgyas bgegs rnams ji lta ba bzhin du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: ral gri'i stabs ni 'og nas bshad pa'i mi g-yo ba'i phyag rgyas bgegs rnams ji lta ba bzhin du gcod pa'o //
translated: The sword method is to cut the obstructors as before with the Akshobhya mudra explained below.

original: rdo rje'i stabs ni g-yon pa'i khro bo'i khu tshur las mdzub mo bsgreng la lag pa g-yas pa ba dan gsum par byas pas rdo rje gsor ba'i tshul du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i stabs ni g-yon pa'i khro bo'i khu tshur las mdzub mo bsgreng la lag pa g-yas pa ba dan gsum par byas pas rdo rje gsor ba'i tshul du byed pa'o //
translated: The vajra method is to raise the index finger from the left wrathful fist and to make the right hand into a three-pointed banner and to make the gesture of throwing a vajra.

original: 'khor lo'i stabs ni 'og nas bshad pa'i 'khor lo 'phang ba'i phyag rgyas 'phen ba'o //🔽gtun shing gi thabs ni rdo rje bcings pas bzung ba'i gtun shing gis bgegs rnams brdung ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i stabs ni 'og nas bshad pa'i 'khor lo 'phang ba'i phyag rgyas 'phen ba'o // gtun shing gi thabs ni rdo rje bcings pas bzung ba'i gtun shing gis bgegs rnams brdung ba'o //
translated: The wheel method is to throw with the wheel-throwing mudra explained below.🔽The pestle method is to beat the obstructors with a pestle held with the vajra fist.

original: zhags pa'i thabs ni de bzhin du rdo rje zhags pa'i phyag rgyas gzhug pa'i thabs su byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhags pa'i thabs ni de bzhin du rdo rje zhags pa'i phyag rgyas gzhug pa'i thabs su byas pa'o //
translated: The noose method is to make a hook with the vajra noose mudra in the same way.

original: padma'i tshul ni 'og nas bshad pa'i padma'i @199b stang stabs kyi tshul du byed pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i tshul ni 'og nas bshad pa'i padma'i @199b stang stabs kyi tshul du byed pa'o //
translated: The lotus posture is the posture of the lotus dance explained below.

original: be con gyi thabs ni de bzhin du dbyig sngon gyi phyag rkyas mdzub mo bsgreng ba'o //
analyzed: be con gyi thabs ni de bzhin du dbyig sngon gyi phyag rkyas mdzub mo bsgreng ba'o //
translated: The club method is the same as the blue vajra fist with the index finger extended.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i tshul ni don yong bar grub pa'i phyag rgya ji lta ba bzhin du bcing ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i tshul ni don yong bar grub pa'i phyag rgya ji lta ba bzhin du bcing ba'o //
translated: The fearless posture is binding the mudra of Amoghasiddhi as it is.

original: lcags kyu'i thabs ni 'og nas bshad pa'i lcags kyu'i phyag rgyas dgug pa'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu'i thabs ni 'og nas bshad pa'i lcags kyu'i phyag rgyas dgug pa'o //
translated: The hook method is summoning with the hook mudra explained below.

original: gshol gyi thabs ni g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung ba'i gshol gyis sa 'dra la zhing g-yas pas kyang rab tu bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gshol gyi thabs ni g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung ba'i gshol gyis sa 'dra la zhing g-yas pas kyang rab tu bzlog pa'o //
translated: The plow method is plowing the earth with a plow held by the left vajra fist, and also turning it over with the right.

original: mdung gi thabs ni rdo rje khu tshur gyis mdung 'phel pa'o //
analyzed: mdung gi thabs ni rdo rje khu tshur gyis mdung 'phel pa'o //
translated: The spear method is throwing a spear with the vajra fist.

original: gzhu'i thabs ni lag pa g-yon pas gzhu bzung la g-yas pas rna ba'i bar du gzhu rgyud drangs nas 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhu'i thabs ni lag pa g-yon pas gzhu bzung la g-yas pas rna ba'i bar du gzhu rgyud drangs nas 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: The bow method is holding a bow with the left hand and drawing the bowstring up to the ear with the right.

original: mda' gzung ba'i thabs ni g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis gzhu bzung ba ji lta ba bzhin du gar byed pa sngon du 'gro bas lte bar gan rkyal du bzhag la /
analyzed: mda' gzung ba'i thabs ni g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis gzhu bzung ba ji lta ba bzhin du gar byed pa sngon du 'gro bas lte bar gan rkyal du bzhag la /
translated: The method of holding the arrow is that, having first danced as if holding a bow with the left vajra fist, one places it on one's lap.

original: g-yas pa'i mthe bo dang mdzub mo gnyis kyi bar du mda' gsor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i mthe bo dang mdzub mo gnyis kyi bar du mda' gsor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Then, between the right thumb and forefinger, one draws the arrow.

original: mda' 'phang ba'i thabs ni de bzhin du mda' 'phen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mda' 'phang ba'i thabs ni de bzhin du mda' 'phen par byed pa'o //
translated: The method of shooting the arrow is to shoot the arrow in that way.

original: thag mdung bskor ba'i thabs ni g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyi mdzub mo bsgreng la g-yas pa'i khu tshur gyis thag mdung yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: thag mdung bskor ba'i thabs ni g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyi mdzub mo bsgreng la g-yas pa'i khu tshur gyis thag mdung yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The method of whirling the lasso is to extend the forefinger of the left fist and to whirl the lasso with the right fist.

original: mchog sbyin pa'i tshul ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag rgya bcing pa'o //
analyzed: mchog sbyin pa'i tshul ni 'og nas bshad pa'i rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag rgya bcing pa'o //
translated: The method of bestowing gifts is to bind the Ratnasaṃbhava mudra explained below.

original: mdung thung gi thabs ni g-yon pa rdo rje khu tshur las snying gar mdzub mo bsgreng la lag pa g-yas pas gsor ba sngon du 'gro bas mdung thung rab tu 'phen pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: mdung thung gi thabs ni g-yon pa rdo rje khu tshur las snying gar mdzub mo bsgreng la lag pa g-yas pas gsor ba sngon du 'gro bas mdung thung rab tu 'phen pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The method of the short spear is to extend the forefinger from the left vajra fist to the heart, and to shoot with the right hand, in the manner of throwing a short spear.

original: mtshon rtse gcig pa'i thabs ni de bzhin du mtshon rtse gcig 'phen pa'i tshul du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon rtse gcig pa'i thabs ni de bzhin du mtshon rtse gcig 'phen pa'i tshul du byed pa'o //
translated: The method of the single-pointed weapon is like shooting a single-pointed weapon.

original: phyag 'tshal ba'i tshul ni stod par byed pa'i tshul gyis lag pa thal mo sbyar nas snying gar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba'i tshul ni stod par byed pa'i tshul gyis lag pa thal mo sbyar nas snying gar 'jog pa'o //
translated: The method of homage is placing one's palms together at the heart in the manner of paying respect.

original: rdo rje'i 'dug stangs kyi tshul ni 'og nas bshad pa'i mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya bcing ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i 'dug stangs kyi tshul ni 'og nas bshad pa'i mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya bcing ba'o //
translated: The method of the vajra posture is binding the Akṣobhya mudrā explained below.

original: bsam gtan gyi tshul ni 'og nas bshad pa'i 'od dpag med pa'i phyag rgya bcing pa ste rus sbal gyi rkang stabs nas bsam gtan gyi tshul gyi mthar thug pa la g-yas brgyad pa dang g-yon brkyang ba dag bcing bar bya'o zhes gzhan dag 'dod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi tshul ni 'og nas bshad pa'i 'od dpag med pa'i phyag rgya bcing pa ste rus sbal gyi rkang stabs nas bsam gtan gyi tshul gyi mthar thug pa la g-yas brgyad pa dang g-yon brkyang ba dag bcing bar bya'o zhes gzhan dag 'dod do //
translated: The method of meditation is binding the Amitābha mudrā explained below. Others assert that from the tortoise step up to the method of meditation, the right leg is extended and the left leg is contracted.

original: rdo rje'i skyil mo krung ni g-yas pa'i byin pa dang brla'i bar du rkang pa g-yon pa ji lta ba bzhin du bcug ste /🔽de'i steng du rkang ba g-yas @200a * //
analyzed: rdo rje'i skyil mo krung ni g-yas pa'i byin pa dang brla'i bar du rkang pa g-yon pa ji lta ba bzhin du bcug ste / de'i steng du rkang ba g-yas @200a * //
translated: The vajra cross-legged posture is placing the left leg between the right thigh and calf as before,🔽and placing the right leg

original: pa bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: pa bzhag pa'o //
translated: on top of that.

original: padma'i 'dug stangs ni da bzhin du rkang pa g-yon pa phab ste 'og tu 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i 'dug stangs ni da bzhin du rkang pa g-yon pa phab ste 'og tu 'jog pa'o //
translated: The lotus posture is like that, except that the left foot is placed below and rests on the ground.

original: sems dpa'i skyil mo krung ni de bzhin du cung zad tsam gyis rkang pa g-yas pa brla g-yon pa'i steng du gzhag pa'o //🔽dpa' bo'i 'dug stangs ni rkang pa g-yon pas skyil mo krung phyed du bcas la /
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil mo krung ni de bzhin du cung zad tsam gyis rkang pa g-yas pa brla g-yon pa'i steng du gzhag pa'o // dpa' bo'i 'dug stangs ni rkang pa g-yon pas skyil mo krung phyed du bcas la /
translated: The bodhisattva posture is like that, except that the right foot is placed on the left thigh, with the sole of the foot facing up.

original: de'i drung du rkang pa g-yas pa drang por gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i drung du rkang pa g-yas pa drang por gzhag pa'o //
translated: The hero posture is to sit in half lotus posture with the left foot, and place the right foot straight out in front of it.

original: bzang po'i 'dug stangs ni rkang pa gnyis ka stan gyi steng nas drang por thur du brkyang nas 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po'i 'dug stangs ni rkang pa gnyis ka stan gyi steng nas drang por thur du brkyang nas 'jog pa'o //
translated: The good posture is to sit with both feet straight down on the ground from a seated position.

original: tsog bu'i 'dug stangs ni rkang pa gnyis kyi bar mtho gang gis mchod pa stan gyi steng du bzhag pa tsog tsog por 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: tsog bu'i 'dug stangs ni rkang pa gnyis kyi bar mtho gang gis mchod pa stan gyi steng du bzhag pa tsog tsog por 'dug pa'o //
translated: The squatting posture is to sit with the knees and buttocks touching the ground, and the two feet placed on the ground about a cubit apart.

original: rol pa'i stang stabs ni rkang pa g-yas pa sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du byas la g-yon pa 'og tu 'gying bag tu brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: rol pa'i stang stabs ni rkang pa g-yas pa sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du byas la g-yon pa 'og tu 'gying bag tu brkyang ba'o //
translated: The dancing posture is to sit in bodhisattva posture with the right foot, and place the left foot in a graceful manner below it.

original: mdun du bsnun pa dang phyir 'gyel ba ni rdo rje khu tshur gnyis mdun dang rgyab tu bltas la de nyid kyis mdun du phyogs pa dang phyir blta ba'o //
analyzed: mdun du bsnun pa dang phyir 'gyel ba ni rdo rje khu tshur gnyis mdun dang rgyab tu bltas la de nyid kyis mdun du phyogs pa dang phyir blta ba'o //
translated: The forward thrust and the backward fall are the two vajra fists looking forward and backward, and with that very [fist] one thrusts forward and falls backward.

original: rdo rje skyil mo krung la sogs pa stang stabs dgu bcing ba'i dus su ni ji lta ba bzhin du rdo rje brdeg pa bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil mo krung la sogs pa stang stabs dgu bcing ba'i dus su ni ji lta ba bzhin du rdo rje brdeg pa bya'o //
translated: When binding the nine mudras such as the vajra cross-legged posture, one should strike with the vajra as appropriate.

original: mthun pa'i rkang stabs kyis gnas pas 'dug la thal mo spyi bor sbyar te gnas nas shar phyogs su kha bltas te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i rkang stabs kyis gnas pas 'dug la thal mo spyi bor sbyar te gnas nas shar phyogs su kha bltas te /
translated: Dwelling in the proper stance, one should join the palms above the head and dwell there, facing east.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la sri zhu dad bcas shing rnam par rol pa'i gar gyi mchog rdo rje'i stang stabs dang sbyar bas sngags pas phyag byas nas snga ma'i thal mo snying gar pha ba ste padma'i sbyor bas phyogs thams cad du bskor nas khu tshur bcings
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la sri zhu dad bcas shing rnam par rol pa'i gar gyi mchog rdo rje'i stang stabs dang sbyar bas sngags pas phyag byas nas snga ma'i thal mo snying gar pha ba ste padma'i sbyor bas phyogs thams cad du bskor nas khu tshur bcings
translated: With devotion and faith in the Tathagatas, the mantrin should pay homage with the supreme dance play of the Tathagatas, applied with the vajra dance steps, and having joined the palms as before at the heart with the lotus gesture, one should turn in all directions and make a fist.

original: la phyag 'tshal ba dang bcas pa'i rdo rje ldang ba'i phyag rgya bcing bar byas nas khro bo'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas sngags zlos shing stang stabs re re zhing gar sngon du 'gro bas ji skad du bshad pa'i stang stabs bcings te /🔽de las byung ba'i rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i khro bo rnams kyis bgegs rnams gzhom pa la sogs pa dang por byas nas sa gzhi rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs la snga ma bzhin du gar byas te /
analyzed: la phyag 'tshal ba dang bcas pa'i rdo rje ldang ba'i phyag rgya bcing bar byas nas khro bo'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas sngags zlos shing stang stabs re re zhing gar sngon du 'gro bas ji skad du bshad pa'i stang stabs bcings te / de las byung ba'i rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i khro bo rnams kyis bgegs rnams gzhom pa la sogs pa dang por byas nas sa gzhi rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs la snga ma bzhin du gar byas te /
translated: Having made the mudra of rising with the vajra, together with prostrations, and endowed with the pride of wrath, one should recite the mantra, and with each step, having gone in front of the dance, bind the steps as they are explained.

original: rked pa g-yon pa ji lta ba bzhin bzur la stang stabs rnams bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rked pa g-yon pa ji lta ba bzhin bzur la stang stabs rnams bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Having first conquered the obstructors with the wrathful ones such as Vajra Humkara arisen from that, and so on, one should bless the ground as having the nature of vajra, and having danced as before, one should gather the steps, having turned to the left as before.

original: phur bus gnas lngar bcing ba dang // zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su dang shar lho la sogs pa'i mtshams bzhir ro //
analyzed: phur bus gnas lngar bcing ba dang // zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su dang shar lho la sogs pa'i mtshams bzhir ro //
translated: Binding the dagger in the five places means in the center of the mandala and in the four directions beginning with the southeast.

original: dra ba dang ra bas mtshams bcing ba dang zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor @200b mngon par 'dod pa'i sa'i cha kun nas rdo rje rab tu 'bar bas bar mtshams med par khyab par bdag gir byas pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: dra ba dang ra bas mtshams bcing ba dang zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor @200b mngon par 'dod pa'i sa'i cha kun nas rdo rje rab tu 'bar bas bar mtshams med par khyab par bdag gir byas pa'i tshul lo //
translated: “The enclosure and the boundary are the binding” means that the area of the ground that one desires for the maṇḍala is completely taken possession of by the vajra blazing in all directions without any gaps.

original: phyogs bcing ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du phyogs bcur khyab cing sa'i cha rnams bdag gir bya ba ste ra ba'i rtsa ba'i rdo rje rnam par byas pa ni dkyil 'khor bcing ba yang yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcing ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du phyogs bcur khyab cing sa'i cha rnams bdag gir bya ba ste ra ba'i rtsa ba'i rdo rje rnam par byas pa ni dkyil 'khor bcing ba yang yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: “The binding of the directions” means that, as before, one pervades the ten directions and takes possession of the areas of the ground. One should understand that the vajra foundation of the boundary is also the binding of the maṇḍala.

original: bsgoms te zhes bya ba ni bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms te zhes bya ba ni bsams pa'o //
translated: “Having meditated” means having imagined.

original: gtan la dbab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'di nyid du sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gtan la dbab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'di nyid du sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: “One should determine” means that one should generate the mind in this way.

original: rang gi ming nas smos te zhes bya ba ni rang gi rdo rje'i ming gi yi ge h'um dang spel ba'i sgra ni 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi stang stabs kyi dus su sngags yin lag gsang sngags 'di nyid ni 'khor lo thams cad kyi bla na med par 'gyur🔽bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ming nas smos te zhes bya ba ni rang gi rdo rje'i ming gi yi ge h'um dang spel ba'i sgra ni 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi stang stabs kyi dus su sngags yin lag gsang sngags 'di nyid ni 'khor lo thams cad kyi bla na med par 'gyur bar grags pa'o //
translated: Reciting one's own name means that the sound of one's own vajra name, combined with the syllable hūṃ, is the mantra at the time of the mandala dance. This very mantra is renowned as being the unsurpassed of all wheels.

original: 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo la gnas pa'i lha ma lus ba rnams la dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi bzhugs gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo la gnas pa'i lha ma lus ba rnams la dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi bzhugs gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: Wheel means that all the deities residing in the wheel are the abode of the deities of the mandala.

original: 'khor lo ni rang gi gnas yin par shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni rang gi gnas yin par shes bar bya'o //
translated: The wheel should be understood as one's own abode.

original: mtha' kun du yang zhes bya ba ni mtha' thog thag tu'o //
analyzed: mtha' kun du yang zhes bya ba ni mtha' thog thag tu'o //
translated: Everywhere means all around.

original: mtshams nas smos te zhes bya ba ni sngags gdon pas so //
analyzed: mtshams nas smos te zhes bya ba ni sngags gdon pas so //
translated: In the directions means by reciting the mantra.

original: spyan drang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams spyan drangs la ji lta ba bzhin du rgyas btab ste mchod pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: spyan drang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams spyan drangs la ji lta ba bzhin du rgyas btab ste mchod pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Inviting and so forth means that one should invite the mandala deities, seal them as they are, and perform offerings and so forth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob ma lhag par gnas par byas la chos kyang bstan par bya zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob ma lhag par gnas par byas la chos kyang bstan par bya zhes 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Having consecrated the disciples, one should also teach the Dharma, as is connected below.

original: ji ltar sta gon du gnas par bya zhe na sbos chus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar sta gon du gnas par bya zhe na sbos chus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: How should one consecrate?

original: sbos chus bsangs te lag pa g-yas pas spyi bo dang snying gar gtug pa byas nas snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar ba dang / spyi bor thams cad byed pa sna tshogs rdo rje bsams nas dpung ba g-yon pa srung skud kyis bcing bar byas la /
analyzed: sbos chus bsangs te lag pa g-yas pas spyi bo dang snying gar gtug pa byas nas snying gar rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar ba dang / spyi bor thams cad byed pa sna tshogs rdo rje bsams nas dpung ba g-yon pa srung skud kyis bcing bar byas la /
translated: Having sprinkled with water from the waterpot, having touched the crown and the heart with the right hand, having visualized a blazing five-pronged vajra at the heart and a crossed vajra at the crown, having bound the left arm with the protection thread,

original: lag pa g-yas par so shing dang ku sha ji lta ba bzhin du byin te 'dug pa la gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa 'dzin du gzhug go //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas par so shing dang ku sha ji lta ba bzhin du byin te 'dug pa la gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa 'dzin du gzhug go //
translated: having given the tooth stick and kuśa grass to the right hand, having made them sit, one should make them take the refuge in the Three Jewels, etc.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis gzung //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub yid kyis gzung //
translated: One should hold the mind on the enlightenment of the Buddha.

original: zhes bstan pa 'dis ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin la des na bdag dbul bar byas pa yin pas logs shig tu ma gsungs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa 'dis ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin la des na bdag dbul bar byas pa yin pas logs shig tu ma gsungs par shes par bya ste /
translated: This teaching is the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment, and since thereby one becomes poor, it should be understood that it is not mentioned separately.

original: gang gis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa des ni thams cad yongs su btang ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir @201a * //
analyzed: gang gis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa des ni thams cad yongs su btang ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir @201a * //
translated: For it is said, By whomsoever the Thought of Enlightenment is generated, by him all is given up.

original: ro // ci nus kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lam mchog 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa zab cing rgya che ba'i chos bzang po ci nus pa dang ci 'dod pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ro // ci nus kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lam mchog 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa zab cing rgya che ba'i chos bzang po ci nus pa dang ci 'dod pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: As much as one can, etc. means that one should explain as much as one can, as much as one wishes, the good Dharma which is profound and vast, beginning with This is the supreme path, etc.

original: sngar bstan pa'i bya bas slar gshegs su gsol zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las bstan pa'i slar yang gshegs su gsol ba'i sbyor bas slar gshegs su gsol lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i bya bas slar gshegs su gsol zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud las bstan pa'i slar yang gshegs su gsol ba'i sbyor bas slar gshegs su gsol lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The request to depart by the previously taught procedure means that one requests the departure by the procedure taught in the Root Tantra for requesting the departure.

original: slar gshegs su gsol ba 'di ni bsnyen pa'i zhag dang dkyil 'khor nye bar sdud pa'i 'dus su yang bya'o //
analyzed: slar gshegs su gsol ba 'di ni bsnyen pa'i zhag dang dkyil 'khor nye bar sdud pa'i 'dus su yang bya'o //
translated: This request to depart is also to be made at the end of the preparatory day and at the end of the mandala ritual.

original: mchod pa la sogs pa ni mchod pa'i chog 'og nas bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas bya zhing rjes su mnyes pa legs par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa ni mchod pa'i chog 'og nas bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas bya zhing rjes su mnyes pa legs par bya'o //
translated: The offerings and so forth should be done with the characteristics of the offering rite explained below, and the pleasing should be done well.

original: 'di la don la la ni 'di nyid nas dngos su gsal bar bstan la /
analyzed: 'di la don la la ni 'di nyid nas dngos su gsal bar bstan la /
translated: Here, some of the meanings are clearly taught in this very [Vairocanābhisambodhi Tantra],

original: la la ni don gyi dbang gis gzhan las 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don 'ga' zhig kyang yod de man ngag ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du gzhung bsrangs te chog thams cad kyis dkyil 'khor bri ba la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: la la ni don gyi dbang gis gzhan las 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don 'ga' zhig kyang yod de man ngag ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du gzhung bsrangs te chog thams cad kyis dkyil 'khor bri ba la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and some are to be applied from elsewhere by the power of the meaning. As taught by the instructions, one should arrange the text and apply it to all the rites for drawing the maṇḍala.

original: des na rgyud la ma tshang ba dang lhag pa yod du zin kyang som ma nyi mi bya ste don gyi dbang gis ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na rgyud la ma tshang ba dang lhag pa yod du zin kyang som ma nyi mi bya ste don gyi dbang gis ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even if there are omissions and additions in the tantra, one should not be doubtful, but should apply them as appropriate by the power of the meaning.

original: 'di'i dkyil 'khor gyi chog rgyas pa ni logs na yod pas skabs 'dir tshig gi don nyid tsam las ma bris so //
analyzed: 'di'i dkyil 'khor gyi chog rgyas pa ni logs na yod pas skabs 'dir tshig gi don nyid tsam las ma bris so //
translated: Since the extensive maṇḍala rite of this [Vairocanābhisambodhi Tantra] exists elsewhere, in this context I have not written more than just the meaning of the words.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhir glo g-yas pas nyal te zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i mthar slob ma'i mchog la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu mnyam par gzhag pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyis nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhir glo g-yas pas nyal te zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i mthar slob ma'i mchog la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu mnyam par gzhag pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyis nyal bar bya'o //
translated: Lying down on the mandala base on the right side means that the disciple, together with the best of the disciples, should lie down on the edge of the mandala base with a mind endowed with meditative concentration.

original: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for dreams and so forth,

original: rmi lam sangs rgyas mthong ba ni //
analyzed: rmi lam sangs rgyas mthong ba ni //
translated: Seeing a buddha in a dream

original: yon tan rgya mtsho mngon sum bzhin //
analyzed: yon tan rgya mtsho mngon sum bzhin //
translated: is like directly seeing an ocean of good qualities.

original: mchod rten dang ni sku gzugs dang // de la mchod pa rtsom pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rmi lam bzang po'o //
analyzed: mchod rten dang ni sku gzugs dang // de la mchod pa rtsom pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rmi lam bzang po'o //
translated: Commencing offerings to stupas and images, and so forth, are good dreams.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rmi lam ngan pa ste de mthong ba ni de la zhi bar byed pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rmi lam ngan pa ste de mthong ba ni de la zhi bar byed pa shes par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that are bad dreams, and seeing them is to be understood as pacifying them.

original: nyi ma gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni sta gon la gnas pa'i zhag la ltos pa ste sa yongs su gzung ba las ltos na ni /
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni sta gon la gnas pa'i zhag la ltos pa ste sa yongs su gzung ba las ltos na ni /
translated: The second day is in relation to the day of the preparatory rite, but in relation to the day of taking possession of the ground,

original: nub gsum pa ni 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: nub gsum pa ni 'jug pa yin //
translated: it is the third evening that is the entry.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated.

original: tshon dang thig la sangs rgyas lnga'i //
analyzed: tshon dang thig la sangs rgyas lnga'i //
translated: The colors and lines are the five Buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lngar sngags dang phyag rgyas bsgom zhing lhag pa'i bsam pas sprul nas @201b bskyed pa'i tshon dang thig gi bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lngar sngags dang phyag rgyas bsgom zhing lhag pa'i bsam pas sprul nas @201b bskyed pa'i tshon dang thig gi bya ba'o //
translated: In this and other passages, one should visualize the five Tathagatas, Vairocana and so forth, with mantras and seals, and having emanated them with a superior intention, one should perform the actions of the colors and lines.

original: 'di ni chos dbyings dag pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni chos dbyings dag pa ste //
translated: This is the pure realm of phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lhag par mos pa'i tshul 'di ni tshon ser po'i yin te lhag pa rnams la yang rim pa 'dis rang dang rjes su mthun pa lhag par mos par bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lhag par mos pa'i tshul 'di ni tshon ser po'i yin te lhag pa rnams la yang rim pa 'dis rang dang rjes su mthun pa lhag par mos par bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: In this and other passages, this method of superior intention is for the yellow color, and one should understand that for the remaining ones, one should have a superior intention in accordance with oneself by this sequence.

original: kun du zhes bya ba ni dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te g-yas su bskor ba'i rim gyis so //
analyzed: kun du zhes bya ba ni dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te g-yas su bskor ba'i rim gyis so //
translated: All around means beginning from the northeast direction and in the clockwise sequence.

original: dang po sa gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa mdor bsdus pa'i dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor la nges pa 'di yin par bstan gyi thams cad kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po sa gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa mdor bsdus pa'i dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor la nges pa 'di yin par bstan gyi thams cad kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: The first, the ground, and so forth, this is taught as the certainty of the empowerment mandala of the concise accomplishment, but not for all.

original: gzhan dag nas zla ba nya nas phyi ma'i zla ba'i nya'i bar du bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi las rgya cher ston pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na / khru lnga 'am khru do ba //
analyzed: gzhan dag nas zla ba nya nas phyi ma'i zla ba'i nya'i bar du bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi las rgya cher ston pa'i phyir ro // yang na / khru lnga 'am khru do ba //
translated: And in other tantras, from the full moon to the full moon, and so on, it is taught extensively in the tantras that the mandala should be made.🔽Again, five cubits, five cubits, and so on, and one cubit, and so on, are said to be the size of the mandala made five cubits, and so on.

original: khru gang ba yi zhes bya ba ni khru lnga la sogs pa'i tshad du byas pa'i dkyil 'khor la de skad ces gsungs pa ni phyogs tsam ste grangs med pa'i grangs la 'jug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khru gang ba yi zhes bya ba ni khru lnga la sogs pa'i tshad du byas pa'i dkyil 'khor la de skad ces gsungs pa ni phyogs tsam ste grangs med pa'i grangs la 'jug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is just an indication, and one should enter into the countless enumerations.

original: bar du'o zhes bya ba ni brgyad cu dang lnga bcu la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar du'o zhes bya ba ni brgyad cu dang lnga bcu la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: In between refers to eighty, fifty, and so on.

original: gru bzhi pa la zhes bya ba la phyogs bzhi'i thig gis mnyam par byas pa'o //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa la zhes bya ba la phyogs bzhi'i thig gis mnyam par byas pa'o //
translated: In the square, the four directions are made equal with a line.

original: rdo rje'i shugs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la aom badzra be ga kra ma h'um zhes bya ba brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i shugs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la aom badzra be ga kra ma h'um zhes bya ba brjod pa ste /
translated: With the speed of the vajra, and so on, means reciting Oṃ vajra-speed-up, speed-up!

original: 'jug pa 'am ni 'byung ba na ;
analyzed: 'jug pa 'am ni 'byung ba na ;
translated: Whether entering or emerging,

original: / srad bu yid kyis bteg pa ni //
analyzed: / srad bu yid kyis bteg pa ni //
translated: the thread is lifted with the mind.

original: rdo rje shugs zhes grags pa ste //
analyzed: rdo rje shugs zhes grags pa ste //
translated: The one known as Vajra Speed,

original: de nas ri mo bgom par bya //
analyzed: de nas ri mo bgom par bya //
translated: then one should draw the picture.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i lha'i nga rgyal gyi rol pas bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i lha'i nga rgyal gyi rol pas bya ba'o //
translated: This is the performance with the pride of the deity as stated.

original: grva rnams su ni zhes bya ba ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams su'o //
analyzed: grva rnams su ni zhes bya ba ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams su'o //
translated: In the corners means in the intermediate directions of the outer maṇḍala.

original: sgo'i nang logs zhes bya ba ni sgo khyud kyi mtshams rnams su'o //
analyzed: sgo'i nang logs zhes bya ba ni sgo khyud kyi mtshams rnams su'o //
translated: In the inner side of the gates means in the intermediate directions of the gate enclosures.

original: dkar pos bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad ces gsungs mod kyi 'on kyang tshon gyi rim pa ni ser po dang dkar po dang sngon po'am sngon po dang dkar po dang ser po yin no //
analyzed: dkar pos bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad ces gsungs mod kyi 'on kyang tshon gyi rim pa ni ser po dang dkar po dang sngon po'am sngon po dang dkar po dang ser po yin no //
translated: With white, etc. , although it is stated thus, nevertheless the sequence of colors is yellow, white, and blue, or blue, white, and yellow.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyed du'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyed du'o //
translated: Then, etc. , in half of the root maṇḍala.

original: de la mngon du phyogs par khru dos chod par dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor tshon dkar po gcig pu 'am tshon sna lngas bris te de'i dbus su dkar po 'am tshon sna lngas de'i phyed kyi tshad las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bya'o //
analyzed: de la mngon du phyogs par khru dos chod par dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor tshon dkar po gcig pu 'am tshon sna lngas bris te de'i dbus su dkar po 'am tshon sna lngas de'i phyed kyi tshad las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bya'o //
translated: In that, one should draw a mandala with white powder or with the five powders, the size of which is determined by the measure of the cubit, and in the center of that, one should draw an eight-petaled lotus with white or with the five powders, the size of which is half the measure of the mandala.

original: rin chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rin po che ni byi ru dang / gser dang dngul dang mu tig dang nor bur grags @202a * //
analyzed: rin chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rin po che ni byi ru dang / gser dang dngul dang mu tig dang nor bur grags @202a * //
translated: As for jewels and so forth, jewels are coral, gold, silver, pearls, and gems.

original: ba'o // sman ni bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri dang / sa ha dang / danda autpala dang / shve ha aa par dzi ta zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba'o // sman ni bri ha ti dang / kanda ka ri dang / sa ha dang / danda autpala dang / shve ha aa par dzi ta zhes bya'o //
translated: Medicines are called bhrngaraja, kanakaraja, saha, danaudumbara, and svestaparajita.

original: 'bru ni 'bras dang nas gro dang til dang ma sha'o //
analyzed: 'bru ni 'bras dang nas gro dang til dang ma sha'o //
translated: Grains are rice, barley, wheat, sesame, and beans.

original: spos chu ni tsandan dkar po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i chu ste de spos kyis yongs su bdugs pa'o //
analyzed: spos chu ni tsandan dkar po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i chu ste de spos kyis yongs su bdugs pa'o //
translated: Perfumed water is water endowed with white sandalwood and so forth, and that is perfumed with incense.

original: las kun byed pas zhes bya ba ni las thams cad byed pa bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi gsang sngags bzlas pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: las kun byed pas zhes bya ba ni las thams cad byed pa bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi gsang sngags bzlas pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase because it performs all activities means that the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali, who performs all activities, is recited.

original: sems can kun la bsang gtor bya //
analyzed: sems can kun la bsang gtor bya //
translated: One should perform the sprinkling for all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la bsang gtor bya ba'i phyir gzhag pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la bsang gtor bya ba'i phyir gzhag pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is placed there in order to perform the sprinkling for all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar bsang gtor bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsang gtor bya zhe na /
translated: How does one perform the sprinkling?

original: yang na ku sha'i chun pos bya //
analyzed: yang na ku sha'i chun pos bya //
translated: Or with a bundle of kuśa grass.

original: zhes gsungs te ku sha'i chun po'am aa mra'i 'dab ma la sogs pas bya /🔽lha bshos zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te ku sha'i chun po'am aa mra'i 'dab ma la sogs pas bya / lha bshos zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
translated: One should perform the sprinkling with a bundle of kuśa grass or a leaf of the Indian fig tree, and so forth.🔽The phrase offer the sacrificial cake refers to the sacrificial cake of the maṇḍala.

original: gtor ma phul la zhes bya ba ni 'dir gtor ma ni phyogs kyi gtor ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gtor ma phul la zhes bya ba ni 'dir gtor ma ni phyogs kyi gtor ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: Having offered the sacrificial cake, one should invite the deities.

original: spyan drang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bsdu pa'i phyag rgya dang sngags dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa bsdu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: spyan drang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bsdu pa'i phyag rgya dang sngags dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa bsdu bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase one should invite means that one should gather all the tathāgatas and so forth with the mantra and the gesture of the vajra gathering.

original: gsal bar byas te zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gnod sbyin nam bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyis so //🔽gzhug pa dang zhes bya ba ni rdo rje zhags pas so //
analyzed: gsal bar byas te zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gnod sbyin nam bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyis so // gzhug pa dang zhes bya ba ni rdo rje zhags pas so //
translated: Having illuminated means with Vajrayakṣa or Amṛtakuṇḍali.🔽Having caused to enter means with Vajrapāśa.

original: bsdams pa dang dbang du byas te zhes bya ba ni lcags sgrog dang 'bebs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: bsdams pa dang dbang du byas te zhes bya ba ni lcags sgrog dang 'bebs pa dag gis so //
translated: Having bound and controlled means with Vajrasphoṭa and Vajraghanta.

original: phur bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngar bshad pa'i gsang sngags phyag rgya dang bcas pas ci rigs par phur bu la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: phur bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngar bshad pa'i gsang sngags phyag rgya dang bcas pas ci rigs par phur bu la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: With the stakes and so on means that one should perform the stakes and so on with the previously explained mantras and mudras, as appropriate.

original: rol mo'i khyad par dpag tu med pa rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni rol mo'i rnam pa 'di lta ste gling bu dang pi wang dang rdza rnga dang mu kunda dang cha lang dang / rngo bo che dang rdza rnga chen po dang / rnga rings dang kun dza ta dang ti mi la la sogs pa rol mo'i sil snyan bcu po stong phrag gis so //
analyzed: rol mo'i khyad par dpag tu med pa rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni rol mo'i rnam pa 'di lta ste gling bu dang pi wang dang rdza rnga dang mu kunda dang cha lang dang / rngo bo che dang rdza rnga chen po dang / rnga rings dang kun dza ta dang ti mi la la sogs pa rol mo'i sil snyan bcu po stong phrag gis so //
translated: With countless special musical instruments means with ten thousand types of musical instruments such as flutes, lutes, clay drums, mukuṇḍa, cymbals, kettledrums, large clay drums, large kettledrums, kunjāta, timila, and so on.

original: bstod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'o //
analyzed: bstod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'o //
translated: The phrase should be praised means should be worshipped.

original: bzod par gsol te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ma tshang ba dang lhag pa nye bar gzung ba'i phyir 'di yo byad ma tshang ba dang nyams pa las byung ba gang dag yod pa de dag thams cad bzod par mdzod cig ces brjod la /
analyzed: bzod par gsol te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ma tshang ba dang lhag pa nye bar gzung ba'i phyir 'di yo byad ma tshang ba dang nyams pa las byung ba gang dag yod pa de dag thams cad bzod par mdzod cig ces brjod la /
translated: The phrase should be asked for forgiveness and so forth means that one should say, Please forgive all of those faults which have occurred due to incompleteness and excess, in order to take hold of the incompleteness and excess.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyi phyir /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyi phyir /
translated: For the sake of all powers,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi byin rlabs dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsol ba gdab po //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi byin rlabs dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsol ba gdab po //
translated: one should request with the words The blessing of the realm of phenomena, and so forth.

original: slob ma zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor bri bar ro //
analyzed: slob ma zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor bri bar ro //
translated: The phrase the disciple means one who is to draw the mandala as it has been taught.

original: ci zhig byas nas gzhug @202b par bya zhes na snying po 'di dang phyag rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te snying ga dang dbung mgo gnyis dang lkog ma dang spyi bor dzi na dzi ka ces bya ba la sogs pa'i snying po gsum dgod cing
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas gzhug @202b par bya zhes na snying po 'di dang phyag rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te snying ga dang dbung mgo gnyis dang lkog ma dang spyi bor dzi na dzi ka ces bya ba la sogs pa'i snying po gsum dgod cing
translated: What should be done in order to admit him? The root text states, With this essence mantra and the mudras, and so forth. One should place the three essence mantras at the heart, the two wrists, the throat, and the head, with the words Jinajik, and so forth.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas bsrungs la rdo rje srung ba'i sngags dang phyag rgyas go bgo bar byas la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas bsrungs la rdo rje srung ba'i sngags dang phyag rgyas go bgo bar byas la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should protect with the seal of the Vajra Body, etc. , and one should enter, having put on the armor with the mantra and seal of the Vajra Protection.

original: dor bar bya ste zhes ba ni 'phang ba'o //
analyzed: dor bar bya ste zhes ba ni 'phang ba'o //
translated: One should cast away means one should throw away.

original: gdong g-yogs dgrol zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces brjod do zhes tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gdong g-yogs dgrol zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces brjod do zhes tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: One should remove the blindfold means one should say this, as the following words are connected.

original: dngos grub thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la dngos grub thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni 'da' bar mi bya ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la dngos grub thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni 'da' bar mi bya ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: All powers etc. : the perfection of all powers is the nature of not being transgressed.

original: ba shya badzra zhes bya ba ni de skad ces brjod par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ba shya badzra zhes bya ba ni de skad ces brjod par bya'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should say vasya vajra means one should say this, one should understand.

original: de nas dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then one should bestow the consecration.

original: rig pa'i dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The consecration of knowledge.

original: dri dang me tog ces bya ba la sogs pas dbang bskur ro zhes 'og nas bshad pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dri dang me tog ces bya ba la sogs pas dbang bskur ro zhes 'og nas bshad pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: With perfume, flowers, etc. , one should consecrate, as will be explained below.

original: steng du bla re bre bar bya //
analyzed: steng du bla re bre bar bya //
translated: One should stretch a canopy above.

original: zhes bya ba ni slob ma'i zhes bya bar sbyar ro//
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni slob ma'i zhes bya bar sbyar ro//
translated: This is connected with “the disciples.”

original: gang dag ce na gdugs dang rgya pa mtshan la sogs pa ste bkra shis par 'gyur ba de dang gis bklubs shing nye bar brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag ce na gdugs dang rgya pa mtshan la sogs pa ste bkra shis par 'gyur ba de dang gis bklubs shing nye bar brgyan par bya'o //
translated: What are they? The auspicious things such as the parasol, the victory banner, the banner of the charnel ground, and so forth.

original: rnam rgyal bum pa yis zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i bum pas so //
analyzed: rnam rgyal bum pa yis zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i bum pas so //
translated: With the “conquest vase” means with the vase of the principal deity of the mandala.

original: lha mo bzhi rnams dang zhes bya ba ni re re zhing ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag po dang lha mo gsum gsum yongs su bzlas pa'i bum pa bzhis so //🔽lha rnams kun gyi bzhi po yis //
analyzed: lha mo bzhi rnams dang zhes bya ba ni re re zhing ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag po dang lha mo gsum gsum yongs su bzlas pa'i bum pa bzhis so // lha rnams kun gyi bzhi po yis //
translated: With the four goddesses means with the four vases of the lord of meditative concentration and the three goddesses, each one.

original: zhes bya ba ni re re zhing gshin rje gshed la sogs pa khro bo gnyis gnyis yongs su bzlas pa'i bum pa bzhi rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni re re zhing gshin rje gshed la sogs pa khro bo gnyis gnyis yongs su bzlas pa'i bum pa bzhi rnams kyis so //
translated: With the four of all the deities means with the four vases of each one of the two wrathful deities, such as Yamāntaka, and so forth.

original: 'di ni bum pa'i grangs nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bum pa'i grangs nges pa yin te /
translated: This is the definite number of vases.

original: 'byor na ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams re re'i dang bum pa gang ba byas te /
analyzed: 'byor na ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams re re'i dang bum pa gang ba byas te /
translated: If one is wealthy, one should fill a vase for each deity of the mandala.

original: bum pa gang bas ni mchod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa gang bas ni mchod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should worship with a full vase.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: dang po rnam par snang mdzad kyi sngags kyis so //
analyzed: dang po rnam par snang mdzad kyi sngags kyis so //
translated: First, with the mantra of Vairocana.

original: de nas mi bskyod pa dang spyan ma dang rdo rje sems ma dang skul byed ma dang mi g-yo ma dang gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i gsang sngags bzhis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mi bskyod pa dang spyan ma dang rdo rje sems ma dang skul byed ma dang mi g-yo ma dang gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i gsang sngags bzhis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with the four mantras of Akshobhya, Locana, Vajrasattva, Chandali, Achala, Yamantaka, and so on, one should confer empowerment.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang ni slob dpon dag rgyud gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas ji skad du bshad pa las gzhan 'chad de /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang ni slob dpon dag rgyud gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas ji skad du bshad pa las gzhan 'chad de /
translated: The irreversible empowerment, the masters explain following other tantras, is different from what has been explained.

original: yi ge'i don dang man ngag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i don dang man ngag las shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be known from the meaning of the syllables and the esoteric instructions.

original: 'dis ni slob dpon gyi dbang bskur ba bstan pa @203a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni slob dpon gyi dbang bskur ba bstan pa @203a * //
translated: This teaches the master empowerment.

original: yin no // til gyi gang bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rjes su gnang ba'i dbang bskur ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yin no // til gyi gang bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rjes su gnang ba'i dbang bskur ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: With the lines beginning filled with sesame seeds, the permission empowerment is taught.

original: de nyid la ni dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: de nyid la ni dbang bskur ba //
translated: One should confer empowerment on that very person.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtag pa kho nar bdag nyid dbang bskur ba ster ba de'i tshe ji skad du gsungs pa'i rgyal ba 'di rnams kyis dbang bskur ba stsol bar mdzad do zhes de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rtag pa kho nar bdag nyid dbang bskur ba ster ba de'i tshe ji skad du gsungs pa'i rgyal ba 'di rnams kyis dbang bskur ba stsol bar mdzad do zhes de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid
translated: In this and other passages, the consecration of the self is taught as being permanent. At that time, the Victorious Ones, as they are described, confer the consecration. One should imagine the mandala with such a nature.

original: shes pas bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pas bsam par bya'o //
translated: The reality of the mandala should be understood by the wise.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan par bya // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The characteristics of the Dharma should be taught.🔽The characteristics of the Dharma are taught in the following passage:

original: chos rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu ste //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽mi shes rab rib la sogs pa //
analyzed: chos rnams gzugs brnyan lta bu ste // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // mi shes rab rib la sogs pa //
translated: The dharmas are like reflections.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni mi dge ba'i bag chags la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni mi dge ba'i bag chags la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The words “ignorance, cataracts, and so on” include the latent tendencies of non-virtue and so on.

original: gzugs brnyan phyag rgya bstan par bya //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan phyag rgya bstan par bya //
translated: The reflection seal should be taught.

original: zhes bya ba'i thur ma la sogs pa ston pa'i lag pa'i phyag rgya bcings la bstan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i thur ma la sogs pa ston pa'i lag pa'i phyag rgya bcings la bstan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should display the hand seal of the teacher, such as the scalpel and so on.

original: rus pa la bab kyang zhes bya ba ni gshis 'jigs par 'gyur pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: rus pa la bab kyang zhes bya ba ni gshis 'jigs par 'gyur pas kyang ngo //
translated: “Even if it comes to the bones” means even if it comes to the horror of the basic nature.

original: lus kyang zhes bya ba lus kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lus la yang mi blta ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyang zhes bya ba lus kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lus la yang mi blta ba'o //
translated: “Even the body” means even the body is not to be looked at.

original: 'di skad ston te lus byin pas kyang slob mas bla ma 'di ci nas mgu ba de ltar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ston te lus byin pas kyang slob mas bla ma 'di ci nas mgu ba de ltar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This is what is taught: “By giving the body, the disciple should please the guru in this way.”

original: bslang ste zhes bya ba ni bslang la rjes su gnang ba de nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bslang ste zhes bya ba ni bslang la rjes su gnang ba de nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: “Having risen” means having risen, the permission is taught.

original: chog mthong bas zhes bya ba ni 'og nas gnas bshad pa'i chogs so //
analyzed: chog mthong bas zhes bya ba ni 'og nas gnas bshad pa'i chogs so //
translated: “Having seen the ritual” means the ritual that will be explained below.

original: de bzhin du bsgom pa'i rim pa'i tshul zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid dang gsang ba'i dbye bas zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i rim gyis dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams legs par mchod la ji skad du bshad pa bzhin gshegs su gsol lo zhes bya bar sbyar
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgom pa'i rim pa'i tshul zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid dang gsang ba'i dbye bas zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i rim gyis dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams legs par mchod la ji skad du bshad pa bzhin gshegs su gsol lo zhes bya bar sbyar
translated: “In the same way, the method of the stage of meditation” means that, having well worshipped the deities of the maṇḍala with the stages of pacifying and increasing by the divisions of reality and secret, one should request them to depart as explained.

original: ro // sprul pa ni rang gi snying gar nye bar bsdu bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ro // sprul pa ni rang gi snying gar nye bar bsdu bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the emanation is to be withdrawn into one’s heart.

original: tshon rtsi bsdu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshon rtsi bsdu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The collection of colors and so on are easy to understand.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho ga ston pa'i gzhung gi le'u la dkyil 'khor rim par phye ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho ga ston pa'i gzhung gi le'u la dkyil 'khor rim par phye ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The chapter of the treatise that teaches the rite of drawing the maṇḍala is expressed by the term the maṇḍala section.

original: le'u gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter.

original: // / dkyil 'khor du zhugs pas ni sngags yongs su zung ngar bya dgos pas de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u gsum pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // / dkyil 'khor du zhugs pas ni sngags yongs su zung ngar bya dgos pas de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u gsum pa gsungs te /
translated: Since one who has entered the maṇḍala must take up the mantra, then, in order to explain the third chapter, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig gi 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig gi 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “the Bhagavān spoke” is connected to the end.

original: ci zhig mdzad nas she na gsang sngags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste gsang sngags nyid ni @203b 'khor lo ste /🔽yang dang yang du bzlas pas na 'khor lo bzhin du 'khor ba'am /
analyzed: ci zhig mdzad nas she na gsang sngags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste gsang sngags nyid ni @203b 'khor lo ste / yang dang yang du bzlas pas na 'khor lo bzhin du 'khor ba'am /
translated: What did he do? He declares, “the wheel of the mantra,” and so on. The mantra itself is the wheel.

original: 'khor lo bskyed pa'i phyir 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo bskyed pa'i phyir 'khor lo'o //
translated: Since it is repeated again and again, it is a wheel, like a wheel, or it is a wheel because it generates a wheel.

original: de rnams bskor ba ni gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams bskor ba ni gsungs pa ste /
translated: The turning of that is the teaching.

original: de'i don gyi rdo rje'i ye shes la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don gyi rdo rje'i ye shes la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That samādhi which has the vajra wisdom of that meaning is so called.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa ste /
translated: Engaged in that means actualized.

original: sngags ston pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba ni don to //
analyzed: sngags ston pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba ni don to //
translated: The meaning is that he focused his mind on teaching the mantra.

original: gsang sngags kyi snying po'i yi ge rnams zhes bya ba ni 'dir bshad kyis zhes nye bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi snying po'i yi ge rnams zhes bya ba ni 'dir bshad kyis zhes nye bar sbyar te /
translated: The syllables of the essence of the mantra means that here it is connected with “explained.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin du zin kyang ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas sngags ston par mdzad pa 'dis ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin du zin kyang ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas sngags ston par mdzad pa 'dis ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: Although the Blessed One is always in equipoise, by the priority of focusing on samādhi, he teaches the mantra. This shows that

original: rnal 'byor pas kyang chos bdag med pa bsgom pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rang gi lha la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas sngags ston par mdzad pa 'dis ni 'di'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas kyang chos bdag med pa bsgom pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rang gi lha la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas sngags ston par mdzad pa 'dis ni 'di'o //
translated: the practitioner, too, by the priority of focusing on his own deity in connection with the cultivation of the selflessness of phenomena, teaches the mantra.

original: rnam par snang mdzad do zhes bya ba 'dis ni gsang sngags dang rig pa'i skyes bu gnyis tha mi dad par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad do zhes bya ba 'dis ni gsang sngags dang rig pa'i skyes bu gnyis tha mi dad par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: By saying Vairocana, he says that the mantra being and the knowledge being are not different.

original: gzhan du rnam par snang mdzad las gzhan pa'o zhes tha dad par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rnam par snang mdzad las gzhan pa'o zhes tha dad par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, he would be teaching that they are different, saying other than Vairocana.

original: de yang 'di nyid nas spyan la sogs pa'i gsang sngags gsungs pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de yang 'di nyid nas spyan la sogs pa'i gsang sngags gsungs pa'i 'og tu /
translated: Moreover, right after the mantra of Locana and so forth is taught here, it is explained:

original: de nas 'di ni gsungs tsam gyis //
analyzed: de nas 'di ni gsungs tsam gyis //
translated: Then, merely by saying this,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad da /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad da /
translated: and so forth.

original: de bas na 'di gnyis ni tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gnyis ni tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are not different.

original: kun du bzang po'o zhes gsungs pa 'di ni byams pa la sogs pa la ma gtogs par bshad pa yin pas /
analyzed: kun du bzang po'o zhes gsungs pa 'di ni byams pa la sogs pa la ma gtogs par bshad pa yin pas /
translated: By saying Samantabhadra, he explains that it is not included in Maitreya and so forth.

original: byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug le'u gnyis par bstan pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug le'u gnyis par bstan pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore, the sixteen bodhisattvas beginning with Maitreya, who are taught in the second chapter, are merely an illustration.

original: de bas na 'dir nor bzangs dag kyang dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir nor bzangs dag kyang dgod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, Sudhana should also be included here.

original: de bas na ci rigs par bzhis mtshang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' stong bri ba'am bsgom mo zhes pa 'dir rig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ci rigs par bzhis mtshang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' stong bri ba'am bsgom mo zhes pa 'dir rig pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is correct to draw or visualize a thousand bodhisattvas, each with four faces.

original: 'dir ma bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyi'i sngags ni /
analyzed: 'dir ma bshad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyi'i sngags ni /
translated: The general mantra of the bodhisattvas not mentioned here is:

original: aom sarba sam sk'a ra ba ri shudha:dharm'a te ma h'a ya na pa ri p'a re sv'a h'a /🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: aom sarba sam sk'a ra ba ri shudha:dharm'a te ma h'a ya na pa ri p'a re sv'a h'a / zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Om sarva-samskara-pariśuddha-dharmate mahāyāna-paribhāṣa svaha.

original: sngags kyi rjes su 'brangs nas gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo bzhis gshin rje dang / khyab 'jug dang / tshangs pa dang / log 'dren chung ma dang bcas pa gnon par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rjes su 'brangs nas gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo bzhis gshin rje dang / khyab 'jug dang / tshangs pa dang / log 'dren chung ma dang bcas pa gnon par shes par bya'o //
translated: Following the mantra, one should understand that the four wrathful ones, such as Yamântaka, trample on Yama, Vishnu, Brahma, and the seducer with their wives.

original: 'di dag ni dkyil @204a * //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dkyil @204a * //
translated: These are the deities of the mandala.

original: 'khor du dgod pa'i gsang sngags kyi yi ge rnams te zhes bya ba na dkyil 'khor du lha rnams dgod pa la ji skad du bshad pa'i gsang sngags kyi yi ge rnams yang dag par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor du dgod pa'i gsang sngags kyi yi ge rnams te zhes bya ba na dkyil 'khor du lha rnams dgod pa la ji skad du bshad pa'i gsang sngags kyi yi ge rnams yang dag par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The mantra syllables that are set out in the maṇḍala. The remainder of the sentence is: “In setting out the deities in the maṇḍala, one should employ the mantra syllables as explained.”

original: dkyil 'khor du zhes bya ba'i nye bar mtshon pa las ni lha'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du zhes bya ba'i nye bar mtshon pa las ni lha'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: From the indication of “in the maṇḍala,” one should understand the yoga of the deity, etc.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i gsang sngags kyi tshogs de dag go //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i gsang sngags kyi tshogs de dag go //
translated: “Those” and so on refer to the aforementioned collection of mantras.

original: brten nas zhes bya ba ni mtshan gzhir byas nas 'di nyid kyi 'khor gyi don du rigs dang rtog pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis gsang sngags bye phrag du ma gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: brten nas zhes bya ba ni mtshan gzhir byas nas 'di nyid kyi 'khor gyi don du rigs dang rtog pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis gsang sngags bye phrag du ma gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Based on” means “taking as the basis,” and it is on the basis of those that many millions of mantras have been taught, differentiated by family, thought, etc., for the sake of their retinue.

original: gzhan dag ni de la brten shing thob nas ngas sngags bye ba phrag du ma gsungs so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa yin gyi 'di ni gsang sngags kyi tshogs ma yin te chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de la brten shing thob nas ngas sngags bye ba phrag du ma gsungs so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa yin gyi 'di ni gsang sngags kyi tshogs ma yin te chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni gnas pa ste /
translated: This is not a collection of secret mantras, because the reality of phenomena is stable.

original: 'di lta ste sngags kyi chos nyid kyang de ni mi rigs te sngags gsungs pa nyid ma yin gyi snga ma kho na rigs par shes so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sngags kyi chos nyid kyang de ni mi rigs te sngags gsungs pa nyid ma yin gyi snga ma kho na rigs par shes so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the reality of mantras is that, because mantras are not taught, but only the previous [is reasonable].

original: gtan tshigs dang yang mi 'gal te don dam par stong pa nyid du yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang yang mi 'gal te don dam par stong pa nyid du yang med pa yin no //
translated: It is also not contradictory to reasoning, because ultimately it does not exist as emptiness.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag las byung ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin phul du byung ba dang rig pa'i skyes bur ldan pas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag las byung ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin phul du byung ba dang rig pa'i skyes bur ldan pas so //
translated: What is called arising from the distinction of samādhi is having the excellence of samādhi and being a person of knowledge.

original: lcags kyus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni 'di nyid nas 'byung bas ma bris so //
analyzed: lcags kyus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni 'di nyid nas 'byung bas ma bris so //
translated: As for with the hook, and so on, the mudrās of the vajra hook, and so on, are not written here because they appear in this [tantra].

original: de dag la sogs pa ni spyan drang ba'i sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bsdu ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa ni spyan drang ba'i sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bsdu ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: These and so on are the applications for invoking them.

original: de dag sngags de rnams kyi go rims ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes ni thun mong gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de dag sngags de rnams kyi go rims ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes ni thun mong gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The order of those mantras is as follows: The essence of Vairocana, the wisdom of the realm of phenomena, is the common characteristic.

original: de las me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes bzhi byung ngo //
analyzed: de las me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes bzhi byung ngo //
translated: From that, the four wisdoms such as mirror-like arise.

original: de bas na ye shes de'i bdag nyid mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bzhir bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na ye shes de'i bdag nyid mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bzhir bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the four such as Akṣobhya are taught as having the nature of that wisdom.

original: de lta na yang de sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la /
analyzed: de lta na yang de sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la /
translated: However, for the continuum of the yogi/nī who cultivates them in that way,

original: ji srid du kun du 'gro ba'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: ji srid du kun du 'gro ba'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po mngon du byas nas /
translated: as long as the universal emptiness characterized by the first bodhisattva ground is not actualized,

original: chos kyi dbyings las brtsams nas ji srid kyi bar gyi mthar thug pa las 'jug pa'i dga' ba nye bar mi 'byung ba de srid kyi bar du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las brtsams nas ji srid kyi bar gyi mthar thug pa las 'jug pa'i dga' ba nye bar mi 'byung ba de srid kyi bar du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Until the joy of engagement arises from the beginning of the dharma-dhātu up to the ultimate, it will not arise.

original: de bas na ye shes bzhi thob pa'i rgyur gyur pas dga' ba bzhi'i bdag nyid can ni @204b spyan la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bas na ye shes bzhi thob pa'i rgyur gyur pas dga' ba bzhi'i bdag nyid can ni @204b spyan la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is the cause for attaining the four knowledges, the four beginning with Locanā have the nature of the four joys.

original: de yang ji srid du byang chub kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bzhi yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ba de srid du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang ji srid du byang chub kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bzhi yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ba de srid du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, until the four perfections such as generosity are purified, they will not arise.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can ni rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can ni rdo rje sems ma la sogs pa bzhi yin no //
translated: Therefore, the four beginning with Vajrasattva have the nature of the four perfections such as generosity.

original: de yang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi dang bral bas ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi dang bral bas ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, they will not arise without the four perfections.

original: de bas na sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can ni skul byed ma la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can ni skul byed ma la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, the four beginning with Cāriṇī have the nature of the perfections such as generosity.

original: de yang yang dag par spong bar dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid can nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi dang bral bas ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang yang dag par spong bar dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid can nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi dang bral bas ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it does not arise without the four right efforts, the four bases of magic power, the five faculties, and the five powers.

original: de bas na nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi'i bdag nyid can ni gshin rje'i gshed la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bas na nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi'i bdag nyid can ni gshin rje'i gshed la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, the four beginning with Yamântaka are of the nature of the four aspects of penetration.

original: de yang lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa med na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa med na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it does not arise without the four stations of mindfulness of body, sensation, thought, and the dharmas.

original: de bas na de'i bdag nyid can mi g-yo ba la sogs pa bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de'i bdag nyid can mi g-yo ba la sogs pa bzhi bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the four beginning with Acala are taught as being of that nature.

original: go rims ji skad du bshad pa'i nang du byams pa la sogs pa ni mi gtogs te rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sems dpa' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims ji skad du bshad pa'i nang du byams pa la sogs pa ni mi gtogs te rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sems dpa' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Maitreya and the others mentioned in the order in which they are explained are not included, because they are Bodhisattvas arisen from the evolution of karma.

original: sngags rab tu ston pa'i gzhung gi le'u la ni gsangs sngags rim par phye ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: sngags rab tu ston pa'i gzhung gi le'u la ni gsangs sngags rim par phye ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: In the chapter of the scripture teaching the mantras, the term “division of the mantras” is used.

original: rim par bye ba gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rim par bye ba gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: The commentary on the third hundred thousand.

original: // / sngags yongs su bzung bas na ting nge 'dzin yongs su shes par bya dgos pas de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u bzhi pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // / sngags yongs su bzung bas na ting nge 'dzin yongs su shes par bya dgos pas de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u bzhi pa gsungs te /
translated: Since the mantra must be understood by knowing the meditative concentration that fully holds it, then the fourth chapter is stated beginning with “thereupon.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should connect this with “the Lord said thus.”

original: ci zhig mdzad nas she na ye shes chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci zhig mdzad nas she na ye shes chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What did he do? He said “great intuition,” etc.

original: ye shes chen po ni chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa ye shes rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ni chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa ye shes rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Great intuition is the five kinds of intuition, such as the intuition of the ultimate realm.

original: de yam stobs ni nus pa ste thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yam stobs ni nus pa ste thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Its power is its capacity, which is unobstructed.

original: de'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sprul pas rnam par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sprul pas rnam par spyod pa'o //
translated: Its magical emanation is the enjoyment of emanations such as Buddhas.

original: de nyid rdo rje ste 'bras bu lan pa'i phyir don yod pa'i nus pa can yin la de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste 'bras bu lan pa'i phyir don yod pa'i nus pa can yin la de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is the vajra, because it is the fruit of the cause, and it has the capacity of the unerring cause. That which is the meditative concentration focused on that is called by that name.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa ste /
translated: Engaged in meditative concentration means manifesting.

original: ting nge 'dzin ston pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad de zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽ting nge 'dzin la @205a * //
