analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ston pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad de zhes bya ba'i don to // ting nge 'dzin la @205a * //
translated: It means that he has focused his mind on teaching meditative concentration.

original: dmigs pas ni 'di skad ston pa yin te dngos grub kyi phyir lha'i gzugs bsgom pa ni rdo rje phra mo bsgom pa'i sems brtan par byas nas bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pas ni 'di skad ston pa yin te dngos grub kyi phyir lha'i gzugs bsgom pa ni rdo rje phra mo bsgom pa'i sems brtan par byas nas bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: By observing meditative concentration, he shows this: In order to attain power, you should cultivate the deity's form by stabilizing the mind in the cultivation of the subtle vajra.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs brnyan bskyed pa'i phyir ras dang rtsig pa dang // shing leb la sogs pa la sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i bar khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs brnyan bskyed pa'i phyir ras dang rtsig pa dang // shing leb la sogs pa la sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i bar khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: In the reflection, and so on, the reflection means that you should understand that you should cultivate the form of the Buddha, and so on, on cloth, on a wall, on a wooden tablet, and so on, in order to generate the reflection.🔽This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: 'di ni gnyis su sbyor ba yin te sems yongs su dag pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis su sbyor ba yin te sems yongs su dag pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is a twofold application: the teaching of the object of observation from the perspective of the completely purified mind.

original: rgyud yongs su dag pa ni gnyis su sbyor ba la mngon par zhen par mi byed de ji skad du /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su dag pa ni gnyis su sbyor ba la mngon par zhen par mi byed de ji skad du /
translated: The pure continuum is not fixated on the union of the two, as it is said:

original: rnal 'byor yang dag ma yin sems //
analyzed: rnal 'byor yang dag ma yin sems //
translated: The yoga is not real, the mind

original: lha la dmigs par byed pa dag //
analyzed: lha la dmigs par byed pa dag //
translated: Is focused on the deity.

original: rnal 'byor gzugs brnyan rang bzhin te //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gzugs brnyan rang bzhin te //
translated: The yoga is the nature of a reflection,

original: lugs ma la sogs rnal 'byor skye //
analyzed: lugs ma la sogs rnal 'byor skye //
translated: The yoga of the icon and so forth arises.

original: yang dag mchog sems rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: yang dag mchog sems rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yoga of the real, supreme mind🔽Is focused on the deity,

original: lha la dmigs par byed pa dag / rang gi dam tshig bdag sbyor bas //🔽mi 'gyur dam pa 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: lha la dmigs par byed pa dag / rang gi dam tshig bdag sbyor bas // mi 'gyur dam pa 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: One's own commitment, and the self-consecration,

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: The supreme, unchanging is accomplished.

original: gsang sngags 'chang rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni sngags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'chang rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni sngags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The mantra-holders are the mantra practitioners.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsang chen zhes bya ba ni rigs dang dam tshig dang phyag rgya mchog dang lhan cig sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsang chen zhes bya ba ni rigs dang dam tshig dang phyag rgya mchog dang lhan cig sbyor ba'o //
translated: The great secret samadhi is the union with the supreme commitment seal of the family.

original: rnal 'byor dag pa 'di ni gtso po'i dbang du mdzad pa bstan pa yin pas 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor dag pa 'di ni gtso po'i dbang du mdzad pa bstan pa yin pas 'di skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This purity of yoga is taught from the perspective of the principal.

original: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa bstan pas gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin du de kho na nyid dang gsang sngags dang gsang chen gyi rnal 'byor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa bstan pas gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin du de kho na nyid dang gsang sngags dang gsang chen gyi rnal 'byor du 'gyur ro //
translated: By teaching the meditative concentrations, etc., one becomes a yogin of reality, mantra, and the great secret, respectively.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: mos pa ji lta bas rnal 'byor gsum las gang yang rung ba bsgoms nas mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyi skal pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mos pa ji lta bas rnal 'byor gsum las gang yang rung ba bsgoms nas mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyi skal pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having cultivated any one of the three yogas according to one's faith, one becomes a fit vessel for the desired spiritual powers.🔽This very point is stated in other scriptures:

original: don 'di nyid gzhan dag las kyang rigs kyi bu sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: don 'di nyid gzhan dag las kyang rigs kyi bu sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Son of noble family, this mind is naturally radiant,

original: 'di lta ste ji ltar sems yongs su sbyangs pa de lta de ltar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste ji ltar sems yongs su sbyangs pa de lta de ltar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and it becomes just as it is purified.

original: aom gyi ye shes las bsgrub pa //
analyzed: aom gyi ye shes las bsgrub pa //
translated: Established in the knowledge of OM

original: zhes bya ba ni ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: means that knowledge is the characteristic of the realm of phenomena.

original: de nyid yi ge aom yin pas na aom gyi ye shes te des bsgrubs pa'i rdo rje bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid yi ge aom yin pas na aom gyi ye shes te des bsgrubs pa'i rdo rje bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That itself is the syllable OM, so it is the knowledge of OM. One should meditate on the vajra established by that.

original: rdzogs pa'i go rims kyang byang chub kyi sems @205b kyi le'u'i rim pas so //🔽shes rab ye shes rab rgyas pa //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i go rims kyang byang chub kyi sems @205b kyi le'u'i rim pas so // shes rab ye shes rab rgyas pa //
translated: The order of completion is also by the order of the chapter on the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis blo rgyas par byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis blo rgyas par byas pa'o //
translated: The enlargement of wisdom is the enlargement of the mind by the wisdom of the selflessness of things.

original: zhal gsum gyis ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnam par dag par ston par byed pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ngo bo ste kha dog ni gcig pa'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum gyis ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnam par dag par ston par byed pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ngo bo ste kha dog ni gcig pa'o //
translated: The three faces are the three doors of liberation, the nature of which is the purification of passion, hatred, and folly, and the color of which is the same.

original: la la ni man ngag las zhal gsum gyi mdog ni 'dus pa ltar gsum du bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la ni man ngag las zhal gsum gyi mdog ni 'dus pa ltar gsum du bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the color of the three faces should be made according to the Guhyasamaja Tantra, by the oral instruction.

original: spyan gsum ni zhal dang po 'am re re zheng gsum ste thams cad du yang de bzhin no //🔽dang po bsam gtan phyag rgya can //
analyzed: spyan gsum ni zhal dang po 'am re re zheng gsum ste thams cad du yang de bzhin no // dang po bsam gtan phyag rgya can //
translated: The three eyes are the three eyes of each face, or the three eyes of each one, and they are all the same.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya dang po'i g-yas dang g-yon ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgyar byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya dang po'i g-yas dang g-yon ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgyar byas pa'o //
translated: The first meditation is the first seal, which is made into the meditation seal of the right and left hands.

original: bgrang phreng ldan zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi nor bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bgrang phreng ldan zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi nor bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The one with a rosary is the one with the mantra-jewel.

original: nu ma 'dzin zhes bya ba ni nu ma bzung ba ste /
analyzed: nu ma 'dzin zhes bya ba ni nu ma bzung ba ste /
translated: The one with a breast is the one who holds a breast.

original: lha mo yang phyag gnyis pa sku mdog gser mo lag pa gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'khyud par byed pa ste /
analyzed: lha mo yang phyag gnyis pa sku mdog gser mo lag pa gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'khyud par byed pa ste /
translated: The goddess is also two-armed, golden-colored, and embraces the Blessed One with both hands.

original: gshin rje gshed kyi lha mo gnyis phyag gnyis mnga' bar bshad pa 'dis nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed kyi lha mo gnyis phyag gnyis mnga' bar bshad pa 'dis nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is indicated by the explanation that the two goddesses of Yamântaka are two-armed.

original: la la na re rang gi bdag po dang 'dra bar thams cad bsam mo zhes zer te 'dis ni gsang ba'i rnal 'byor bshad do //
analyzed: la la na re rang gi bdag po dang 'dra bar thams cad bsam mo zhes zer te 'dis ni gsang ba'i rnal 'byor bshad do //
translated: Some say that everything is imagined like one's own lord. This explains the secret yoga.

original: mchod pa'i dus su ni nu ma 'dzin pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i dus su ni nu ma 'dzin pa med par bya'o //
translated: At the time of worship, one should be without a breast.

original: 'jigs shing skrag mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir de nas zhes nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig gi bsgom par gyis zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jigs shing skrag mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir de nas zhes nye bar mtshon pa'i tshig gi bsgom par gyis zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: The one who causes fear and terror is here indicated by the word then, and this is connected with one should meditate.

original: de bzhin du rigs las kyang 'di nyid kyi 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs las kyang 'di nyid kyi 'og nas ston to //
translated: In the same way, this is taught below in the family section.

original: sprin zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa'o //🔽yang dag 'byung zhing legs 'khyud pa //
analyzed: sprin zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa'o // yang dag 'byung zhing legs 'khyud pa //
translated: The “cloud” is the immeasurables.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te rnyed na gzhan dang mi 'gro ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rig ma bzhi la mngon par sbyor bar byas la des ji lta ba bzhin du mchod par sbyed pa ni rnal 'byor pa des de bzhin gshegs pa
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te rnyed na gzhan dang mi 'gro ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rig ma bzhi la mngon par sbyor bar byas la des ji lta ba bzhin du mchod par sbyed pa ni rnal 'byor pa des de bzhin gshegs pa
translated: “Correctly arising and well-embracing” means that if one finds the four consorts endowed with the characteristics of not going to others, and so on, one should engage in union with them.

original: thams cad rang gi dam tshig gis 'khyud pa'i sku spro bar bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad rang gi dam tshig gis 'khyud pa'i sku spro bar bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The yogin should visualize the emanation of the body of all the Tathāgatas embraced by his own consort.

original: 'dis ni gsang ba'i rnal 'byor bshad pa yin no //🔽nang gi gsang sngags bzlas brjod cing //
analyzed: 'dis ni gsang ba'i rnal 'byor bshad pa yin no // nang gi gsang sngags bzlas brjod cing //
translated: This explains the secret yoga.

original: zhes bya ba ni nang gi bzlas pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nang gi bzlas pas so //
translated: “Reciting the inner mantra” means with inner recitation.

original: de nyid spyod yul ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi yul te 'dis ni de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid spyod yul ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi yul te 'dis ni de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Having that as the sphere of activity” means the sphere of activity of one’s deity yoga. This explains the reality yoga.

original: rnal 'bor 'di la ni nu ma 'dzin pa med pas sdigs mdzub la sogs @206a * //
analyzed: rnal 'bor 'di la ni nu ma 'dzin pa med pas sdigs mdzub la sogs @206a * //
translated: In this yoga, since there is no grasping of the breasts, there is the threatening gesture and so on.🔽

original: ba ci rigs par gzung ngo //
analyzed: ba ci rigs par gzung ngo //
translated: In this yoga, since there is no holding of the breasts, one should hold the threatening forefinger and so forth as appropriate.

original: 'dir yang 'am gyi sgras ni phyogs gzhan ston par byed pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'am gyi sgras ni phyogs gzhan ston par byed pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, the word “or” should be understood to indicate another alternative,🔽because it is not reasonable for a single meditator to perform all three. Therefore, a single practitioner should meditate on reality, the secret, and the great secret in sequence.

original: sgom pa po gcig gis gsum char bya bar mi rigs pas sgrub pa po gcig gis de kho na nyid dang / gsang ba dang gsang ba chen po rnams rim bzhin du bsgom par bya'o zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum nye bar bkod de /
analyzed: sgom pa po gcig gis gsum char bya bar mi rigs pas sgrub pa po gcig gis de kho na nyid dang / gsang ba dang gsang ba chen po rnams rim bzhin du bsgom par bya'o zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum nye bar bkod de /
translated: The three meditative stabilizations are set forth in order to understand this.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i rim pa ni 'og nas bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la yang 'di bzhin shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i rim pa ni 'og nas bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la yang 'di bzhin shes par bya ste /
translated: The stages of these meditative stabilizations should be understood in the same way as the meditative stabilizations that will be explained below.

original: la la ra de kho na nyid la sogs par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la la ra de kho na nyid la sogs par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are taught as reality and so forth.

original: de yang nye bar mtshon pa ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang nye bar mtshon pa ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the illustration is stated in “all meditative stabilizations” and so forth.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi zhes pa lha thams cad la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi stobs te thogs pa med pa'i nus pa rdzogs par byed pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi zhes pa lha thams cad la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi stobs te thogs pa med pa'i nus pa rdzogs par byed pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings shes par bya ba ste /
translated: The wisdom that fulfills the power of all meditative stabilizations, which is the nature of focusing on all deities, is to be known as the realm of phenomena.

original: de 'gengs shing rdzogs par byed pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni de'i ngo bos rnal 'byor pa'i sems la skyed par mdzad pa rnam par snang mdzad gang yin pa de la de skad bya ste /
analyzed: de 'gengs shing rdzogs par byed pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni de'i ngo bos rnal 'byor pa'i sems la skyed par mdzad pa rnam par snang mdzad gang yin pa de la de skad bya ste /
translated: The Bhagavān who fills and perfects that is Vairocana, who generates the yogi’s mind with that nature.

original: de nyid la dmigs pa'i don 'dis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid la dmigs pa'i don 'dis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: This is called “meditative stabilization” because it benefits migrating beings by focusing on that.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bshad par sku gsung thugs kyi rim pa dang rjes su mthun par 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ting nge 'dzin gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bshad par sku gsung thugs kyi rim pa dang rjes su mthun par 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ting nge 'dzin gsungs te /
translated: The meditative stabilizations of Vajrasattva and so forth are taught in accordance with the stages of body, speech, and mind.

original: aom zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes nyid yi ge aa zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes nyid yi ge aa zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The syllable oṃ is the wisdom of discernment itself, which should be understood as the syllable a.

original: thams cad du yang ye shes ji lta ba nyid gsang sngags kyi yi ge yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: thams cad du yang ye shes ji lta ba nyid gsang sngags kyi yi ge yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: And everywhere, the knowledge of reality is the mantra syllables.

original: tshig gi lam zhes bya ba ni lung gi chos ma lus pa'i ngo bo nyid du //
analyzed: tshig gi lam zhes bya ba ni lung gi chos ma lus pa'i ngo bo nyid du //
translated: The path of words is the nature of all the Dharma of transmission.

original: dbu rgyan thams cad mkhyen pas byas //
analyzed: dbu rgyan thams cad mkhyen pas byas //
translated: The crown ornament is made by the Omniscient One.

original: zhes bya ba la thams cad mkhyen pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la thams cad mkhyen pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The Omniscient One is Amitābha.

original: des dbu rgyan byas pa ni gtso bo'i rin po che'i dbu rgyan gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des dbu rgyan byas pa ni gtso bo'i rin po che'i dbu rgyan gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The crown ornament is made by him, and it is the principal one’s jeweled crown ornament.

original: gdan ni bzhi dang ldan zhes bya ba la zla ba'i gdan te nye bar mtshon pa 'dis ni gzhan dag gi yang gdan du zla ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gdan ni bzhi dang ldan zhes bya ba la zla ba'i gdan te nye bar mtshon pa 'dis ni gzhan dag gi yang gdan du zla ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The seat is endowed with four. The seat is the moon. By this example, the moon also appears as the seat of the others.

original: la la ni lha mo bzhi dang gdan gcig pas gdan ni bzhi dang ldan zhes bya ba'o zhes bya zer ro //
analyzed: la la ni lha mo bzhi dang gdan gcig pas gdan ni bzhi dang ldan zhes bya ba'o zhes bya zer ro //
translated: Some say that since there is one seat for the four goddesses, the seat is endowed with four.

original: phyag gnyis padma rnam par 'byed //
analyzed: phyag gnyis padma rnam par 'byed //
translated: The two-armed one opens the lotus.

original: ces bya ba ni g-yon pa'i padma'i khu tshur gyis padma'i sdong bu @206b g-yon pa'i sta zur gyi gnas su 'dzin la /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni g-yon pa'i padma'i khu tshur gyis padma'i sdong bu @206b g-yon pa'i sta zur gyi gnas su 'dzin la /
translated: The lotus is the left lotus fist, holding a lotus stalk at the left side of the hip.🔽 The right lotus is the right lotus fist, holding a lotus petal at the heart.

original: g-yas kyi padma khu tshur gyis rang gi snying gar padma'i 'dab ma 'byed pa la brtson pa ste 'dir de la blta zhing zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyi padma khu tshur gyis rang gi snying gar padma'i 'dab ma 'byed pa la brtson pa ste 'dir de la blta zhing zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The looking at that is the remainder of the verse.

original: yang tshig gi lam zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i chos ma lus pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: yang tshig gi lam zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i chos ma lus pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The path of speech is the essence of all the teachings of the Dharma.

original: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa thams cad ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa thams cad ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'o //
translated: The all aspects are the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks of a great being.

original: mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
translated: The supreme is the most excellent.

original: rgya che ba ni yul na gnas pa dang gsal ba dang rdzogs pa nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni yul na gnas pa dang gsal ba dang rdzogs pa nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The vast is the possession of the object, the abode, the clarity, and the perfection.

original: chos kyi rgyal po ni chos gnyis ka'i bdag po bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po ni chos gnyis ka'i bdag po bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
translated: The king of Dharma is the Lord of the Dharma, the Bhagavat Lokeśvara.🔽 🔽The Dharma is the path of the perfections.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The meditative stabilization that has that as its object is called that.

original: h'um zhes bya ba ni me long lta bu'i ye shes yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba ni me long lta bu'i ye shes yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: The syllable HUM is the mirror-like intuition.

original: mthing shun bzang po zhes bya ba ni sku mdog mthing shun lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthing shun bzang po zhes bya ba ni sku mdog mthing shun lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The excellent blue-green color means that the color is like blue-green.

original: sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs cod pan can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs cod pan can //
translated: The crown of the Buddha Akshobhya

original: zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa cod pan la bzhugs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa cod pan la bzhugs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: means that he is the one who is crowned with Akshobhya.

original: 'dis ni shar du mi bskyod pa bri bar bya'o zhes gang bshad pa der rdo rje sems dpa'i 'bri bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni shar du mi bskyod pa bri bar bya'o zhes gang bshad pa der rdo rje sems dpa'i 'bri bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: This means that the one who is explained as being drawn in the east as Akshobhya should be drawn as Vajrasattva.

original: dbu rgyan thams cad mkhyen pas byas //
analyzed: dbu rgyan thams cad mkhyen pas byas //
translated: The crown is made by the Omniscient One

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'od dpag med kyi gnas su yang 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'od dpag med kyi gnas su yang 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
translated: means that in the place of Amitabha, one should draw Lokeshvara.

original: 'di dag gi rjes su 'brangs pas rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i gnas su yang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pas dbang bskur ba dang / shin tu 'brel ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba gnyis bri ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi rjes su 'brangs pas rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i gnas su yang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pas dbang bskur ba dang / shin tu 'brel ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba gnyis bri ste /
translated: Following these, one should draw two cakravartins who are very closely related to the Tathāgatas Vairocana and Amoghasiddhi, in the places of Ratnasaṃbhava and Amoghasiddhi.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i mi bskyod pa //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i mi bskyod pa //
translated: Vajrasattva is Akṣobhya,

original: rdo rje rin chen dgos 'dod 'byung //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen dgos 'dod 'byung //
translated: Vajraratna is the fulfiller of wishes,

original: rdo rje chos ni 'jig rten dbang //
analyzed: rdo rje chos ni 'jig rten dbang //
translated: Vajradharma is Lokanātha,

original: rdo rje las ni rab sgrub stsol //
analyzed: rdo rje las ni rab sgrub stsol //
translated: Vajrakarma is the one who accomplishes well.

original: zhes gsungs pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nyid mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sgrar bshad pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nyid mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sgrar bshad pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: Thus, there is no fault in explaining Vajrasattva and so on as Akṣobhya and so on.

original: rol pa'i stabs su legs par bzhugs //
analyzed: rol pa'i stabs su legs par bzhugs //
translated: They are well-seated in the posture of sport.

original: zhes bya ba ni stan gyi nang du mtho gang gis mchod par rkang pa bzhag nas phyogs gnyis su brkyang ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stan gyi nang du mtho gang gis mchod par rkang pa bzhag nas phyogs gnyis su brkyang ste /
translated: This means that having placed the feet on the seat, which is a cubit inside, one should extend them in two directions,

original: g-yon phyogs cung zad dbab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid can te des gnas pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon phyogs cung zad dbab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid can te des gnas pa'o //
translated: and lower the left side a little. This is the definition. One should remain in that posture.

original: la la na re gang rnal 'byor dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas pas 'dug par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la na re gang rnal 'byor dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas pas 'dug par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: One should abide in a state that is in accord with yoga.

original: de ltar kun du khyab pa nyid //
analyzed: de ltar kun du khyab pa nyid //
translated: Thus, it is all-pervading.

original: ces bya ba 'dir de dag gis zhes nye bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dir de dag gis zhes nye bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the word “their” should be supplied.

original: @207a * // de bzhin du rigs la sogs pa rnams la yang de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: @207a * // de bzhin du rigs la sogs pa rnams la yang de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood in the same way with regard to the family, etc.

original: rga shi rnams kyi pha rol 'gro //
analyzed: rga shi rnams kyi pha rol 'gro //
translated: It goes beyond old age and death.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dang bral ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dang bral ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it is free from them.

original: sems chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems chen po ni gnyis kyis dben pa'o //
analyzed: sems chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems chen po ni gnyis kyis dben pa'o //
translated: The great mind, etc. The great mind is the absence of duality.

original: de'i rdzogs par byed pa ni gdul bya rnams kyi sems rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba nyid du gnas pa'i mi bden pa'i kun du rtog pa bsal ba de ltar rdzogs shing don de kun nas mthar phyin par byed pa de'i stobs te nus pa gang yin
analyzed: de'i rdzogs par byed pa ni gdul bya rnams kyi sems rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba nyid du gnas pa'i mi bden pa'i kun du rtog pa bsal ba de ltar rdzogs shing don de kun nas mthar phyin par byed pa de'i stobs te nus pa gang yin
translated: Its perfection is the removal of unreal imagination in the minds of those to be trained, which is the natural purification of the mind. The power of that perfection, i.e. the completion of that aim, is the ability to manifest the Dharma body.

original: pa de nyid mtha' yas pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje'i rgyal po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rgyal po ste /
analyzed: pa de nyid mtha' yas pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje'i rgyal po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rgyal po ste /
translated: That very king is the nature of the King of Concentrations, the Vajra King, and so on, which are infinite.

original: gtso bor gyur pa bcom ldan 'das thugs rdo rje de ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa bcom ldan 'das thugs rdo rje de ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavat, the mind vajra, is the king, the principal one, because he teaches that.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje thugs te sems can gyi don bya ba la 'jug pa la thogs pa med pa'i pha rol gnon pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje thugs te sems can gyi don bya ba la 'jug pa la thogs pa med pa'i pha rol gnon pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very one is the vajra mind, because he has the perfection of unobstructed engagement in the performance of the aims of sentient beings.

original: de la dmigs pas na ting nge 'dzin de la ming de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pas na ting nge 'dzin de la ming de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The concentration is named after its object.

original: tram gi ye shes las bsgrubs pa //
analyzed: tram gi ye shes las bsgrubs pa //
translated: Established from the wisdom of tram.

original: zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid yi ye shes yi ge tram ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid yi ye shes yi ge tram ste /
translated: The wisdom of equality is the syllable tram.

original: de las bsgrubs pa ni de bzhin du gzhan dag gis ji lta ba bzhin du 'di nyid bsgoms pas 'tshang rgya ba nyid thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las bsgrubs pa ni de bzhin du gzhan dag gis ji lta ba bzhin du 'di nyid bsgoms pas 'tshang rgya ba nyid thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Established from that means that by meditating on just that, as the others do, one attains the very state of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang 'bras bu nye bar len pa'i gzhir gyur pas na lha rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs su gdags te /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang 'bras bu nye bar len pa'i gzhir gyur pas na lha rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs su gdags te /
translated: Likewise, in all cases, the form is designated in accordance with the gods, because it serves as the basis for the result to be appropriated.

original: gdul bya rnams 'bras bu la gzhol bas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams 'bras bu la gzhol bas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Since the disciples are engaged in the result, they are engaged in the form.

original: rin chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rin chen ni rin po che'i rigs so //
analyzed: rin chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rin chen ni rin po che'i rigs so //
translated: The jewel and so on. The jewel is the jewel family.

original: rin chen mngon par mtho ba zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rin chen mngon par mtho ba zhes bya ba ni gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
translated: The jewel elevation is the arising of the complete fulfillment of the wishes of the disciples.

original: de'i ye shes ni des bskyed pa ste ye shes kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu stsol bas rin chen 'byung ldan te /
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni des bskyed pa ste ye shes kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu stsol bas rin chen 'byung ldan te /
translated: His wisdom is generated by that, and it is the cause of the result of the accumulation of wisdom. Therefore, it is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la yang ming de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la yang ming de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That samādhi is also called by that name.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //🔽kham gi ye shes las bsgrubs pa //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to // kham gi ye shes las bsgrubs pa //
translated: The observation of that and so on have been explained.🔽The wisdom of the syllable khaṃ is the wisdom of accomplishment.

original: zhes bya ba la ye shes ni bya ba nan tan sgrub pa ste de nyid yi ge kham yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ye shes ni bya ba nan tan sgrub pa ste de nyid yi ge kham yin no //
translated: The wisdom is the accomplishment of activities, and that itself is the syllable khaṃ.

original: kham gi yi shes las bsgrubs pa ni nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kham gi yi shes las bsgrubs pa ni nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The one who is accomplished from the knowledge of morsels is the one who has gone forth.

original: ting 'dzin phyag rgyas legs zhugs pa //
analyzed: ting 'dzin phyag rgyas legs zhugs pa //
translated: Well-engaged with the seal of samadhi,

original: zhes bya ba ni ji srid du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bsam gtan gyi phyag rgyas shin tu legs par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji srid du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bsam gtan gyi phyag rgyas shin tu legs par zhugs pa'o //
translated: means well-engaged with the seal of samadhi, which has the characteristics explained above.

original: marka ta ste yi 'od @207b ltar 'bar //
analyzed: marka ta ste yi 'od @207b ltar 'bar //
translated: Blazing with the light of a cat’s eye,

original: zhes bya ba ni sku mdog mar ka ta'i 'od 'bar ba ste ljang gu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku mdog mar ka ta'i 'od 'bar ba ste ljang gu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the color of the body is blazing with the light of a cat’s eye, which means green.

original: la la dag ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor ma ra ka ta lta bu'o zhes zer mod kyi de ni mi rigs te bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mdog 'chad pa'i skabs yin gyi 'od ni ma yin no //
analyzed: la la dag ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor ma ra ka ta lta bu'o zhes zer mod kyi de ni mi rigs te bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mdog 'chad pa'i skabs yin gyi 'od ni ma yin no //
translated: Some say the orb of light is like a cat’s eye, but that is not correct, because this is the section on the color of the Bhagavan’s body, not on his light.

original: legs par 'grub phyir slar yang sdud //
analyzed: legs par 'grub phyir slar yang sdud //
translated: In order to accomplish well, he gathers them back again.

original: ces bya ba ni sems dbang du gyur pa legs par 'grub pa'i phyir spros pa rnams slar nye bar sdud pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sems dbang du gyur pa legs par 'grub pa'i phyir spros pa rnams slar nye bar sdud pa ste /
translated: In order to accomplish well the mind under control, he gathers back the emanations.

original: 'di yang rnal 'byor pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnal 'byor pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is also explained in order to teach the stages of yoga.

original: 'di'i 'og ma rnams la yang 'di bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'og ma rnams la yang 'di bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The following should be understood in the same way as this.

original: 'od zer chen pos rab gsal zhing //
analyzed: 'od zer chen pos rab gsal zhing //
translated: Illuminated by great light,

original: zhes bya ba la 'od zer chen po ni ye shes kyi snang ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa'i chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'od zer chen po ni ye shes kyi snang ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa'i chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Great light is the Dharma Body of the Blessed One Amoghasiddhi, because it is the essence of the illumination of intuition.🔽Similar to that is the enjoyment body, which is the cause of that, and which is the cause of that.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni de'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i tshul 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni de'i rgyu mthun pa las byung ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i tshul 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the one who takes up the mode of that.

original: nam mkha'i snying po ni nam mkha'i skye gnas can no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po ni nam mkha'i skye gnas can no //
translated: Akasa-garbha is the one who has the womb of space.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid dang / thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa nyid la sogs pas mnyam pas na nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid dang / thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa nyid la sogs pas mnyam pas na nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Equal to space means equal to space because of non-conceptuality, pervasiveness, being the abode of all, and so on.

original: gtan tshigs de nyid kyis na 'du byed thams cad spangs pa'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de nyid kyis na 'du byed thams cad spangs pa'i zhes bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is said to be the abandonment of all formations.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nam mkha' dang mnyam par 'du byed thams cad kyi go 'byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nam mkha' dang mnyam par 'du byed thams cad kyi go 'byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: In the phrase “like space,” etc., it is the space-like openness of all things that are conditioned.

original: de nyid ni bya bsgrub pa'i ye shes yongs su gyur pa las byung bas /
analyzed: de nyid ni bya bsgrub pa'i ye shes yongs su gyur pa las byung bas /
translated: That is the gnosis of successful activity, which arises from the transformation of the gnosis of successful activity.

original: ye shes kyi rdo rje ni bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rdo rje ni bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The vajra of gnosis is the Bhagavat Amoghasiddhi.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “having that as its object,” etc., has been explained.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brangs nas 'dir rigs kyis bsdus pa'i ye shes kyi cha rnams yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brangs nas 'dir rigs kyis bsdus pa'i ye shes kyi cha rnams yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Following the gnosis of Vairochana, etc., one should understand that here the aspects of gnosis are included in the families.

original: rgyan zhes bya ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i tshul gyis mnyes par byed pa'o //🔽'od dmar 'od zer phreng ba can //
analyzed: rgyan zhes bya ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i tshul gyis mnyes par byed pa'o // 'od dmar 'od zer phreng ba can //
translated: “ Ornament” means to please by the method of the pledge seal.🔽Red light, garland of light rays.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'od dmar po dang 'od kyi phreng ba dmar po gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'od dmar po dang 'od kyi phreng ba dmar po gang la yod pa'o //
translated: Red light and a garland of red light rays.

original: de bas na de ni lha rnams 'jigs pas sems myos te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na de ni lha rnams 'jigs pas sems myos te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the gods, frightened, are crazed in mind.

original: gang gis lha rnams ni lag pa thal mo sbyar bar byed ces bya ba ste lag pa gnyis kyi sor mo thams cad kun nas thal mo sbyar ba byas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces @208a * //
analyzed: gang gis lha rnams ni lag pa thal mo sbyar bar byed ces bya ba ste lag pa gnyis kyi sor mo thams cad kun nas thal mo sbyar ba byas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces @208a * //
translated: By which the gods join their palms means that all the fingers of both hands are joined in the gesture of prayer.

original: bya'o // byang chub yan lag 'bras brgyan pa'i //🔽zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi yan lag ni sbyin pa la sogs pa 'am byang chub kyi yan lag bdun no //🔽de'i 'bras bu ni 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // byang chub yan lag 'bras brgyan pa'i // zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi yan lag ni sbyin pa la sogs pa 'am byang chub kyi yan lag bdun no // de'i 'bras bu ni 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The fruit of the branches of enlightenment is Buddhahood.

original: de nyid ni rgyan te snying po yin la de rtog pa'i sbyor ba las yang dag par 'byung ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste de bas na de bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rgyan te snying po yin la de rtog pa'i sbyor ba las yang dag par 'byung ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste de bas na de bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The ornament is the essence of that fruit. The origin is the origination of that ornament from the application of imagination. Therefore, it should be cultivated.

original: ye shes kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ye shes ni chos bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ye shes ni chos bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Wisdom is the realitylessness of things.🔽 The jewel is the mind of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the jewel of the Buddha.

original: spyan ni chos rnams gnyis su med pa dang dben par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis snang bar byed pa ni so sor snang ba'i ye shes te /
analyzed: spyan ni chos rnams gnyis su med pa dang dben par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis snang bar byed pa ni so sor snang ba'i ye shes te /
translated: The eye is the wisdom of individual discernment, which illuminates the nonduality and voidness of all phenomena.

original: de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pas mi shigs pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pas mi shigs pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: It is a vajra because it is indestructible by the concepts of subject and object.

original: de'i 'jo tshul ni rnam par rol pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'jo tshul ni rnam par rol pa ste /
translated: Its play is the sport.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir sngon gyi 'phen shugs kyi sbyor bas mdzad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir sngon gyi 'phen shugs kyi sbyor bas mdzad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the activity that is done by the momentum of previous impetus for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das yum sangs rgyas spyan de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yum sangs rgyas spyan de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The Bhagavat's mother is called Buddha Locana.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The phrase having that as its objective support and so on has been explained.

original: rdo rje'i gdan can zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i gdan la bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i gdan can zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i gdan la bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The phrase having a vajra seat means seated on a vajra seat,

original: rnam par mi g-yo ba'i gdan brnyes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yo ba'i gdan brnyes pa'i don to //
translated: which means having attained an unshakable seat.🔽Some say that it means seated in the manner of a person on a vajra seat,

original: la la dag na re rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rdo rje la skyes bu'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: la la dag na re rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rdo rje la skyes bu'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: that is, seated in the manner of a person on a pledge seal.

original: nye bar mtshon pa 'dis ni lha mo thams cad kyang tshul 'di nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa 'dis ni lha mo thams cad kyang tshul 'di nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: By this illustration, all the goddesses are also like this.

original: dgod cing zhes bya ba ni dbus dang g-yas kyi zhal lo //
analyzed: dgod cing zhes bya ba ni dbus dang g-yas kyi zhal lo //
translated: Laughing means the right and left faces.

original: zhal ras khro bag bcas zhes bya ba ni zhal dbus ma'i g-yon pa'i cha khro bag tu bcas la zhal gyi cha'i phyed ni dgod bag tu gnas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhal ras khro bag bcas zhes bya ba ni zhal dbus ma'i g-yon pa'i cha khro bag tu bcas la zhal gyi cha'i phyed ni dgod bag tu gnas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: With a wrathful face means that the left side of the central face is wrathful, and the left side of the face is smiling. This is what is meant by with a wrathful face and a smiling face.

original: shin tu gdug pa'i cig shos rnams tshar gcod pa dang rjes su gzung ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu gdug pa'i cig shos rnams tshar gcod pa dang rjes su gzung ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that he abides in the manner of subduing and protecting the other extremely violent ones.

original: g-yon pa bsdigs pa'i mdzub mo ste //
analyzed: g-yon pa bsdigs pa'i mdzub mo ste //
translated: The left is the threatening forefinger.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur las byung ba'i khro bo'i sdigs mdzub mdzad pas gnas shing de kho na nyid la gnas pas de gzigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur las byung ba'i khro bo'i sdigs mdzub mdzad pas gnas shing de kho na nyid la gnas pas de gzigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that he abides in the wrathful threatening gesture that arises from the left vajra fist, and that he sees reality by abiding in thatness.

original: dngos med dngos po'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: dngos med dngos po'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: The sign of existence is the characteristic of non-existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams med cing mig yor lta bu'i tshul gyis gzugs chen po'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid can khams gsum lta bu'i rnam par 'jug pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid can gang yin @208b pa de la de skad ces bya ste
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams med cing mig yor lta bu'i tshul gyis gzugs chen po'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid can khams gsum lta bu'i rnam par 'jug pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid can gang yin @208b pa de la de skad ces bya ste
translated: That is said of the mind and mental factors that are the nature of the great form of things, which is the characteristic of the entity of the great form of things, and which functions in the three realms in the manner of a magical creation, since things do not exist.

original: / don dam par ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / don dam par ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that ultimately it is the nature of nondual intuition.

original: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ni mos shing dang pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ni mos shing dang pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sems kyis so //
translated: Cultivate means with a mind that is devoted and in accord with devotion.

original: sgyu 'phrul zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgyu 'phrul ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sprul pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgyu 'phrul ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sprul pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Illusion means the nature of the emanations of the buddhas and so on.

original: de'i 'byung ba ni gdul bya rnams kyi skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'byung ba ni gdul bya rnams kyi skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa'o //
translated: Its origination is the teaching in accordance with the fortune of those to be trained.

original: de'i rgyu stobs kyi ye shes ni ye shes bcu'i stobs te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu stobs kyi ye shes ni ye shes bcu'i stobs te gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi nus pa'o //
translated: The intuition power of its cause is the power of the ten intuitions, the capacity of nondual intuition.

original: de dang ldan pa nyid ni bcom ldan 'das yum m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa nyid ni bcom ldan 'das yum m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: The Blessed Lady is endowed with that.

original: zab mo ni 'phags pa ma yin pas ngo bo nyid mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zab mo ni 'phags pa ma yin pas ngo bo nyid mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: The profound is not realized by the nature of the non-noble.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of having that as its object and so on has been explained.

original: mi 'jigs sbyin mdzad ma zhes bya ba ni phyag dang pos so //
analyzed: mi 'jigs sbyin mdzad ma zhes bya ba ni phyag dang pos so //
translated: The giver of fearlessness is with the first hand.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnams 'byung ba bsgom par gyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sku rnams 'byung ba nyid de de lta bu'i lus gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnams 'byung ba bsgom par gyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sku rnams 'byung ba nyid de de lta bu'i lus gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: You should meditate on the arising of the Buddha bodies means the arising of the Buddha bodies themselves. That which has such a body is called that.

original: sprul pa rnams sprul bar mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sprul pa rnams sprul bar mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means manifesting the emanations.

original: rin chen skur ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus rin po che ste 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rin chen skur ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus rin po che ste 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the jewel body means in one's own body, which is a jewel. This is the teaching on the union of non-duality.

original: gnyis su sbyor ba'i ming yang 'di nyid las nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su sbyor ba'i ming yang 'di nyid las nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: The name of the union of the two should be illustrated by this very [verse].

original: padma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la padma'i gzugs kyis ni /
analyzed: padma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la padma'i gzugs kyis ni /
translated: In the lotus and so on. With the form of a lotus,

original: ji ltar padma rab dmar yang //
analyzed: ji ltar padma rab dmar yang //
translated: Just as a very red lotus,

original: zhes bya ba'i dpes bstan pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dpes bstan pas na /
translated: because of the example that is taught,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: it is through the nature of the doors of liberation of passion, etc.

original: rnam par rol pa ni sems can gyi don gyi phyir rnam par brtse ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rol pa ni sems can gyi don gyi phyir rnam par brtse ba'o //
translated: Play is the affection for the sake of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: des sangs rgyas rnams kyis sam sangs rgyas rnams bzhin du rgyal mtshan nyid can thob cing bsnyes pa ste yum gos dkar mo gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas rnams kyis sam sangs rgyas rnams bzhin du rgyal mtshan nyid can thob cing bsnyes pa ste yum gos dkar mo gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: By that, the Buddhas or the Buddhas themselves obtain the banner, which is the mother Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and are seated.

original: de nyid ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na ye shes rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na ye shes rdo rje'o //
translated: That itself is the essence of indivisible intuition, therefore it is the intuition-vajra.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “having that as its object,” etc., has been explained.

original: sgeg pa'i cha lugs la gnas pa //
analyzed: sgeg pa'i cha lugs la gnas pa //
translated: Dwelling in the mode of flirtation,

original: zhes bya ba ni cung zad bzhad pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni cung zad bzhad pa'i tshul can no //
translated: means having the manner of a slight smile.

original: ma ra ka ta'i 'od dang ldan //
analyzed: ma ra ka ta'i 'od dang ldan //
translated: Possessing the radiance of a ruby,

original: zhes bya ba ni ma ra ka ta lta bu'i 'od zer gyi mdangs gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma ra ka ta lta bu'i 'od zer gyi mdangs gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which has the radiance of light rays like a ruby is so called.

original: sku mdog ljang gu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku mdog ljang gu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “green-colored body” is the meaning of “green-colored body.”

original: sangs rgyas spro ba kun du 'khrug //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spro ba kun du 'khrug //
translated: The buddhas are agitated.

original: ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyang yin la spro bar mdzad pa yin pas na de la de skad ces bya ste de rnams kyi sku la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyang yin la spro bar mdzad pa yin pas na de la de skad ces bya ste de rnams kyi sku la khyab pa'o //
translated: The buddhas are so called because they are buddhas and they are agitated. They pervade the bodies of those.

original: @209a * // sems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la sems can thams cad dbang du byas pa de la rag las pa nyid kyi thugs rje chen po'i stobs kyis bzhud cing 'gro bas na de la de skad ces bya la /
analyzed: @209a * // sems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la sems can thams cad dbang du byas pa de la rag las pa nyid kyi thugs rje chen po'i stobs kyis bzhud cing 'gro bas na de la de skad ces bya la /
translated: The sentient beings, etc. , are so called because they go, i.e., proceed, by the power of great compassion that is dependent on the control of all sentient beings.

original: ngo bo nyid de la mngon par dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i sems can rnams smin cing dga' bar byed pa ste de nyid ni ye shes kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de la mngon par dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i sems can rnams smin cing dga' bar byed pa ste de nyid ni ye shes kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: The sentient beings who delight in that nature ripen and delight the yogins. That itself is the gnosis vajra.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “object” has been explained.

original: sems ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje sems ma dang / rdo rje rin chen ma dang rdo rje chos ma dang rdo rje las ma'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje sems ma dang / rdo rje rin chen ma dang rdo rje chos ma dang rdo rje las ma'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Vajrarati, Vajraratna, Vajradharma, and Vajrakarma.

original: rol pas rjes su mnyes mdzad ma //
analyzed: rol pas rjes su mnyes mdzad ma //
translated: She delights in play.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgeg pa dang rjes su mthun pas rol par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgeg pa dang rjes su mthun pas rol par mdzad pa'o //
translated: She delights in play, because she is in accord with the mood of passion.

original: ji ltar rigs pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag po'i sa bon las bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag po'i sa bon las bsgrub pa ste /
translated: As is appropriate, i.e., as is proper, she is produced from the seed of her Lord.

original: kha dog dang gzugs dang phyag mtshan yang de dang 'dra ba 'chang las rdo rje sems ma dang / rdo rje chos la nu ma 'dzin pa med pa de'i phyag gnyis pas sdigs mdzub dang zhags pa 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang gzugs dang phyag mtshan yang de dang 'dra ba 'chang las rdo rje sems ma dang / rdo rje chos la nu ma 'dzin pa med pa de'i phyag gnyis pas sdigs mdzub dang zhags pa 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: She holds the same color, form, and insignia as he. But Vajrarati and Vajradharma do not hold breasts, and in their two other hands they hold a threatening forefinger and a noose.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste de thabs dang shes rab kyi bden pas dga' zhing mnyes par byed pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste de thabs dang shes rab kyi bden pas dga' zhing mnyes par byed pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The four noble truths, etc. The four noble truths are Akshobhya, etc. , and they are delighted and pleased by the truth of means and insight.

original: de la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the object, etc. , has been explained.

original: sku gsum rgyal ba bye ba phrag bdun gyis zhes bya ba ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyal ba bye ba phrag bdun gyis yang dag par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum rgyal ba bye ba phrag bdun gyis zhes bya ba ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyal ba bye ba phrag bdun gyis yang dag par ston pa'o //
translated: The seven hundred million victors of the three bodies, etc. , means that the seven hundred million victors of the nature of the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, and the Apparition Body, teach.

original: gsang sngags glu yis zhes bya ba la ni gsang sngags gsungs pas so //
analyzed: gsang sngags glu yis zhes bya ba la ni gsang sngags gsungs pas so //
translated: By the song of the secret mantra, etc. , means by the utterance of the secret mantra.

original: bstod ces bya ba ni rnam par mkhyen zhing bsngags par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bstod ces bya ba ni rnam par mkhyen zhing bsngags par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Praise means to know and to praise.

original: yi ge dgu pa zhes bya ba ni aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gsang sngags kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge dgu pa zhes bya ba ni aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gsang sngags kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nine-syllable, etc. , means that it is the nature of the secret mantra beginning with Om.

original: thabs dgu can zhes bya ba ni /🔽sgeg pa dpa' ba mi sdug pa //
analyzed: thabs dgu can zhes bya ba ni / sgeg pa dpa' ba mi sdug pa //
translated: The nine methods are🔽the nine dramatic sentiments.🔽The nine dramatic sentiments are

original: dgod dang khro dang 'jigs rung dang // snying rje rngam dang zhi ba ni //🔽gar thabs dgu ru shes par bya //
analyzed: dgod dang khro dang 'jigs rung dang // snying rje rngam dang zhi ba ni // gar thabs dgu ru shes par bya //
translated: erotic, comic, pathetic, furious, heroic, terrifying, wondrous, frightening, and peaceful.

original: zhes bya ba ste de rnams gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /🔽gdul bya rnams kyi bsam pa'i bye brag gis de dag dang ldan pas de skad gsungs pa yin no //🔽lha dgu yis ni gnas su mdzad //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste de rnams gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste / gdul bya rnams kyi bsam pa'i bye brag gis de dag dang ldan pas de skad gsungs pa yin no // lha dgu yis ni gnas su mdzad //
translated: One who has these is called a master of the nine dramatic sentiments.🔽The nine deities are

original: ces bya ba ni lha dgus bzhir mdzad pa'i rgyal ba'i gnas gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni lha dgus bzhir mdzad pa'i rgyal ba'i gnas gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: the nine deities who are the abode of the Victorious One.

original: don gyis @209b ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyis @209b ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what it means.

original: aom las spyi bor rnam par snang mdzad de ser po /
analyzed: aom las spyi bor rnam par snang mdzad de ser po /
translated: From the syllable Om, Vairochana is in the head, yellow.

original: tsa las mig tu 'khor los sgyur ba ste ser po /
analyzed: tsa las mig tu 'khor los sgyur ba ste ser po /
translated: From the syllable Cha, Chakravartin is in the eyes, yellow.

original: le las mgrin par mi g-yo ba ste nag po /
analyzed: le las mgrin par mi g-yo ba ste nag po /
translated: From the syllable Le, Achala is in the throat, black.

original: tsu las snying gar btsug na nor bu ste dmar po /
analyzed: tsu las snying gar btsug na nor bu ste dmar po /
translated: From the syllable Tsu, Tsukanishvara is in the heart, red.

original: le las dpung mgor don yod pa'i zhags pa ste nag po /
analyzed: le las dpung mgor don yod pa'i zhags pa ste nag po /
translated: From La, on the shoulders, Amogha-pāśa, black.

original: cu las lta bar skul byed ma ste /
analyzed: cu las lta bar skul byed ma ste /
translated: From Ca, on the eyes, Akṣobhya-devī,

original: dmar po / de las brla gnyis su rdo rje 'chad ba ste nag po /
analyzed: dmar po / de las brla gnyis su rdo rje 'chad ba ste nag po /
translated: red. From Da, on the thighs, Vajra-dharā, black.

original: sv'a las byin pa gnyis su ral pa gcig ma ste nag po /
analyzed: sv'a las byin pa gnyis su ral pa gcig ma ste nag po /
translated: From Swa, on the hips, Ekacāriṇī, black.

original: h'a las rkang pa gnyis kyi steng du rdo rje sen mo can dkar po ste de dag bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: h'a las rkang pa gnyis kyi steng du rdo rje sen mo can dkar po ste de dag bzhugs pa'o //
translated: From Ha, on the feet, Vajra-nakha, white.

original: ston ka'i 'dam bu'i mdog ces bya ba ni sku mdog ston ka'i 'dam bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽na chud skal ldan dar la bab //
analyzed: ston ka'i 'dam bu'i mdog ces bya ba ni sku mdog ston ka'i 'dam bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to // na chud skal ldan dar la bab //
translated: She is the color of autumnal lotuses, that is, her body is the color of autumnal lotuses.🔽She is in the prime of youth,

original: ces bya ba ni na tshod gzhon zhing dar la bab pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni na tshod gzhon zhing dar la bab pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: that is, she is in the prime of youth.

original: rig sngags thams cad sgrol mdzad ma //
analyzed: rig sngags thams cad sgrol mdzad ma //
translated: She is the deliverer of all vidyā mantras,

original: zhes bya ba ni lha mo thams cad kyi nang na yum 'di ni shin tu yang sems can rnams sgrol bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha mo thams cad kyi nang na yum 'di ni shin tu yang sems can rnams sgrol bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is, of all goddesses, this mother is the one who delivers sentient beings.

original: zhal dang po ni sku mdog dang mthun la g-yas g-yon gnas pa'i zhal gnyis kyi sku mdog bstan pa ni zhal dbus ma ni sku'i mdog can nyid yin te thams cad du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: zhal dang po ni sku mdog dang mthun la g-yas g-yon gnas pa'i zhal gnyis kyi sku mdog bstan pa ni zhal dbus ma ni sku'i mdog can nyid yin te thams cad du yang de bzhin no //
translated: The first face is the same color as the body. The colors of the two faces on the right and left are taught. The central face is the same color as the body. This is the same in all cases.

original: mche ba zla ba tshes pa 'dra //
analyzed: mche ba zla ba tshes pa 'dra //
translated: The fangs are like the crescent moon.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshes gcig gi zla ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshes gcig gi zla ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the moon of the first day.

original: ljags ni glog bzhin skyod par mdzad //
analyzed: ljags ni glog bzhin skyod par mdzad //
translated: The tongue flickers like lightning.

original: ces bya ba ni lce glog ltar g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni lce glog ltar g-yo ba'o //
translated: This is the tongue moving like lightning.

original: tshems kyis sgrogs gnon rnam par gdangs //
analyzed: tshems kyis sgrogs gnon rnam par gdangs //
translated: The teeth are even and well-aligned.

original: zhes bya ni ma mchu'i sgros tshems kyis mnan pas rnam par gdangs pa ni cung zad gdangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ni ma mchu'i sgros tshems kyis mnan pas rnam par gdangs pa ni cung zad gdangs pa'o //
translated: This is the lower lip pressed by the teeth, so it is well-aligned, slightly open.

original: rtsa ba'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pas so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pas so //
translated: The root mudra is explained below.

original: se gol gtogs zhes bya ba ni ba dan gsum pa'i phyag gis se gol gtogs pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: se gol gtogs zhes bya ba ni ba dan gsum pa'i phyag gis se gol gtogs pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The snapping of the fingers is the snapping of the fingers with the third hand.

original: stod g-yogs pang par rnam par bcings //
analyzed: stod g-yogs pang par rnam par bcings //
translated: The upper garment is wrapped around the lap.

original: zhes bya ba ni steng nas bla gos gyon pa pang bar bcings zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni steng nas bla gos gyon pa pang bar bcings zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of wearing the upper robe on the upper part of the body is binding it to the lap.

original: cho 'phrul rnams pa sna tshogs dang // zhes bya ba ni kun brjod pa la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de dang ngo //🔽thal mo sbyor bar byed la brtson //
analyzed: cho 'phrul rnams pa sna tshogs dang // zhes bya ba ni kun brjod pa la sogs pa'i cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de dang ngo // thal mo sbyor bar byed la brtson //
translated: The various kinds of miracles are the various kinds of miracles such as the miracle of instruction.

original: zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyor ba'o //
translated: He is intent on joining the palms means he is intent on joining the palms.

original: la la na re lag pa sbyar ba byas pa'o //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la na re lag pa sbyar ba byas pa'o // zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say he is intent on joining the hands,🔽but others say he is intent on joining the arms.

original: rgyal ba mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyal ba mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Blessed One is called the mother of the victors in the verse that begins with the victors are infinite.

original: rgyal ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The victors are Vairochana and so forth.

original: mtha' yas pa ni tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa ni tshad med pa'o //
translated: They are infinite, meaning they are immeasurable.

original: @210a * // de rnams kyi ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga ste /
analyzed: @210a * // de rnams kyi ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga ste /
translated: Their wisdom is the five wisdoms such as the wisdom of the dharmadhatu.

original: de las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das yum skul byed ma la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das yum skul byed ma la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One who arises from that is also called the mother of the victors.

original: de nyid ni stobs te des lha dgu'i tshogs kyi rdo rje gdug pa rnams las rnam par rgyal bas na de skad ces bya ste de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid ni stobs te des lha dgu'i tshogs kyi rdo rje gdug pa rnams las rnam par rgyal bas na de skad ces bya ste de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the words “observing that” and so forth has been explained.

original: gser gyi mdog dang ldan zhes bya ba ni ser po'o //
analyzed: gser gyi mdog dang ldan zhes bya ba ni ser po'o //
translated: “Having the color of gold” means yellow.

original: rol stang stabs kyis gnas pas gnon //
analyzed: rol stang stabs kyis gnas pas gnon //
translated: He tramples with the dance-pose.

original: zhes bya ba ni rol pa'i stang stabs kyi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad pa ste de nyid ni gzhir gyur pas gnas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rol pa'i stang stabs kyi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad pa ste de nyid ni gzhir gyur pas gnas te /
translated: The nature of the dance-pose has been explained above. It is the basis, since it is the foundation.

original: des gnon cing bdag gis mdzad pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: des gnon cing bdag gis mdzad pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: He tramples with it, and whatever he does is called that.

original: rol pa'i stang stabs kyis bzhugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rol pa'i stang stabs kyis bzhugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he abides in the dance-pose.

original: sangs rgyas sprin spros thob par mdzad //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprin spros thob par mdzad //
translated: He causes the cloud of Buddhas to rain down.

original: ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sprin spros pas thob par mdzad ces bya ba gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi kye shes skyed par mdzad pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sprin spros pas thob par mdzad ces bya ba gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi kye shes skyed par mdzad pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He causes the cloud of Buddhas to rain down means that he causes the cloud of Buddhas to rain down, and he causes the knowledge of the beings to be trained to arise.

original: chos mdzod ces bya ba ni ye shes rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos mdzod ces bya ba ni ye shes rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “jewel of the Dharma” is that it is the source of the jewel of knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas rin chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprin ni tshogs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rin chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprin ni tshogs so //
translated: The “jewel of the Buddhas” is the cloud of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprin de'i ye shes ji skad du bshad pa ni rnyed par dka' bas na rin po che ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprin de'i ye shes ji skad du bshad pa ni rnyed par dka' bas na rin po che ste /
translated: The knowledge of that cloud of the Buddhas is a jewel because it is difficult to obtain.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprin ye shes de nyid la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprin ye shes de nyid la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That very cloud of the Buddhas is knowledge, and it is called a jewel.

original: des sngon gyi smon lam nye bar bsags pas snang bar gyur cing 'gro ba ma lus pa'i yid la 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pa nyid du so sor snang bar byed pa ste rin chen sgrol ma la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des sngon gyi smon lam nye bar bsags pas snang bar gyur cing 'gro ba ma lus pa'i yid la 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pa nyid du so sor snang bar byed pa ste rin chen sgrol ma la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is the light of the accumulation of former vows, and it is the manifestation of the fulfillment of the aims desired in the minds of all beings. The jewel of the moon is called “Tārā” because it is the savior of all beings.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the term “object” and so on has already been explained.

original: ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od dang mtshungs //
analyzed: ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od dang mtshungs //
translated: It is like the light of the autumn moon.

original: zhes bya ba ni dkar ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkar ba'o //
translated: It is white.

original: padma la bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni padma de la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: padma la bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni padma de la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Seated on a lotus means seated on that lotus.

original: gal te de skad bshad mod kyi 'o na kyang padma'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te bskyed pa'i rim pa las byung ba'i yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rol pa'i stang stabs brtson pa ste //
analyzed: gal te de skad bshad mod kyi 'o na kyang padma'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te bskyed pa'i rim pa las byung ba'i yin pa'i phyir ro // rol pa'i stang stabs brtson pa ste //
translated: Even though it is explained in this way, nevertheless, it is on the lotus, on a moon disk, because it arises from the stage of generation.

original: zhes bya ba ni rol pa'i stang stabs kyis de la bzhugs nas gdug pa rnams zlog par mdzad pa la rab tu 'bad pas brtson par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rol pa'i stang stabs kyis de la bzhugs nas gdug pa rnams zlog par mdzad pa la rab tu 'bad pas brtson par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Striving with the gait of sport means that, seated there with the gait of sport, he strives, striving to avert the wicked.

original: rnam par blta ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs thams cad du gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par blta ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs thams cad du gzigs pa'o //
translated: Looking around means looking in all directions.

original: nyal dang zhes bya ba la 'dir ni 'khor lo'i sngags rnams yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: nyal dang zhes bya ba la 'dir ni 'khor lo'i sngags rnams yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Sleeping and so on means that here the wheel mantras should be understood.

original: @210b 'dis ni mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i rnal 'byor gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: @210b 'dis ni mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i rnal 'byor gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the yoga of non-equipoise.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la ser sna nye bar bsags pas rang gi sems nyid phyi dang nang gi bgegs rnams su snang ste de la 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la ser sna nye bar bsags pas rang gi sems nyid phyi dang nang gi bgegs rnams su snang ste de la 'jigs pa'o //
translated: In all fears, etc., one's own mind itself appears as external and internal obstacles due to the accumulation of stinginess, and one is afraid of them.

original: de 'jigs pa ni nye bar zhi ba ste /🔽de 'jigs par nus pa ni bdag dang bdag gir gnyis su rtog pa la kun du spyod pa la kun du 'dug pa'i ser sna spor bar nus pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de nyid ni rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de 'jigs pa ni nye bar zhi ba ste / de 'jigs par nus pa ni bdag dang bdag gir gnyis su rtog pa la kun du spyod pa la kun du 'dug pa'i ser sna spor bar nus pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de nyid ni rdo rje ste /
translated: That fear is pacified.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa nyid dang de thob pa'i thabs kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pas bcom ldan 'das yum khro gnyer can la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa nyid dang de thob pa'i thabs kyi bdag nyid can du gyur pas bcom ldan 'das yum khro gnyer can la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that is able to destroy that fear is the vajra, and since it has become the nature of that and the means of attaining it, the Blessed Lady Bhairava is also called that.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of observing that and so on has already been explained.

original: thams cad bcing ba bskyed pas te //
analyzed: thams cad bcing ba bskyed pas te //
translated: By generating all bonds,

original: zhes bya ba ni gdug pa thams cad kyi bcing ba ste bgegs byed pa'i nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gdug pa thams cad kyi bcing ba ste bgegs byed pa'i nus pa med pa'o //
translated: all bonds means the bonds of all evildoers, the inability to create obstacles.

original: de skyed par mdzad pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de skyed par mdzad pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is so called because he generates that.

original: de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na /
translated: By that very fact,

original: sems can ma lus des 'dul byed //
analyzed: sems can ma lus des 'dul byed //
translated: he is the tamer of all sentient beings.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te 'di yang rol pa'i stang stabs kyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te 'di yang rol pa'i stang stabs kyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: This also is the way of standing in the dance.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rdo rje sgrog ni mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rdo rje sgrog ni mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The vajra-lock, etc., is the characteristic of ignorance.

original: de'i 'gro ba ni ji ltar bcings pa 'di rnam par mi shigs par 'gyur zhes rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'gro ba ni ji ltar bcings pa 'di rnam par mi shigs par 'gyur zhes rtog pa ste /
translated: Its going is the thought, “How will this bondage become indestructible?”

original: bcom ldan 'das yum rdo rje lu gu rgyud la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yum rdo rje lu gu rgyud la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The Blessed Mother is called the vajra-chain.

original: de nyid ye shes rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid ye shes rdo rje'o //
translated: That very thing is the vajra of intuition.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “object,” etc., has been explained.

original: thub pa skyes mchog ces bya ba ni bar chad med par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: thub pa skyes mchog ces bya ba ni bar chad med par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The best of sages is the one who will become fully enlightened without interruption.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the best of the Tathāgatas.

original: sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du bzhugs //
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du bzhugs //
translated: He sits in the bodhisattva posture.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva sitting cross-legged.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' yi //
translated: The clouds of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: sprin rnams de bzhin 'phro bar mdzad //
analyzed: sprin rnams de bzhin 'phro bar mdzad //
translated: are likewise sent forth.🔽The clouds of the Buddhas, having the nature of the Buddhas, are sent forth, pervading the three realms, and likewise the clouds of the bodhisattvas are sent forth.

original: ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa'i sprin rnams kyis khams gsum khyab par mdzad pa dang de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sprin rnams kyang 'phro ba mdzad do zhes bya bar sbyar te bsgom par bya'o zhes ba ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa'i sprin rnams kyis khams gsum khyab par mdzad pa dang de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sprin rnams kyang 'phro ba mdzad do zhes bya bar sbyar te bsgom par bya'o zhes ba ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The word “are” is supplied.

original: byams pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byams pa'i stobs mnga' bas na byams pa'i stobs te 'phags pa byams pa'o //🔽ye shes nyid kyis bdud bzhi las @211a * //
analyzed: byams pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byams pa'i stobs mnga' bas na byams pa'i stobs te 'phags pa byams pa'o // ye shes nyid kyis bdud bzhi las @211a * //
translated: The one who has the power of love is the one with the power of love, i.e., the noble Maitreya.
