original: snon gnas pa la ye shes kyi sprin zhes bya ste de nyid rdo rje'o //
analyzed: snon gnas pa la ye shes kyi sprin zhes bya ste de nyid rdo rje'o //
translated: The cloud is the knowledge of the abode of the cloud. That very [knowledge] is the vajra.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of object and so on has been explained.

original: rta bdun ldan pa'i shing rtar zhugs //
analyzed: rta bdun ldan pa'i shing rtar zhugs //
translated: Seated in a chariot yoked with seven horses.

original: zhes bya ba ni rta bdun gshibs pa'i shing rta la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rta bdun gshibs pa'i shing rta la gnas pa'o //
translated: This means seated in a chariot yoked with seven horses.

original: 'bar pa'i dkyil 'khor snang mdzad pa //
analyzed: 'bar pa'i dkyil 'khor snang mdzad pa //
translated: Illuminating the mandala of blazing light.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor las byung pa'i 'od zer 'bar ba'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su rgyas pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor las byung pa'i 'od zer 'bar ba'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su rgyas pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: This means the mandala of blazing light that is the nature of the fully expanded light of the rays arising from the mandala of the sun.

original: phyogs bcu bsrung par brtson pa ste //
analyzed: phyogs bcu bsrung par brtson pa ste //
translated: He strives to protect the ten directions.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i gdug pa rnams las bsrung pa'i phyir brtson zhing rab tu 'bad par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i gdug pa rnams las bsrung pa'i phyir brtson zhing rab tu 'bad par mdzad pa'o //
translated: This means that he strives and exerts himself to protect from the wicked ones who dwell in the ten directions.

original: mig dang kha ni 'drub par byed //
analyzed: mig dang kha ni 'drub par byed //
translated: He blocks their eyes and mouths.

original: ces bya ba ni gdug pa rnams kyi mig dang kha 'drub par mdzad par bsgom par bya ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gdug pa rnams kyi mig dang kha 'drub par mdzad par bsgom par bya ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This means that he should meditate on blocking the eyes and mouths of the wicked ones, as before.

original: nye par spyod pa rnams spangs te //
analyzed: nye par spyod pa rnams spangs te //
translated: Having abandoned the enjoyments,

original: zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal la rnam pa thams cad du lha mo bsgom pas gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal la rnam pa thams cad du lha mo bsgom pas gnas par bya'o //
translated: this means that he should dwell in meditation on the goddess, having dispelled false conceptualization in every way.

original: h'um mdzad ces bya ba ni yi ge h'um gi skra legs par sgrogs pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: h'um mdzad ces bya ba ni yi ge h'um gi skra legs par sgrogs pa la brtson pa'o //
translated: Humkara means he is intent on the excellent proclamation of the syllable hum.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'od zer can gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'od zer can gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
translated: This means by the samadhi of Marichi.

original: dbang du zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dbang du zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis so //
translated: Under his control means under the control of that very yogin.

original: sdang ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la sdang ba thams cad kyis mi tshugs par byed pa ni gdug pa thams cad bzlog pa ste lha mo 'od zer can no //🔽de nyid ni thogs pa med cing mchog tu gyur pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas na ye shes kyi rdo rje mchog @217a * //
analyzed: sdang ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la sdang ba thams cad kyis mi tshugs par byed pa ni gdug pa thams cad bzlog pa ste lha mo 'od zer can no // de nyid ni thogs pa med cing mchog tu gyur pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas na ye shes kyi rdo rje mchog @217a * //
translated: With all hatreds and so forth, she who is not overcome by all hatreds is the one who wards off all evil, the goddess Marici.

original: rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: rab ces bya'o //
translated: She is called the supreme vajra of knowledge because she is endowed with unobstructed, supreme knowledge.

original: dmigs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //🔽de steng kha dog lnga po dag //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to // de steng kha dog lnga po dag //
translated: The meaning of visualization and so forth has been explained.🔽Above that, the Buddhas abiding in the five colors

original: rab tu 'dres pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs //
analyzed: rab tu 'dres pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs //
translated: are thoroughly mixed.

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te kha dog ser po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te kha dog ser po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five colors are yellow and so forth.

original: slar yang de la kha dog lnga'i //
analyzed: slar yang de la kha dog lnga'i //
translated: Again, in that, the Buddhas of the five colors

original: sangs rgyas bdud rtsi'i char 'bebs mdzad //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bdud rtsi'i char 'bebs mdzad //
translated: cause a rain of nectar to fall.

original: ces bya ba ni khro bo'i 'od 'bar bas gdon bsal pa'i sems can la rdo rje bdud rtsi'i chu'i bum pa phyag gnyis kyis 'dzin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dbang bskur bar bsam mo zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni khro bo'i 'od 'bar bas gdon bsal pa'i sems can la rdo rje bdud rtsi'i chu'i bum pa phyag gnyis kyis 'dzin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dbang bskur bar bsam mo zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of with the blazing light of the wrathful one is that one should imagine that the Tathagatas, holding in their two hands the vase of the water of vajra nectar, confer initiation upon the sentient beings who have been freed from the demons by the blazing light of the wrathful one.

original: nad thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la nad thams cad ni rims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nad thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la nad thams cad ni rims la sogs pa'o //
translated: All illnesses and so forth: all illnesses are fevers and so forth.

original: nye par zhi ba ni bsal ba ste de nus pa'i ye shes thogs pa med pa gang yin pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na ri khrod kyi shing lo can la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nye par zhi ba ni bsal ba ste de nus pa'i ye shes thogs pa med pa gang yin pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na ri khrod kyi shing lo can la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The pacification is the removal of those, and the unobstructed intuition which is capable of that is the vajra. One becomes of the nature of that, and so is called the one with the bark garment.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje 'bar pa'i gzugs can te mi bzad pa'i srung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje 'bar pa'i gzugs can te mi bzad pa'i srung ba'o //
translated: That very [intuition] has the form of a blazing vajra, and is the unendurable protection.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of observing that and so forth has been explained.

original: sprul mgo bdun gyi gdengs ka rgyas //
analyzed: sprul mgo bdun gyi gdengs ka rgyas //
translated: The one with the hood of seven snake heads,

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sprul mgo bdun gyi gdengs ka cod phan gyi steng du 'jogs pas rgyas shing khyad par gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

original: de nyid ni nor bu 'bar bas brgyan pa ste zhes bya ba ni sprul mgo rnams kyi steng na 'od 'bar ba de'i dbus na gnas pa'i nor bu las byung pa'i 'od zer mdzes pas 'bar pa'i nor bus rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni nor bu 'bar bas brgyan pa ste zhes bya ba ni sprul mgo rnams kyi steng na 'od 'bar ba de'i dbus na gnas pa'i nor bu las byung pa'i 'od zer mdzes pas 'bar pa'i nor bus rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: means that it is adorned with blazing jewels, which are beautiful light rays issuing from the jewels located in the middle of the blazing light of the snake heads.

original: 'od ni dmar po'i dkyil 'khor can //
analyzed: 'od ni dmar po'i dkyil 'khor can //
translated: It has a red light mandala.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dmar po 'bar pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dmar po 'bar pa'o //
translated: This means that it blazes with a red light mandala.

original: 'ja' rnams 'phro bas bskor pa ste //
analyzed: 'ja' rnams 'phro bas bskor pa ste //
translated: It is surrounded by rainbow light.

original: zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'phro ba'i 'ja' 'dra pa'i ye shes kyi phreng ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'phro ba'i 'ja' 'dra pa'i ye shes kyi phreng ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is so called because it is surrounded by a garland of wisdom, which is like a spreading rainbow.

original: kun nas 'bar ba rnams kyis khebs //
analyzed: kun nas 'bar ba rnams kyis khebs //
translated: It is covered with all blazing lights.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'bar pa'i tshogs kyis khebs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'bar pa'i tshogs kyis khebs pa'o //
translated: This means that it is covered with a mass of blazing light.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan 'phro pa phyag gi padma gnyis kyis yi ge bam las byung pa'i bum pa bdud rtsi'i chu sa yongs su gang ba'i zla ba'i mdog ltar dkar pa thogs par bsgom
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan 'phro pa phyag gi padma gnyis kyis yi ge bam las byung pa'i bum pa bdud rtsi'i chu sa yongs su gang ba'i zla ba'i mdog ltar dkar pa thogs par bsgom

analyzed: mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro // kha ni dza yis rnam brgyan pa //
translated: The mother and so forth means that one should meditate on the reflection of the Buddha's body emanating in that way, holding a vase arisen from the syllable vaṃ, completely filled with the water of nectar, white like the color of the moon, with both hands in the gesture of giving refuge.

translated: The mother and so forth means that one should meditate on the reflection of the Buddha's body emanating in that way, holding a vase arisen from the syllable vaṃ, completely filled with the water of nectar, white like the color of the moon, with both hands in the gesture of giving refuge.🔽The mother and so forth means that one should meditate on the reflection of the Buddha's body emanating in that way, holding a vase arisen from the syllable vaṃ, completely filled with the water of nectar, white like the color of the moon, with both hands in the gesture of giving refuge.

original: dug gis phog pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni dug med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dug gis phog pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni dug med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mother and so forth means that one should meditate on the reflection of the Buddha's body emanating in that way, holding a vase arisen from the syllable vaṃ, completely filled with the water of nectar, white like the color of the moon, with both hands in the gesture of giving refuge.🔽The mother and so forth means that one should meditate on the reflection of the Buddha's body emanating in that way, holding a vase arisen from the syllable vaṃ, completely filled with the water of nectar, white like the color of the moon, with both hands in the gesture of giving refuge.🔽The mother and so forth means that one should meditate on the reflection of the Buddha's body emanating in that way, holding a vase arisen from the syllable vaṃ, completely filled with the water of nectar, white like the color of the moon, with both hands in the gesture of giving refuge.

original: de ltar bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni dug sel ma'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni dug sel ma'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The meditation in this way is the samadhi of Anavatapta.

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: All afflictions are attachment and so on.

original: de dag nyid thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those very ones are all attachment and so on.

original: de dag nyid thabs med par bsten na 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong pa 'byin pas na dug ste de nye par 'joms par mdzad pas na dug sel mal de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid thabs med par bsten na 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong pa 'byin pas na dug ste de nye par 'joms par mdzad pas na dug sel mal de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those very ones are poison if relied upon without means, so it is called Anavatapta, which means destroyer of poison.

original: de nyid gdengs ka'i dbang po ste klu rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gdengs ka'i dbang po ste klu rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa'o //
translated: That very one is the lord of the hood, the master of the nagas.

original: de nyid gzhig par mi nus pa dang mi ldog pa'i phyir rdo rje ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid gzhig par mi nus pa dang mi ldog pa'i phyir rdo rje ye shes so //
translated: That very one is the vajra wisdom, because it is indestructible and irreversible.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of object and so on has been explained.

original: thor tshugs rgyal pa'i sku gzugs bzhugs //
analyzed: thor tshugs rgyal pa'i sku gzugs bzhugs //
translated: The form of the Victor with matted hair resides.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i sku ni rgyal pa'i sku ste de thor tshugs kyi dbus na bzhugs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i sku ni rgyal pa'i sku ste de thor tshugs kyi dbus na bzhugs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The body of Amitābha is the body of the Victor, and he who dwells in the middle of the topknot is so called.

original: padma dkar po lta bur snang //
analyzed: padma dkar po lta bur snang //
translated: He appears like a white lotus.

original: zhes bya ba ni padma dag pa dang 'dra pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padma dag pa dang 'dra pa'o //
translated: He is like a pure lotus.

original: nyams sems stobs ldan zhes bya ba ni gar stabs kyi ro'i nyams dang nye par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyams sems stobs ldan zhes bya ba ni gar stabs kyi ro'i nyams dang nye par ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the experience of the rasa of dance and gesture.

original: bgrang nor phreng ba can zhes bya ba ni bgrang phreng dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bgrang nor phreng ba can zhes bya ba ni bgrang phreng dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is the one with the rosary, the one with the rosary.

original: rol pa'i stangs stabs zhes bya ba ni rol pa dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: rol pa'i stangs stabs zhes bya ba ni rol pa dang bcas pas so //
translated: He is the one with the rasa of dance, the one with the rasa.

original: rin chen ri phug nang bzhugs pa //
analyzed: rin chen ri phug nang bzhugs pa //
translated: He dwells in the interior of the jeweled mountain cave.

original: zhes bya ba ni rin po che'i ri phug gi dbus na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rin po che'i ri phug gi dbus na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He dwells in the middle of the jeweled mountain cave.

original: rnal 'byor sems pas zhes bya ba ni ha la ha la'i thabs dang shes rab sgom par byed pas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor sems pas zhes bya ba ni ha la ha la'i thabs dang shes rab sgom par byed pas so //
translated: The one who contemplates yoga is the one who meditates on the method and wisdom of Halahala.

original: rnam par mi rtog ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: By the samādhi of nonconceptuality,

original: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa la lhag par mos pas yang dag ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa bsal pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa la lhag par mos pas yang dag ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa bsal pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
translated: This is the meditative stabilization Elimination of Unreal Imaginings by the superior devotion to the way the Dharma-Sphere abides.

original: nang gi bzlas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsam gtan gyi bzlas pas sngags zlos pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi bzlas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bsam gtan gyi bzlas pas sngags zlos pa ste /
translated: The inner repetition and so on is the mantra repetition by the meditative stabilization repetition.

original: gcig dang gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i gzugs 'phro bas bsgom pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig dang gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i gzugs 'phro bas bsgom pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the meditation by the emission of the forms of one, two, three, and so on.

original: 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'dod pa thams cad ni yongs su dag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //🔽de @218a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'dod pa thams cad ni yongs su dag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'o // de @218a * //
translated: All desires and so on: all desires are the pure forms and so on.

original: rab tu bsgrub pa ni sgrub pa po'i rgyud la rdzogs par mdzad pas na 'dod pa thams cad rab tu sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrub pa ni sgrub pa po'i rgyud la rdzogs par mdzad pas na 'dod pa thams cad rab tu sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment is the accomplishment of the practitioner's continuum, and so it is the accomplishment of all desires.

original: de nyid ni ha la ha la 'di yin pas ni de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni ha la ha la 'di yin pas ni de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That itself is this hālāhala, and so it is called that.

original: de nyid ni gdul bya'i skye bo ma lus pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dug 'joms pa nyid kyis thogs pa med pa'i shin tu sim pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas na yongs su mnyes par byed pa ye shes rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni gdul bya'i skye bo ma lus pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dug 'joms pa nyid kyis thogs pa med pa'i shin tu sim pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas na yongs su mnyes par byed pa ye shes rdo rje'o //
translated: He is the vajra of intuition, which is the universal satisfaction, because he is endowed with the intuition of universal satisfaction, which is unobstructed, since he destroys the poisons of passion, etc., of all the disciples without exception.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “object,” etc., has been explained.

original: srin mo zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srin mo zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The “rākṣasī” is so called because she assumes such a form.

original: thor tshugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thor tshugs dang cod pan gyis brgyan pa'i spyi bo de nyid la mi bskyod pa bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi mgo la mi bskyod pa bzhugs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: thor tshugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thor tshugs dang cod pan gyis brgyan pa'i spyi bo de nyid la mi bskyod pa bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi mgo la mi bskyod pa bzhugs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The “head” adorned with the topknot and diadem, on which Akṣhobhya resides, is so called because Akṣhobhya resides on her head.

original: lag na khrag gis bkang pa'i thod pa thogs ba zhes bya ba ni mi'i khrag gis yongs su bkang pa'i mi'i thod pa lag pa g-yas kyi dang po la thogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: lag na khrag gis bkang pa'i thod pa thogs ba zhes bya ba ni mi'i khrag gis yongs su bkang pa'i mi'i thod pa lag pa g-yas kyi dang po la thogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Holding a skull-cup filled with blood in his hand means that he holds in his right hand a human skull-cup filled with human blood.

original: g-yon pa gcig gis ni sdigs mdzub byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa gcig gis ni sdigs mdzub byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: With the other left hand he makes a threatening gesture.

original: rol pa'i stabs kyis zhes bya ba ni rol pa'i stang stabs kyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rol pa'i stabs kyis zhes bya ba ni rol pa'i stang stabs kyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: In a dancing posture means that he stands in a dancing posture.

original: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bshad ma thag pa'i bzlas pa dang sgom pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bshad ma thag pa'i bzlas pa dang sgom pa 'di lta bu dang ldan pas so //
translated: Having such and such recitations and meditations means having the recitations and meditations just explained.

original: h'um gis h'um mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni khro bo la zhen pa'i h'um sgra sgrogs par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: h'um gis h'um mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni khro bo la zhen pa'i h'um sgra sgrogs par brtson pa'o //
translated: Humkara means that he is intent on uttering the sound hum which is attached to wrath.

original: sems can kun don phun tshogs pa'i //
analyzed: sems can kun don phun tshogs pa'i //
translated: The accomplishment of the aims of all sentient beings🔽means that he is intent on accomplishing the aims of all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni spyin pa la sogs pas sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i phyir nye par bsags pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu dang yang dag par ldan pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spyin pa la sogs pas sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i phyir nye par bsags pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu dang yang dag par ldan pas so //
translated: This is because she is endowed with the cause of the perfection of the accumulations of merit and knowledge, which are collected through giving and so forth in order to benefit all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la sems can thams cad de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la sems can thams cad de /
translated: All sentient beings and so forth: all sentient beings are the object of her compassion.

original: gdug pa rnams gsod pa'i mchog yin la /
analyzed: gdug pa rnams gsod pa'i mchog yin la /
translated: She is the supreme killer of the wicked,

original: de nyid kyis na rab ste pad dkar ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rab ste pad dkar ma'o //
translated: and she is the best because of that.

original: de nyid ni byang chub kyi snying por bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi stobs bcu'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na byang chub kyi snying po rnam par rgyal ba'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni byang chub kyi snying por bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi stobs bcu'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na byang chub kyi snying po rnam par rgyal ba'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: She is the essence of the ten powers of the Lord, because she is victorious over the four demons at the site of enlightenment.

original: dmigs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of object and so forth has been explained.

original: phyed zur pa ni rnam par rol //
analyzed: phyed zur pa ni rnam par rol //
translated: The half-verse is a play.

original: ces bya ba ni g-yon logs dpag bsam gyi shing la brten pas rten pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni g-yon logs dpag bsam gyi shing la brten pas rten pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is supported because it is based on the wish-fulfilling tree on the left.

original: 'jam @218b pa'i khro bo rdo rje yis //🔽zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed kyis so //
analyzed: 'jam @218b pa'i khro bo rdo rje yis // zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed kyis so //
translated: With the vajra of Manjushri's wrath,

original: de yis mgo ni mnan nas bzhugs //
analyzed: de yis mgo ni mnan nas bzhugs //
translated: he suppresses with Yamantaka.

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbang po 'jam dpal gyi sbyor pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbang po 'jam dpal gyi sbyor pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He resides with the union of Manjushri, the lord of the mandala.

original: gnod spyin mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnod spyin mo thams cad kyi sgrub pa ni rang dbang du bya ba nyid rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnod spyin mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnod spyin mo thams cad kyi sgrub pa ni rang dbang du bya ba nyid rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: The accomplishment of all yakshini is the complete subjugation of all yakshini.

original: de la mchog tu gyur pa ni 'jam dpal rang gi khro bo dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la mchog tu gyur pa ni 'jam dpal rang gi khro bo dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The supreme is Manjushri with his own wrathful form.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //🔽yi ge gsum pa mig gsum gzugs //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to // yi ge gsum pa mig gsum gzugs //
translated: The meaning of visualization and so on has been explained.

original: zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i yi ge gsum gyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i yi ge gsum gyi gzugs can no //
translated: The three syllables are the three eyes, the form,

original: de nyid gsum pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid gsum pa ni //
translated: the three realities,

original: khyab 'jug lha chen mes po che //
analyzed: khyab 'jug lha chen mes po che //
translated: Vishnu, the great god, the great grandfather,

original: zhes bya ba ste khyab 'jug ni nor lha'o //🔽lha chen po ni bde byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste khyab 'jug ni nor lha'o // lha chen po ni bde byed do //
translated: The great lord is Śiva.

original: mes po chen po ni tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: mes po chen po ni tshangs pa'o //
translated: The great grandfather is Brahmā.🔽As for holding their own weapons, holding weapons is merely an indication of proximity.

original: rang gi mtshon thogs la zhes bya ba ni mtshon cha thogs pa ni nye par mtshon pa tsam ste de la khyab 'jug ni mdog sngon po lag pa bzhi pa /
analyzed: rang gi mtshon thogs la zhes bya ba ni mtshon cha thogs pa ni nye par mtshon pa tsam ste de la khyab 'jug ni mdog sngon po lag pa bzhi pa /
translated: Viṣṇu is blue-colored, with four arms,

original: g-yas dang g-yon na dbyug pa dang rdo rje dang / dung dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa nam mkha' lding la zhon pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon na dbyug pa dang rdo rje dang / dung dang 'khor lo 'dzin pa nam mkha' lding la zhon pa'o //
translated: holding a club, a vajra, a conch, and a discus in his right and left hands, and riding on Garuḍa.

original: lha chen po ni shel gyi mdog can mgrin pa sngo ba /
analyzed: lha chen po ni shel gyi mdog can mgrin pa sngo ba /
translated: The great lord is crystal-colored, with a blue neck,

original: mig gsum pa /🔽stag gi pags pa gyon pa //
analyzed: mig gsum pa / stag gi pags pa gyon pa //
translated: and three eyes.🔽He wears a tiger skin,

original: mtshan ma 'greng ba /
analyzed: mtshan ma 'greng ba /
translated: with his penis erect.

original: lag pa drug pa /
analyzed: lag pa drug pa /
translated: He has six arms,

original: g-yas na mdung rtse gsum pa dang rdo rje dang ta ma ru thogs pa ;
analyzed: g-yas na mdung rtse gsum pa dang rdo rje dang ta ma ru thogs pa ;
translated: holding a trident, a vajra, and a tamāla tree in his right hands,

original: g-yon gnyis na kha tv'am ga dang thod pa khrag gis bkang ba thogs pa cig gis au ma la 'khyud pa khyu mchog la zhon pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon gnyis na kha tv'am ga dang thod pa khrag gis bkang ba thogs pa cig gis au ma la 'khyud pa khyu mchog la zhon pa'o //
translated: and a khaṭvāṅga and a skull-cup filled with blood in his two left hands, embracing Umā, and riding on a bull.

original: tshangs pa ni mdog ser po lag pa bzhi pa g-yas na rdo rje dang phreng ba dang g-yon na dbyig pa dang spyi blugs 'dzin pa dang dad pa la zhon pa ste de dag kyang rin po che'i cod pan can no //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mdog ser po lag pa bzhi pa g-yas na rdo rje dang phreng ba dang g-yon na dbyig pa dang spyi blugs 'dzin pa dang dad pa la zhon pa ste de dag kyang rin po che'i cod pan can no //
translated: Brahma is yellow, with four arms, holding a vajra and a rosary in the right hands, and an axe and a water pot in the left hands, and he rides a goose. They all have jewel crowns.

original: rdo rje'i ting 'dzin bsgom nas ni //
analyzed: rdo rje'i ting 'dzin bsgom nas ni //
translated: Having cultivated vajra concentration,

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pas so //
translated: means having cultivated the concentration of Vajrahumkara.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis bskul na //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis bskul na //
translated: Having summoned with Vajrahumkara,

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas 'dod pa'i rgyal pos lha chen po la sogs pa gang yang rung ba bkug nas khro bo ti r'i nti ri'i phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas 'dod pa'i rgyal pos lha chen po la sogs pa gang yang rung ba bkug nas khro bo ti r'i nti ri'i phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: means that the practitioner of Vajrahumkara, having summoned any of the great gods such as Kamadeva, binds the mudra of Krodha Tiritamati.

original: rdo rje 'di ni rdo rje che //
analyzed: rdo rje 'di ni rdo rje che //
translated: This is the great vajra,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i spyi'i dam tshig bsgom zhing khyad par gyi dam tshig ji lta pa yang bstan nas mngon par 'dod pa'i las grub par gyis shig ces bskul pa byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i spyi'i dam tshig bsgom zhing khyad par gyi dam tshig ji lta pa yang bstan nas mngon par 'dod pa'i las grub par gyis shig ces bskul pa byas la /
translated: and so forth. Having cultivated the general pledge, and having shown the particular pledge, he should be summoned with “Do the desired rite!”

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgyas kyang sdigs mdzub byas nas bsgrubs na @219a * //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgyas kyang sdigs mdzub byas nas bsgrubs na @219a * //
translated: If one accomplishes with the gesture of Vajra Humkara, threatening with the index finger,

original: 'jigs pas dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pas dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will grant powers out of fear.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten thams cad kyi lha rnams sgrub par byed pas spun gsum la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten thams cad kyi lha rnams sgrub par byed pas spun gsum la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: In the phrase all the worldly gods, the term all refers to the three brothers.

original: de nyid kyis na mig gsum pa //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na mig gsum pa //
translated: Therefore, it says three-eyed.

original: zhes bya ba la lha chen po'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rol pa ni rnam par brtse ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la lha chen po'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rol pa ni rnam par brtse ba'o //
translated: The term play means the manifestation of the nature of Mahesvara.

original: ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i thogs pa med par shes pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i thogs pa med par shes pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The term knowledge-vajra means the method of knowing the worldly unobstructed [path].

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of object, etc., has been explained.

original: dkyil 'khor la ma gtogs pa'i lha cung zad tsam zhig bstan nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la ma gtogs pa'i lha cung zad tsam zhig bstan nas /
translated: Having taught a few of the gods not included in the maṇḍala,

original: da ni 'dir ma gtogs pa gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni 'dir ma gtogs pa gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: now, in order to teach the others not included here, he says and so on, and so forth.

original: gsang sngags zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags kyi skyes bu ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags kyi skyes bu ste /
translated: The one called Mantra is the person of mantra.

original: 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i sngags //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i sngags //
translated: This is the mantra of the desired object.🔽Having applied the seed,

original: sa bon gang yin pa sbyar byas te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sa bon gang yin pa sbyar byas te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: means having applied the seed syllable.

original: rdo rje'i yig 'bru rnams bsgoms pas //
analyzed: rdo rje'i yig 'bru rnams bsgoms pas //
translated: By meditating on the vajra syllables

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyud kyi nang na rab tu grags pas rang rang gi sa bon gyi yi ge'am ming gi dang po'i yi ge dang de bzhin du rjes su sbyar pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyud kyi nang na rab tu grags pas rang rang gi sa bon gyi yi ge'am ming gi dang po'i yi ge dang de bzhin du rjes su sbyar pa'o //
translated: means that since they are well-known in the tantras, one should apply the seed syllable of each deity or the first letter of their name, and likewise for the others.

original: 'phrog ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'phrog ma ni yi ge ha las skyes pa bu lnga brgyas yongs su bskor pa rnam par bsams na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phrog ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'phrog ma ni yi ge ha las skyes pa bu lnga brgyas yongs su bskor pa rnam par bsams na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By visualizing Hārītī, who is born from the syllable ha, surrounded by five hundred sons, one will accomplish her.

original: dpa' can yang zhes bya ba ni dpa' can la sogs pa gnod spyin mo lnga brgyas yongs su bskor pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' can yang zhes bya ba ni dpa' can la sogs pa gnod spyin mo lnga brgyas yongs su bskor pa'o //
translated: And Śūrasena, means Śūrasena surrounded by five hundred yakṣiṇīs.

original: ting nge 'dzin rab tu ston pa'i gzhung gi le'u la ting nge 'dzin rim par phye ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar gsungs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rab tu ston pa'i gzhung gi le'u la ting nge 'dzin rim par phye ba zhes bya ba'i sgrar gsungs so //
translated: The chapter of the treatise teaching samādhi is called the Section on Samādhi.

original: le'u bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: Chapter IV

original: // / ting nge 'dzin yongs su shes pas rang gi bstan pa la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la phan pa'i gsang sngags kyi mthu bstan par bya dgos pas na de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u lnga pa gsang sngags kyi ye shes rnam par bsgyings pa'i
analyzed: // / ting nge 'dzin yongs su shes pas rang gi bstan pa la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la phan pa'i gsang sngags kyi mthu bstan par bya dgos pas na de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u lnga pa gsang sngags kyi ye shes rnam par bsgyings pa'i
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the power of the mantra that benefits sentient beings who have entered one's own teaching through the knowledge of samadhi, the fifth chapter, the knowledge of mantra, the display of the knowledge of mantra,

original: rim par phye ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rim par phye ba gsungs te /
translated: is taught beginning with then.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The Blessed One emitted is to be supplied.

original: ci zhig mdzad nas shen /
analyzed: ci zhig mdzad nas shen /
translated: What did he do?

original: zhi la rdul dang bral pa'i mchog / ces bya ba gsungs te 'dod chags la sogs pa nye par zhi bas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi la rdul dang bral pa'i mchog / ces bya ba gsungs te 'dod chags la sogs pa nye par zhi bas na zhi ba'o //
translated: Peace, supreme freedom from dust is said. Peace is due to the pacification of desire and so forth.

original: des rdul dang bral pa ni rnyog pa dang bral pa ste /
analyzed: des rdul dang bral pa ni rnyog pa dang bral pa ste /
translated: Freedom from dust is freedom from turbidity.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One is Vairocana.

original: de'i mchog ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyar gyur pa nyid de yum sangs @219b rgyas spyan no //
analyzed: de'i mchog ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyar gyur pa nyid de yum sangs @219b rgyas spyan no //
translated: His supreme is the commitment seal, which is the mother Buddhalocana.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “object” and so on has been explained.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa ste spyan gyi gsang sngags ston pa'i rnam par thugs rtsi gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa ste spyan gyi gsang sngags ston pa'i rnam par thugs rtsi gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Engaged in” means “manifesting,” that is, “concentrating the mind in the aspect of teaching the mantra of the eye.”

original: gsang sngags ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad la yang lha de'i gsang sngags ston pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad la yang lha de'i gsang sngags ston pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that he concentrates his mind in the aspect of teaching the mantra of that deity in all the concentrations of teaching the mantra.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dmigs par mdzad pas ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dmigs par mdzad pas ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: By “having the concentration as its object” is meant

original: mtshan ma thob pa nyid kyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la gsang sngags rab tu sbyar par bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma thob pa nyid kyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la gsang sngags rab tu sbyar par bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: that one should apply the mantra to the rites of pacification and so on by means of the attainment of the sign.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yum zhes bya ba ni rigs de'i yum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yum zhes bya ba ni rigs de'i yum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhi bskyed yum //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams dang 'brel pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi zhi ba bskyed pa'am /
translated: means that which generates peace for the disciples connected with the buddhas.

original: yang na gal te sgrub pa po zhi ba byed kyang sngags pa gzhan gyis phur bus btab pas sgrub pa po la bya pa'i dngos grub mi stsol @220a * //
analyzed: yang na gal te sgrub pa po zhi ba byed kyang sngags pa gzhan gyis phur bus btab pas sgrub pa po la bya pa'i dngos grub mi stsol @220a * //
translated: Or, if the practitioner performs pacification, but another mantra practitioner performs the rite of stabbing with a kila, and does not grant the practitioner's desired attainment,🔽then having understood that, one should make an effigy of them, stab it with a kila,

original: na ; de'i tshe shes par byas nas de rnams kyi gzugs brnyan byas la phur bus btab ste /
analyzed: na ; de'i tshe shes par byas nas de rnams kyi gzugs brnyan byas la phur bus btab ste /
translated: and

analyzed: slar phyung nas sangs rgyas spyan gyi gsang sngags bzlas pa'i 'o mas bkrus na de'i tshe de rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas de'i mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub stsol par 'gyur bsam 'di la ni / sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhi bskyed yum //

original: zhes bya bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bya'o //

original: 'di dag kyang nges par shes par bya ba ni gzhan gyis bkrir mi rung ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa po'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang nges par shes par bya ba ni gzhan gyis bkrir mi rung ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa po'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: These are also to be understood as referring to the adept who is not to be led astray by others, and so forth.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pas dgug pa la sogs pa la 'jog pa'i tshul dang 'dra par shes par bya'o //🔽rdo rje dam tshig gis bskul na //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pas dgug pa la sogs pa la 'jog pa'i tshul dang 'dra par shes par bya'o // rdo rje dam tshig gis bskul na //

original: zhes bya ba ni nges par bskul ba'o //🔽ma grub rnams la grub par stsol //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nges par bskul ba'o // ma grub rnams la grub par stsol //

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos grub ma grub pa rnams la dngos grub stsol par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos grub ma grub pa rnams la dngos grub stsol par mdzad pa'o //
translated: “Grant power to those who have not attained it” means grant power to those who have not attained power.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs las byung pa'i gsang sngags rnams dngos grub mi stsol na de spyan gyi gsang sngags sngags dang spel nas bzlas na dngos grub stsol par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs las byung pa'i gsang sngags rnams dngos grub mi stsol na de spyan gyi gsang sngags sngags dang spel nas bzlas na dngos grub stsol par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: If the mantras that arise from the Tathagata's lineage do not grant powers, then by reciting the mantra of the eye along with the mantra, they will grant powers.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //

original: sku gsum 'bar pa'i mchog gi dam tshig ces bya ba la sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum 'bar pa'i mchog gi dam tshig ces bya ba la sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The commitment of the supreme blazing of the three bodies is Akshobhya, who is the nature of the three bodies.

original: de nyid ni thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bos khro bo'i gzugs su gyur pas na 'bar pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bos khro bo'i gzugs su gyur pas na 'bar pa'o //
translated: Since he himself becomes the form of wrath by the nature of means and insight, he is blazing.

original: de nyid kyis na 'jigs byed la sogs pa'i khro bo rnams kyi mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'jigs byed la sogs pa'i khro bo rnams kyi mchog go //
translated: Since he is the supreme of the wrathful ones such as Bhairava,

original: de'i dam tshig ni yum m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni yum m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: his commitment is the mother Mamaki.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the observation and so forth has been explained.

original: rdo rje 'chang pa'i mchog thams cad kyi yum zhes bya ba ni rigs de'i yum du gyur pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang pa'i mchog thams cad kyi yum zhes bya ba ni rigs de'i yum du gyur pas so //
translated: The mother of all the supreme vajra holders is the mother of that lineage.

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i rigs kyi ye shes skyed par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i rigs kyi ye shes skyed par mdzad pas so //
translated: The one who generates the vajra maṇḍala is the one who generates the knowledge of the vajra family.

analyzed: dngos grub thams cad rab tu stsol par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas spyan dang 'dra pa'o //
translated: The one who grants all powers is the one who is like Buddhalocanā.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //

original: rjes dran gyur zhes bya ba ni rjes su dran pa ste //
analyzed: rjes dran gyur zhes bya ba ni rjes su dran pa ste //
translated: The one who is mindful is the one who is mindful.

original: dgyes pas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dgyes pas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The one who is pleased is the one who is pleased.

original: dngos grub thams cad srung mdzad ma //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad srung mdzad ma //
translated: The one who protects all powers

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos grub thams cad kyi srung ba 'dis bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos grub thams cad kyi srung ba 'dis bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is the one who protects all powers with this.

original: 'di ni spyi'i @220b srung ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spyi'i @220b srung ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the general protection rite.

original: de bzhin las rnams 'grub pa yin //
analyzed: de bzhin las rnams 'grub pa yin //
translated: And likewise, the accomplishments of actions

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ji lta ba la sogs pa'i las rnams grub pa'i rgyur gyur pas spyan la sogs par sprul par mdzad pa de bzhin du sprul pa'i don to //

translated: means that just as she is the cause for the accomplishments of the actions of pacifying and so forth, she emanates as Buddhalocanā and so forth. This is the meaning of emanation.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then, etc., as before.

original: 'dod chags chen po zhes bya ba la rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i snying rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid ni 'dod chags chen po ste des chags pa ni dmar ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po zhes bya ba la rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i snying rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid ni 'dod chags chen po ste des chags pa ni dmar ba'o //
translated: Great passion is the nature of great compassion, which is pure by nature. He is passionate because he is red.

original: padma ni padma'i rigs so //
analyzed: padma ni padma'i rigs so //
translated: Lotus is the lotus family.

original: de'i gar gyis gar byed pa'i tshul gyis rnam par 'phrul pas 'thor zhing nam mkha'i khams ma lus par khyab pa ste bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gar gyis gar byed pa'i tshul gyis rnam par 'phrul pas 'thor zhing nam mkha'i khams ma lus par khyab pa ste bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called Amitābha, the transcendent lord, because he scatters, pervades the entire realm of space, with the dance of his emanations in the manner of dancing.

original: de'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni shin tu dga' ba'i skus rnam par rol pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni shin tu dga' ba'i skus rnam par rol pa'o //
translated: His emanation is the play of the body of great joy.

original: de'i don dam tshig gi rdo rje ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: de'i don dam tshig gi rdo rje ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste gos dkar mo'o //
translated: His pledge-vajra is the pledge seal, Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the term objective, etc., has been explained.

original: chos thams cad 'dzin pa mchog gi yum zhes bya ba ni rigs de'i yum du gyur pas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dzin pa mchog gi yum zhes bya ba ni rigs de'i yum du gyur pas so //
translated: The mother of the supreme retention of all phenomena is the mother of that family.

original: thams cad dbang du byas pa la //
analyzed: thams cad dbang du byas pa la //
translated: Having brought everything under control,
