analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas la sogs pa thams cad dbang du bya ba ni mi 'da' par byas pa'o //
translated: In this, having brought everything under control means having made all the Buddhas and so on not pass beyond one's control.

original: de'i khor du chud pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i khor du chud pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par byed pa ste /
translated: Having brought them under control means having made them enter one's own mandala.

original: bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The yogis and yoginis realize this, and the Bhagavat Amoghasiddhi is so called.

original: de'i rdo rje gsum mnyam pa nyid kyis dga' bar byed pa ni sku gsum rdo rje skye ba med par mdzad pa ste yum sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: de'i rdo rje gsum mnyam pa nyid kyis dga' bar byed pa ni sku gsum rdo rje skye ba med par mdzad pa ste yum sgrol ma'o //
translated: His three vajra equanimity is the creation of the three vajra bodies, which is the mother Tara.

original: sna tshogs thams cad 'chang pa'i yum gyi mchog / ces bya ba ni rigs de'i yum du gyur pas so //
analyzed: sna tshogs thams cad 'chang pa'i yum gyi mchog / ces bya ba ni rigs de'i yum du gyur pas so //
translated: She is the supreme mother of all varieties, because she is the mother of that family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes la 'jug pas na ye shes la 'jug pa ste khro bo'i thabs dang shes rab ni khro bo'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes la 'jug pas na ye shes la 'jug pa ste khro bo'i thabs dang shes rab ni khro bo'i ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge of all Tathagatas and so on: the knowledge of all the Tathagatas, Vairochana and so on, is the knowledge of the wrathful means and wisdom.

original: des sgrol ba ni sems can gdug pa ngan 'gror ltung ba rnams sgrol bas gshin rje gshed la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des sgrol ba ni sems can gdug pa ngan 'gror ltung ba rnams sgrol bas gshin rje gshed la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The liberator is called Yamarljarin because he liberates evil sentient beings who have fallen into bad destinies.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of having that as an objective support and so on has been explained.

original: 'jigs pa skyes gyur na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa thams cad 'jigs pa skyes pa'o //🔽'dir la la @221a * //
analyzed: 'jigs pa skyes gyur na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa thams cad 'jigs pa skyes pa'o // 'dir la la @221a * //
translated: When fear arises means that fear arises for all those who are Tathagatas and Bodhisattvas.

original: dag ni de rnams la 'jigs pa mi mnga' bas 'di ni mi 'jigs so zhe na de ma yin te /
analyzed: dag ni de rnams la 'jigs pa mi mnga' bas 'di ni mi 'jigs so zhe na de ma yin te /
translated: Here, some say that since they are not afraid, this is not fear.

original: gang gi phyir rang gis dam bcas pa ni 'jigs pa ste de rnams gdul ba'i dbang du mdzad nas dam bcas pa 'di la 'jigs pa rnam par 'jog par mdzad de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gis dam bcas pa ni 'jigs pa ste de rnams gdul ba'i dbang du mdzad nas dam bcas pa 'di la 'jigs pa rnam par 'jog par mdzad de /
translated: That is not so, because one's own vow is fear. Having taken that vow for the sake of disciplining them, one is placed in fear.

original: gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis sgrub pa la lan bdun bzhugs pa'i sngags pas grub par ma gyur na de'i tshe 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pas phur bus btab ste /
analyzed: gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis sgrub pa la lan bdun bzhugs pa'i sngags pas grub par ma gyur na de'i tshe 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pas phur bus btab ste /
translated: If the mantrin who abides in the accomplishment of the above-explained method for seven days does not become accomplished, then at that time, having been staked with the stake of Ārya Yamāri and so on,

original: kho bo cag bsgrub par bya ba yin pas bcom ldan 'das ni gtum po'i snyam nas 'dir sngags pas phur bus 'debs par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: kho bo cag bsgrub par bya ba yin pas bcom ldan 'das ni gtum po'i snyam nas 'dir sngags pas phur bus 'debs par 'gyur ro//
translated: thinking “I am to be accomplished, the Bhagavān is not wrathful,” the mantrin will be staked.

original: zhes 'jigs pa kun du skyes pas dngos grub stsol bar mdzad par 'gyur te ji skad du /
analyzed: zhes 'jigs pa kun du skyes pas dngos grub stsol bar mdzad par 'gyur te ji skad du /
translated: Thus, having generated fear, he will grant spiritual powers, just as it is said:

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad phyag rgya yis //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad phyag rgya yis //
translated: By the mudra of Vajrahūṃkāra,

original: ji lta de lta de rnams khros //
analyzed: ji lta de lta de rnams khros //
translated: they are wrathful just like that.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad gzir na ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad gzir na ni //
translated: If all buddhas are oppressed,

original: 'jigs pas dngos grub stsol bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'jigs pas dngos grub stsol bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: they will grant spiritual powers out of fear.

original: rdo rje ra ba dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gzi byin bzod par dka' bas rdo rje rab dang 'dra bas go mnan pas na ye shes sna tshogs can la gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ra ba dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gzi byin bzod par dka' bas rdo rje rab dang 'dra bas go mnan pas na ye shes sna tshogs can la gzigs pa ste /
translated: The vajra fence and net means that the Blessed One is difficult to approach because of his unbearable splendor, and so he is seen as wearing a vajra fence and net.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de bsnyen par dka' ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de bsnyen par dka' ba bstan to //
translated: This shows that the Blessed One is difficult to approach.

original: srubs cig pa'am zhes bya ba ni dum bu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: srubs cig pa'am zhes bya ba ni dum bu gcig pa'o //
translated: The one-holed means the one-piece skull.

original: srubs gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni dum bu gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srubs gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni dum bu gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The two-holed means the two-piece skull.🔽The four goddesses' union,

original: lha mo bzhi yi sbyor ba dang // sangs rgyas lnga yis byin brlabs te //
analyzed: lha mo bzhi yi sbyor ba dang // sangs rgyas lnga yis byin brlabs te //
translated: blessed by the five buddhas,

original: zhes bya ba ni ji skad du gsungs pa'i thod pa'i dbus su khrag gis thod pa la padma 'dab brgyad bri ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji skad du gsungs pa'i thod pa'i dbus su khrag gis thod pa la padma 'dab brgyad bri ste /
translated: means that in the center of the skull as described, one should draw a lotus with eight petals in a blood-filled skull.

original: de'i dbus dang shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma bzhir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga dang shar lho la sogs pa mtshams kyi 'dab ma bzhi la spyan la sogs pa bzhi dgod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa dang / lha mo bzhi'i sbyor ba dang de ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbus dang shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma bzhir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga dang shar lho la sogs pa mtshams kyi 'dab ma bzhi la spyan la sogs pa bzhi dgod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa dang / lha mo bzhi'i sbyor ba dang de ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the center of that, on the four petals in the east and so forth, one should place the five beginning with Vairocana, and on the four petals in the southeast and so forth, the four beginning with Locanā. This is the consecration by the Buddhas, and one becomes endowed with the union of the four goddesses.

original: rkang rjes sa yi cho ga la //
analyzed: rkang rjes sa yi cho ga la //
translated: The rite of the footprint.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang rjes kyi sa dang chu bo'i ngogs gnyis kyi sa las gzugs brnyan byas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang rjes kyi sa dang chu bo'i ngogs gnyis kyi sa las gzugs brnyan byas te /
translated: One should make an effigy of the victim with earth from a footprint and from both banks of a river,

original: de'i snying gar bsgrub par bya ba'i ming dang spel ba'i gshin rje gshed kyi sngags t'a la la sogs pa la bris te bcug nas g-yogs pa ste 'di ni rkang rjes kyi sa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de'i snying gar bsgrub par bya ba'i ming dang spel ba'i gshin rje gshed kyi sngags t'a la la sogs pa la bris te bcug nas g-yogs pa ste 'di ni rkang rjes kyi sa'i cho ga'o //
translated: and write the name of the victim together with the mantra of Yamāntaka, “tāla, etc.”, in his heart, and bury it. This is the rite of the footprint.

original: rkang pas mnan te de la bzlas //
analyzed: rkang pas mnan te de la bzlas //
translated: One should recite the mantra while stepping on it with one’s foot.

original: zhes @221b bya ba ni gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la bsgrub par bya ba rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon te /
analyzed: zhes @221b bya ba ni gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la bsgrub par bya ba rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon te /
translated: The practitioner of Yamântaka, sitting in the center of his maṇḍala, should place the victim on the vajra wind maṇḍala.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas rang gi zhags pa dang lcags kyus bcings te /🔽drangs par gyur par bsams la rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthil du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu kha thur du bltas pas thod pa'i nang du gzugs brnyan bcug pa mnan la dgug pa'i tshul gyis rkang pa bskyod cing gshin rje gshed kyi gsang
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pas rang gi zhags pa dang lcags kyus bcings te / drangs par gyur par bsams la rkang pa g-yon pa'i mthil du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu kha thur du bltas pas thod pa'i nang du gzugs brnyan bcug pa mnan la dgug pa'i tshul gyis rkang pa bskyod cing gshin rje gshed kyi gsang
translated: Then, with Vairochana and so forth, he should imagine that the victim is bound with his own noose and iron hook,🔽and is drawn in. Having placed the image in the skull-cup with the vajra hook standing on the moon maṇḍala on the sole of his left foot, facing downward, he should stir his foot in the manner of summoning and recite the mantra of Yamântaka, adding the name of the victim to be summoned.

original: sngags bsgrub par bya ba dgug pa'i ming dang spel te bzlas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngags bsgrub par bya ba dgug pa'i ming dang spel te bzlas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the concise meaning.

original: sprin chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du dam pa'i chos kyi chu rgyun rnams kyis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas sprin chen po dang 'dra bas na sprin chen po ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: sprin chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du dam pa'i chos kyi chu rgyun rnams kyis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas sprin chen po dang 'dra bas na sprin chen po ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The great cloud is the Blessed Buddha, since he acts for the welfare of the world with the streams of the holy Dharma, like a great cloud, according to the fortune of the world.

original: de rnams kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje mchog ni gdug pa 'dul ba'i thabs kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje mchog ni gdug pa 'dul ba'i thabs kyi ye shes so //
translated: The supreme vajra knowledge of those is the knowledge of the means of subduing the wicked.

original: de las byung bas na dam pa rdo rje bdud rtsi khro bo ste bdud rtsi'i thab sbyor ro //
analyzed: de las byung bas na dam pa rdo rje bdud rtsi khro bo ste bdud rtsi'i thab sbyor ro //
translated: Since it arises from that, it is the supreme vajra nectar wrath, the Churner of the Ocean of Existence.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the visualization, etc., is as before.

original: khro bo'i 'khor lo spel nas su //
analyzed: khro bo'i 'khor lo spel nas su //
translated: Having increased the wrathful wheel,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khyam zhing smel zhing 'khyams pa'i t'a la'i lo ma la dug la sogs pas 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa bris la lte bar h'um lha sbyin autstsha ta ya phat ces bya ba dang / rtsibs brgyad la'ang de bzhin du dgod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khyam zhing smel zhing 'khyams pa'i t'a la'i lo ma la dug la sogs pas 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa bris la lte bar h'um lha sbyin autstsha ta ya phat ces bya ba dang / rtsibs brgyad la'ang de bzhin du dgod do //
translated: one should draw an eight-spoked wheel on a palm leaf, etc., with poison, etc., and in the center one should write “Hūṃ Devadatta uccaṭa ya phaṭ,” and likewise on the eight spokes.

original: mu khyud la bsgrub par bya ba'i ming skrod pa dang spel te phreng ba'i sngags bri'o //
analyzed: mu khyud la bsgrub par bya ba'i ming skrod pa dang spel te phreng ba'i sngags bri'o //
translated: On the circumference, one should write the name of the person to be effected, with the addition of the word “expelled” or “prospered,” and the garland mantra.

original: tshogs bdag rkang pa'i drung du gzhag / ces bya ba ni tshogs kyi bdag po'i rkang pa'i 'og tu bsgrub par bya ba gzugs brnyan gzhag pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽h'um dang phat kyis bskul nas su //
analyzed: tshogs bdag rkang pa'i drung du gzhag / ces bya ba ni tshogs kyi bdag po'i rkang pa'i 'og tu bsgrub par bya ba gzugs brnyan gzhag pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o // h'um dang phat kyis bskul nas su //
translated: “Placing the Lord of the Ganas under the feet” means that one places the effigy of the person to be effected under the feet of the Lord of the Ganas, and that is what is meant by that.

original: zhes bya ba ni h'um che ge mo autstsha ta ya phat ces tshogs kyi bdag po bskul ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni h'um che ge mo autstsha ta ya phat ces tshogs kyi bdag po bskul ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: “Stirred by HŪṀ and PHAṬ” means that one stirs the Lord of the Ganas with the HŪṀ and PHAṬ of such and such a person, and that is what is meant by that.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te bsgrub par bya ba'i srung ba bsal ba sngon du 'gro bas gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar 'khor lo bcug la bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas tshogs kyi bdag po ji lta ba bzhin bkug la dam tshig byin pa
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te bsgrub par bya ba'i srung ba bsal ba sngon du 'gro bas gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar 'khor lo bcug la bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas tshogs kyi bdag po ji lta ba bzhin bkug la dam tshig byin pa
translated: This is what is being taught: Having previously removed the protection of the person to be effected, one inserts the wheel into the heart of the effigy, and having summoned the Lord of the Ganas with the application of the Amṛtakuṇḍali, one gives the samaya.

original: de'i rkang pa'i 'og tu gzugs brnyan sbas nas h'um @222a * //
analyzed: de'i rkang pa'i 'og tu gzugs brnyan sbas nas h'um @222a * //
translated: Having hidden a reflection under his foot, he should say, “Hum, so-and-so, go away, phaṭ!”

original: che ge mo autstsha ta ya phat ces brjod cing de la bka' bsgo bas bsgrub par bya ba gcer bu til mar gyis bskus pa rnga mo la bskyon te rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bteg nas lho phyogs su khyer bar bsam zhing de'i khyim yang rnga
analyzed: che ge mo autstsha ta ya phat ces brjod cing de la bka' bsgo bas bsgrub par bya ba gcer bu til mar gyis bskus pa rnga mo la bskyon te rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bteg nas lho phyogs su khyer bar bsam zhing de'i khyim yang rnga
translated: Having given the command to him, the one to be expelled, naked and smeared with sesame oil, mounted on a camel, is lifted up by the vajra wind maṇḍala and carried off to the south.🔽One should imagine that his house is completely carried off by a camel.

original: mo gcig gis yongs su khyer bar bsams la khros pas nyi ma phyed dang / mtshan phyed la nyin zhag bdun gyi bar du brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na nges par skrod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mo gcig gis yongs su khyer bar bsams la khros pas nyi ma phyed dang / mtshan phyed la nyin zhag bdun gyi bar du brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na nges par skrod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites this one hundred and eight times, angry at midnight and noon, for seven days, one will certainly expel him.

original: rin po che brtson pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rin po che ni rin po che'i rigs so //
analyzed: rin po che brtson pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rin po che ni rin po che'i rigs so //
translated: “The jewel striving” and so on. The jewel is the family of jewels.

original: brtson pa ni thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pas rab tu 'bad pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: brtson pa ni thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pas rab tu 'bad pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Striving is a special effort, since it fulfills the wishes of all.

original: des spros pas na khro bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa de la de skad ces bya ste de nyid ye shes kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: des spros pas na khro bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa de la de skad ces bya ste de nyid ye shes kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: Since he is elaborated by that, he is called the wrathful one who cannot be overcome by others, and he is the vajra of pristine consciousness.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “visualization” and so on has been explained.

original: skems byed kyi gdon zhes bya ba ni byis pa'i gdon no //
analyzed: skems byed kyi gdon zhes bya ba ni byis pa'i gdon no //
translated: The “demon of drying up” is the demon of children.

original: rdo rje gzir ba'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje gzir ba'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of pressing with a vajra,

original: zhes bya ba ni srin po la sogs pa'i gdon rig pa mchog gi rgyud kyi cho ga las mtshan ma shes par byas la de ji lta ba bzhin du bkug la bsgrub par bya ba'i lus la gzhug cing bcings la ra ba la sogs pa byas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srin po la sogs pa'i gdon rig pa mchog gi rgyud kyi cho ga las mtshan ma shes par byas la de ji lta ba bzhin du bkug la bsgrub par bya ba'i lus la gzhug cing bcings la ra ba la sogs pa byas te /
translated: having understood the signs from the ritual of the supreme knowledge tantra, one should summon the demon just as it is, and having entered the body of the one to be accomplished, bind it, and make it a fence, and so on.

original: yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje gnyis kyis gzir bar bsams la h'um 'bar ba las byung ba'i rdo rje lta bu'i yungs kar gyis srin po la sogs pa rnams sol cig ces bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas par gsang sngags bzlas la brdeg cing bsal ba la
analyzed: yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje gnyis kyis gzir bar bsams la h'um 'bar ba las byung ba'i rdo rje lta bu'i yungs kar gyis srin po la sogs pa rnams sol cig ces bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas par gsang sngags bzlas la brdeg cing bsal ba la
translated: One should imagine that it is pressed down with two vajras arisen from the syllable hūṃ, and one should strike it with mustard seeds like vajras arisen from blazing hūṃs, and one should recite the mantra with the words of urging, “Remove the rākṣasas and so on!”

original: sogs pa'i las rnams byas te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i las rnams byas te /
translated: Having performed the preliminary rites,

original: 'di ni rdo rje gzir ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje gzir ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: this is the procedure of the Vajra-Repelling.

original: yon tan rin po che zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yon tan rin po che lta bu'i yon tan de lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: yon tan rin po che zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yon tan rin po che lta bu'i yon tan de lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The jewel of good qualities and so forth: the good qualities are like jewels, and are of the nature of scripture and realization.

original: dpag tu med pa ni tshad med pa ste de kun nas bsags pa khro bo rta mgrin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste de nyid rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni tshad med pa ste de kun nas bsags pa khro bo rta mgrin gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste de nyid rdo rje'o //
translated: The incalculable are the immeasurable, and the collection of those is the wrathful Hayagriva. He is called that, and he is the vajra.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of object and so forth has been explained.

original: lag pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lag pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The hand and so forth are easy to understand.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: mtshan ma ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byas nas lag pa g-yon pa la zla ba rdo rje de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dkar po //
analyzed: mtshan ma ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byas nas lag pa g-yon pa la zla ba rdo rje de'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dkar po //
translated: Having understood the signs as they are, on the left hand the moon vajra, in the middle of that an eight-petaled white lotus,

original: de'i dbus su yi ge ha zla ba'i mdog can bsams la dug gis zin pa'i mdun du rta mgrin gyi @222b phreng ba'i sngags nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te bsgrub par bya ba gos kyis bkab ste nub phyogs su kha bstan la bzhag nas de'i lus la phreng
analyzed: de'i dbus su yi ge ha zla ba'i mdog can bsams la dug gis zin pa'i mdun du rta mgrin gyi @222b phreng ba'i sngags nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te bsgrub par bya ba gos kyis bkab ste nub phyogs su kha bstan la bzhag nas de'i lus la phreng
translated: In its center, one should visualize the syllable hūṃ, the color of the moon. In front of the one who is afflicted by poison, one should recite the mantra of the rosary of Hayagrīva twenty-one times.🔽

original: ba'i sngags ji lta ba bzhin bkod la /🔽zhi bar mdzad pa'i rta mgrin du gsol cig ces bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas par sngags bzlas par bcom ldan 'das kyis bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ba'i sngags ji lta ba bzhin bkod la / zhi bar mdzad pa'i rta mgrin du gsol cig ces bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas par sngags bzlas par bcom ldan 'das kyis bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: In its center one should visualize the syllable hūṃ, the color of the moon. In front of the one who is possessed by poison, one should recite the mantra of the rosary of Hayagrīva twenty-one times. One should place the one to be subdued, covered with a cloth, facing west, and arrange the mantra of the rosary on his body just as it is.🔽One should recite the mantra together with the words of entreaty, “Please pacify him!”

original: bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyis yongs su 'gengs par bsams la gos drang zhing rta mgrin gyi nga rgyal du byas pas dug bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i rgyun gyis yongs su 'gengs par bsams la gos drang zhing rta mgrin gyi nga rgyal du byas pas dug bsal bar bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One has taught that one should remove the poison by visualizing that the one to be subdued is filled with a stream of nectar, straightening out the cloth, and assuming the pride of Hayagrīva.

original: gal te myur bar ldang ste 'dzin par 'dod na des de'i snying gar padma dkar po'i lte bar yi ge ha bsam par yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te myur bar ldang ste 'dzin par 'dod na des de'i snying gar padma dkar po'i lte bar yi ge ha bsam par yang shes par bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to quickly rise up and seize him, one should visualize a white lotus in his heart, with the syllable hūṃ in its center.

original: khro rgyal ting 'dzin la gnas nas //
analyzed: khro rgyal ting 'dzin la gnas nas //
translated: One should know that the one to be subdued is bound by the king of wrathful ones, abiding in meditative concentration.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi yi ges mdzes //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi yi ges mdzes //
translated: Adorned with the syllables of the three vajras.

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo rta mgrin gyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo rta mgrin gyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas /
translated: Thus, abiding in the contemplation of the wrathful Hayagriva,

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes bya bas nye bar mdzes pa'i lus kyis so //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes bya bas nye bar mdzes pa'i lus kyis so //
translated: with the body adorned with the syllables Om, Ah, and Hum,

original: khams gsum dag kyang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum po rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: khams gsum dag kyang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum po rnams kyang ngo //
translated: and the three realms,🔽he bestows the unobstructed power,

original: don yod par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don yod cing don dang ldan pas thogs pa med pa'i dngos grub stsol ba 'byung zhing bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: don yod par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don yod cing don dang ldan pas thogs pa med pa'i dngos grub stsol ba 'byung zhing bskyed pa ste /
translated: the arising of the Amoghasiddhi,

original: khro bo btson sngon po can la de skad ces bya'o //🔽de nyid ni rgyal mtshan gyi mchog nor bu'i rdo rje ste rdo rjes mtshan zhing yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bstod pa nyid yin pas na rgyal mtshan gyi mchog nor bu
analyzed: khro bo btson sngon po can la de skad ces bya'o // de nyid ni rgyal mtshan gyi mchog nor bu'i rdo rje ste rdo rjes mtshan zhing yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bstod pa nyid yin pas na rgyal mtshan gyi mchog nor bu
translated: the blue-necked wrathful one.🔽That very one is the supreme victory banner jewel vajra,🔽the supreme victory banner jewel vajra marked with a vajra,🔽like a wish-fulfilling jewel, fulfilling all wishes,

original: rdo rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya'o //
translated: praised by all tathagatas, thus it is called the supreme victory banner jewel vajra.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the words “object” and so forth is easy to understand.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba ni de dang 'brel pas na bcom ldan 'das dbyug sngon can no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ces bya ba ni de dang 'brel pas na bcom ldan 'das dbyug sngon can no //
translated: “ All the Buddhas” means that the Blessed One Nīladaṇḍa is connected with them.

original: sbyor ba'i cho gas bskul nas zhes bya ba ni gdug pa rnams gsod pa'i bar du sbyor bas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i cho gas bskul nas zhes bya ba ni gdug pa rnams gsod pa'i bar du sbyor bas so //
translated: “ Having incited them with the rite of application” means that he kills the wicked by the rite of application.

original: de la sbyor ba'i cho ga ni 'di yin te thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bas bsgrub par bya ba'i rdo rje padma'o sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin du zhugs la ;
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i cho ga ni 'di yin te thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bas bsgrub par bya ba'i rdo rje padma'o sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin du zhugs la ;
translated: The rite of application is as follows: The practitioner of Vajra Mind should enter into union with the vajra lotus of the one to be subdued, just as is fitting.

original: de'i snying ga na gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems ji lta ba bzhin du 'thungs te de nyid las byung ba'i khro bo dbyug sngon can gyi nga rgyal can du byas la /🔽rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad khros pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba yang dkon mchog @223a * //
analyzed: de'i snying ga na gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems ji lta ba bzhin du 'thungs te de nyid las byung ba'i khro bo dbyug sngon can gyi nga rgyal can du byas la / rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad khros pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba yang dkon mchog @223a * //
translated: He should drink the bodhicitta just as it is located in her heart, and he should assume the pride of being the wrathful Nīladaṇḍa arisen from that very [bodhicitta].

original: gsum la sogs pa rnam par 'jig par bsgoms la /
analyzed: gsum la sogs pa rnam par 'jig par bsgoms la /
translated: He should meditate on all the Tathāgatas located in his maṇḍala being wrathful, and on the one to be subdued as destroying the Three Jewels and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas dang rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa rang gi dam tshig gis bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa rang gi dam tshig gis bzlog par bya ste /
translated: One should ward off the buddhas, vajra holders, etc. with one’s own commitments.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'di ni dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa de 'di'i dam tshig sbyin pa la sogs pa mi len te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'di ni dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa de 'di'i dam tshig sbyin pa la sogs pa mi len te /
translated: “This bhagavat tathāgata does not accept the commitments, etc. of one who harms the Three Jewels, etc.

original: sems can de ni byang chub kyi sems dang bral ba yin la khyed rnams ni byang chub kyi sems dang rab tu 'brel ba yin pas /
analyzed: sems can de ni byang chub kyi sems dang bral ba yin la khyed rnams ni byang chub kyi sems dang rab tu 'brel ba yin pas /
translated: That sentient being is devoid of the thought of awakening, but you are thoroughly connected with the thought of awakening.

original: des na 'di'i snying spang bar mdzad du gsol zhes brjod la /
analyzed: des na 'di'i snying spang bar mdzad du gsol zhes brjod la /
translated: Therefore, please abandon his heart.”

original: de'i snying spangs nas de bzhin gshegs par rnam par bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i snying spangs nas de bzhin gshegs par rnam par bsam mo //
translated: Having abandoned his heart, one should imagine him as a tathāgata.

original: yang sbyor ba gzhan dag gis srung ba la sogs pa bsams nas khrag gis gsher ba'i gos bgos pa'am gcer bus chu bo'i dogs gnyis kyi sa la sogs pa las bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan byas la rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te bsgrub par bya ba yang der dgug
analyzed: yang sbyor ba gzhan dag gis srung ba la sogs pa bsams nas khrag gis gsher ba'i gos bgos pa'am gcer bus chu bo'i dogs gnyis kyi sa la sogs pa las bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan byas la rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te bsgrub par bya ba yang der dgug
translated: Also, having contemplated protection, etc., with other procedures, one should dress in a garment wet with blood, or naked, and make an effigy of the victim on a riverbank, etc., with the two kinds of soil, and trample it with one’s left foot, and summon, induct, and bind the victim there.

original: pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba byas la khros pas /
analyzed: pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba byas la khros pas /
translated: With wrath,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du mngon spyod kyi cho ga rdzogs pa la brtson par bya zhing be con sngon po can zlos pas de gsod pa la brtson pa'i rdo rje be con sngon po la sogs pa dpag tu med pa spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du mngon spyod kyi cho ga rdzogs pa la brtson par bya zhing be con sngon po can zlos pas de gsod pa la brtson pa'i rdo rje be con sngon po la sogs pa dpag tu med pa spro bar bya'o //
translated: one should strive to complete the rite of killing just as it is, and the reciter of the Blue-Crested Vajra should emit countless blue-crested vajras, etc., striving to kill him.

original: kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun nas thams cad du sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnam par 'phro ba ste /
analyzed: kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun nas thams cad du sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnam par 'phro ba ste /
translated: “Everywhere” and so forth: everywhere, all around, there is an emanation of buddhas, etc.

original: de'i bkod pa'i tshogs yod pas khro bo stobs po che la de skad ces bya ste de nyid rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de'i bkod pa'i tshogs yod pas khro bo stobs po che la de skad ces bya ste de nyid rdo rje'o //
translated: Since there is an assembly of their arrays, the wrathful one is called Mahābala, and he is a vajra.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “object” and so forth has been explained.

original: las kun rab tu sgrub par byed //
analyzed: las kun rab tu sgrub par byed //
translated: It accomplishes all actions.

original: ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa mos pa'i stobs kyis gsang sngags 'di nyid kyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyang 'grub par 'gyur bas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa mos pa'i stobs kyis gsang sngags 'di nyid kyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyang 'grub par 'gyur bas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is because the yogin, by the power of his imagination, accomplishes pacifying and so forth by this very mantra.

original: char pa che na gcod 'gyur la //
analyzed: char pa che na gcod 'gyur la //
translated: If there is too much rain, it will be stopped.

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo stobs po che'i rnal 'byor gyis nam mkha' la gnas pa'i chu'i tshogs rnams 'thungs par lhag par mos nas mtshon cha phyag rgyas sprin rnams gtub par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo stobs po che'i rnal 'byor gyis nam mkha' la gnas pa'i chu'i tshogs rnams 'thungs par lhag par mos nas mtshon cha phyag rgyas sprin rnams gtub par bya'o //
translated: This is because, by the yoga of the powerful wrathful one, the yogin imagines that the mass of water in the sky is drunk, and with the weapon mudra he cuts the clouds.

original: char pa chung na rab tu 'bebs //
analyzed: char pa chung na rab tu 'bebs //
translated: If there is too little rain, it will be brought down.

original: zhes bya ba yang sbyor ba 'di nyid nas bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang sbyor ba 'di nyid nas bshad do //
translated: This is also explained by this very application.

original: kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun nas thams cad du 'bar bas snying por byas pas bcom ldan 'das 'dod pa'i rgyal po la de skad ces bya ste de la dmigs pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun nas thams cad du 'bar bas snying por byas pas bcom ldan 'das 'dod pa'i rgyal po la de skad ces bya ste de la dmigs pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One is called the king of passion because he is the essence of the blazing of all things in every way, and because he is the object of that [blazing].

original: @223b rkang g-yas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rkang pa g-yas pa'i mthil du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og tu yi ge aa las sna tshogs rdo rje de'i yang 'og tu yi ge dza: las rdo rje lcags kyu kha thur du bltas pa rnam par bsams
analyzed: @223b rkang g-yas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rkang pa g-yas pa'i mthil du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og tu yi ge aa las sna tshogs rdo rje de'i yang 'og tu yi ge dza: las rdo rje lcags kyu kha thur du bltas pa rnam par bsams
translated: The right foot, etc. means that one should imagine a vajra hook below the letter jra, which is below the variegated vajra from the letter a, below the moon disk on the sole of the right foot.

original: la mtshan de bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs brnyan mnan no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽sku gsum ye shes stobs ldan pas //
analyzed: la mtshan de bsgrub par bya ba'i gzugs brnyan mnan no zhes bya bar sbyar ro // sku gsum ye shes stobs ldan pas //
translated: One should imagine that the reflection of the one to be accomplished is pressed down by that [hook].

original: zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi ye shes byin gyis brlabs la khro ba dang bcas pas g-yon phyogs su lus cung zad 'dud par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi ye shes byin gyis brlabs la khro ba dang bcas pas g-yon phyogs su lus cung zad 'dud par bya'o //
translated: Endowed with the power of the gnosis of the three bodies means that one should slightly bend one's body to the left with wrath, having blessed the gnosis of the three bodies.

original: khro gnyer rim par bsnyer byas te //
analyzed: khro gnyer rim par bsnyer byas te //
translated: Wrinkling the brow in a frown means that one should wrinkle the brow in a frown.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpral ba bskul ba byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpral ba bskul ba byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, etc. is the meaning of “having stimulated the forehead.”

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje ltar rab tu 'bar ba'i ye shes ni gdug pa rnams 'dul ba'i thabs kyi ye shes te des rab tu 'bar bas gtum por gyur pa ste khro bo mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje ltar rab tu 'bar ba'i ye shes ni gdug pa rnams 'dul ba'i thabs kyi ye shes te des rab tu 'bar bas gtum por gyur pa ste khro bo mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The vajra-like blazing gnosis is the gnosis of the means of subduing the wicked, and by that blazing he becomes fierce, the wrathful Acala.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “visualization,” etc. has been explained.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'dir dran zhes bya ba dang rjes su sbyar ro //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'dir dran zhes bya ba dang rjes su sbyar ro //
translated: “ Chief” here is to be connected with “remember.”

original: dgug byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dgug byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “ Summoning,” etc. is as before.

original: sku gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ni rtag tu sku gsung thugs mi zad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar thug pa yin pas na sku gsum rdo rje'i ye shes so //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ni rtag tu sku gsung thugs mi zad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar thug pa yin pas na sku gsum rdo rje'i ye shes so //
translated: “ Of the three bodies,” etc. This is the ultimate of the inexhaustible gnosis of the three bodies of speech, mind, and body, and so it is the gnosis of the vajra of the three bodies.

original: de nyid h'um bzhis bsnyen par dka' ba'i ngo bo nyid pas na 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid h'um bzhis bsnyen par dka' ba'i ngo bo nyid pas na 'bar ba'o //
translated: That itself is blazing, since it is the nature of the four hūṃs that are difficult to approach.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis thabs dang shes rab kyi khro bo'i gzugs kyis srid pa gsum po ma lus pa'i bdag por gyur cing mi shes pa'i bud shing rnams bsregs pas na 'bar ba'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis thabs dang shes rab kyi khro bo'i gzugs kyis srid pa gsum po ma lus pa'i bdag por gyur cing mi shes pa'i bud shing rnams bsregs pas na 'bar ba'i rdo rje'o //
translated: He is the blazing vajra because he is the lord of the three worlds, having become the lord of the entire triple world by means of the wrathful form of method and wisdom of the Tathagatas, and because he burns the fuel of ignorance.

original: de nyid bgegs rnams 'jig cing rnyog par byed pas na 'jigs pa chen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid bgegs rnams 'jig cing rnyog par byed pas na 'jigs pa chen po ste /
translated: He is the great terror because he destroys and agitates the obstructors.

original: bcom ldan 'das gnod mdzes la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnod mdzes la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the name of the Bhagavat Trailokyavijaya.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the words “object,” etc., has been explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni sku mdog nag po zhal g-yas dkar g-yon dmar pa phyag gnyis 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya bcing ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni sku mdog nag po zhal g-yas dkar g-yon dmar pa phyag gnyis 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya bcing ba /
translated: This Bhagavat is black in color, with a white right face and a red left face, and he makes the mudra of the three worlds.

original: g-yas gnyis na rdo rje dang 'khor lo bsnams pa g-yon gnyis na lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yas gnyis na rdo rje dang 'khor lo bsnams pa g-yon gnyis na lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /

analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad lcags kyu dang zhags pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsnams pa'i gnod mdzes kyi sbyor ba la zhugs pas bsgrub par bya ba rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon la dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i gzugs
translated: All the Tathagatas dwelling in the realm of space, holding iron hooks and nooses, enter into the union of Sumbha, and place the one to be accomplished upon the vajra wind mandala.🔽The pledge seal form is generated, and one imagines that one strives to summon the girl.

original: su bskyed la bu mo 'gugs pa la brtson par bsams nas ming dang spel ba'i sbyor bas sngags bzlas pa bya zhing dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: su bskyed la bu mo 'gugs pa la brtson par bsams nas ming dang spel ba'i sbyor bas sngags bzlas pa bya zhing dgug par bya'o //

analyzed: 'bar ba'i lta ba zhes grags te //
translated: is renowned as the blazing gaze,

original: 'gro ba thams cad dgug par gsungs //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad dgug par gsungs //
translated: and is said to summon all beings.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i 'bar ba'i lta ba'ang dgug pa'i las thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i 'bar ba'i lta ba'ang dgug pa'i las thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The blazing gaze should be applied to all summoning activities.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sngar bshad pa'i gsang sngags kyis kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i las bsgrub tu rung ste gang 'di'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la rab tu snang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas spyan la sogs pa'i las so sor nges par bshad kyi 'o
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sngar bshad pa'i gsang sngags kyis kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i las bsgrub tu rung ste gang 'di'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams la rab tu snang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas spyan la sogs pa'i las so sor nges par bshad kyi 'o
translated: This is because they are explained as having specific activities such as the eye and so forth, in terms of the disciples who are to be tamed by them.

original: na kyang rnal 'byor pa'i mos pa'i dbang gis de dag thams cad kyang las thams cad mdzad pa yin no//
analyzed: na kyang rnal 'byor pa'i mos pa'i dbang gis de dag thams cad kyang las thams cad mdzad pa yin no//
translated: However, all of them can perform all activities by the power of the yogi's devotion.

original: da ni thams cad kyi spyi'i las kyi tshig rnams kyi don gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni thams cad kyi spyi'i las kyi tshig rnams kyi don gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Now, the meaning of the general activity words of all of them is stated:

original: ye shes chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ye shes chen po ni lha rnams sprul pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ye shes chen po ni lha rnams sprul pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Great wisdom and so forth. Great wisdom is the wisdom of emanating the deities.

original: de'i rnam par bsgyings pa ni rnam par rol pa ste sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'gugs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par bsgyings pa ni rnam par rol pa ste sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'gugs pa'o //
translated: Its play is its sport, which is summoning the buddhas and so forth.

original: de'i dga' ston ni des dga' ston mdzad pa ste rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub thob par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dga' ston ni des dga' ston mdzad pa ste rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub thob par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The festival of that is the performance of the festival, the attainment of the powers desired by the yogis.

original: de la dmigs pas na ting nge 'dzin de la yang ming de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pas na ting nge 'dzin de la yang ming de skad ces bya ste /
translated: And because it is focused on that, that samadhi is also called by that name.

original: las kyi tshogs bskyed pa'i rnam pa la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las kyi tshogs bskyed pa'i rnam pa la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is one-pointedly focused on the aspect of the generation of the aggregate of karma.

original: @224b sku gsum gyi mchog rdo rje 'chang skyed par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'dzin pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: @224b sku gsum gyi mchog rdo rje 'chang skyed par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'dzin pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: The generation of the supreme of the three bodies, Vajradhara, is the generation of the Vajra Holder, who is the embodiment of the three bodies.

original: de nyid ni sangs rgyas byang chub ste de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid ni sangs rgyas byang chub ste de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
translated: That itself is the enlightenment of the buddhas, because it is the nature of the lord of the gnosis of thatness.

original: 'byin zhes bya ba ni phyung ba ste las kyi tshogs rnams shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byin zhes bya ba ni phyung ba ste las kyi tshogs rnams shes par bya ste /
translated: The “emanation” is the bringing forth, the knowledge of the aggregate of karma.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rjes su dran nas las kyi tshogs rnams bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rjes su dran nas las kyi tshogs rnams bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, having recalled the Vajra Holder, he explained the aggregate of karma.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston pa yin te las 'di dag thams cad la de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de bskul ba bya ste dngos grub thams cad ni de la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston pa yin te las 'di dag thams cad la de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de bskul ba bya ste dngos grub thams cad ni de la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows that one should exhort the Blessed One to complete all these actions, because all powers depend on him.

original: de bas na 'di nyid kyi 'og nas /
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid kyi 'og nas /
translated: Therefore, just below this,

original: rgyal po kun gyi gnas la bzhugs //
analyzed: rgyal po kun gyi gnas la bzhugs //
translated: he resides in the abode of all kings,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
translated: Vajrasattva, the great being,

original: kun gyi sems rab rdzogs mdzad pa //
analyzed: kun gyi sems rab rdzogs mdzad pa //
translated: who perfects the mind of all,

original: yang dang yang du rab bskul bar //
analyzed: yang dang yang du rab bskul bar //
translated: should be repeatedly exhorted.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of this statement.

original: byang chub chen po rdo rje 'chang ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub chen po rdo rje 'chang ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The holder of great enlightenment vajra is the essence of the mind of enlightenment.

original: de dran pa sngon du 'gro bas las kyi tshogs rnams bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dran pa sngon du 'gro bas las kyi tshogs rnams bshad pa yin no //
translated: Remembering that, the collection of actions is explained.

original: des ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa brtan par gyur pas khams gsum po sems tsam du shes nas las rnams byas na 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //🔽'khor lo che la rnam gnas nas //
analyzed: des ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa brtan par gyur pas khams gsum po sems tsam du shes nas las rnams byas na 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o // 'khor lo che la rnam gnas nas //
translated: This teaches that one who has stabilized the cultivation of the Thought of Enlightenment, knowing the three realms to be mind only, will succeed if he performs the rites.🔽Dwelling in the great wheel,

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor chen po la 'dug pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor chen po la 'dug pas so //
translated: means dwelling in the great mandala.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: gnod mdzes kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnod mdzes kyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa ste /
translated: Dwelling in the mandala of Sumbha,

original: dkyil 'khor de la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas de'i sngags bzlas shing sangs rgyas kyi sprin gnod mdzes kyi sbyor bas zhugs pa lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa spros pas 'gugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas de'i sngags bzlas shing sangs rgyas kyi sprin gnod mdzes kyi sbyor bas zhugs pa lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa spros pas 'gugs par byed pa'o //
translated: the yogin dwelling in that mandala, repeating his mantra, enters by the application of Sumbha, emanating a cloud of Buddhas, with hooks and nooses in their hands, and attracts.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprin ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprin ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: The cloud of Buddhas is all the Tathagatas.

original: rdo rje 'chang ba'i sprin ni rdo rje sems dpa'i sprin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ba'i sprin ni rdo rje sems dpa'i sprin no //
translated: The cloud of Vajradharas is the cloud of Vajrasattvas.

original: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same with others.

original: dgug par gsungs pa 'di ni gtso bo ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgug par gsungs pa 'di ni gtso bo ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not the principal [purpose] of the statement of summoning.

original: snga ma nyid dus dang po bya bar yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma nyid dus dang po bya bar yang shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the previous [statement] is to be done at the beginning.

original: de bas na gzhan dag las kyang //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan dag las kyang //
translated: Therefore, it is also stated elsewhere:

original: sngags kyi sems dpas bya ba ni //🔽rdo rje gsang ba rmad po che //
analyzed: sngags kyi sems dpas bya ba ni // rdo rje gsang ba rmad po che //
translated: The mantra hero should do

original: khro bo rgyal po bkug nas ni //
analyzed: khro bo rgyal po bkug nas ni //
translated: the summoning of the wrathful king,🔽the great secret vajra,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad rab tu mchod //🔽ces gsungs pa yin no //🔽da ni rnal 'byor thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod @225a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad rab tu mchod // ces gsungs pa yin no // da ni rnal 'byor thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod @225a * //
translated: and make offerings to all the buddhas.

original: pa'i bu mo la sogs pa dgug pa yin te /
analyzed: pa'i bu mo la sogs pa dgug pa yin te /
translated: Now, [the verse] beginning with all yogas is the summoning of the desired maiden, etc.

original: kun mkhyen ye shes rang bzhin gtso //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes rang bzhin gtso //
translated: The chief one is the nature of omniscient wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of the wisdom of body, speech, and mind.

original: rang sngags skyes bur bdag bsgoms na //
analyzed: rang sngags skyes bur bdag bsgoms na //
translated: Having contemplated oneself as the being of one's mantra,

original: zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rang gi lha'i skur rang gi sngags kyi bdag nyid rnam par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rang gi lha'i skur rang gi sngags kyi bdag nyid rnam par bsams pa'o //
translated: one should contemplate oneself as the form of one's deity, such as Yamāntaka, etc., with the nature of one's mantra.

original: rlung la rkang pa bzhag nas su //
analyzed: rlung la rkang pa bzhag nas su //
translated: Having placed one's foot on the wind,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rkang pa'i 'og tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhag pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rkang pa'i 'og tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhag pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The one who is placed on the wind mandala under the feet is called that.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that she is placed on the wind mandala.

original: lcags kyus snying nas drangs nas ni //
analyzed: lcags kyus snying nas drangs nas ni //
translated: Having drawn with the hook from the heart,

original: zhes bya ba ni lcags kyus snying drangs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lcags kyus snying drangs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: the one who is drawn with the hook from the heart is called that.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being shown.

original: rnal 'byor pa rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /
translated: The yogi, endowed with the great seal of his deity, sits in the center of the mandala of that deity.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i bu mo dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i gzugs su bskyed la rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon te de la mngon par phyogs par drangs shing /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i bu mo dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i gzugs su bskyed la rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon te de la mngon par phyogs par drangs shing /
translated: The excellent girl who is desired is generated in the form of the pledge seal and placed on the wind mandala. She is drawn to face oneself.

original: rang gi lha'i gzugs kyis lcags kyu dang zhags pa thogs te /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i gzugs kyis lcags kyu dang zhags pa thogs te /
translated: With the form of one’s deity, holding a hook and a noose,

original: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bcings la drangs nas khyer te 'ongs par bsam pa dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang de 'gugs par brtson par bsam zhing bdag nyid kyang ming dang spel pa'i sbyor bas gsang sngags zlos shing dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bcings la drangs nas khyer te 'ongs par bsam pa dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang de 'gugs par brtson par bsam zhing bdag nyid kyang ming dang spel pa'i sbyor bas gsang sngags zlos shing dgug par bya'o //
translated: Having bound him in accordance with the place, one should imagine that he is brought and carried, and that the maṇḍala residents are striving to summon him, and one should summon him with the repetition of the mantra, “Oṁ, (name of the victim)!”

original: skyes pa dgug pa la ni sbyor ba 'di nyid go bzlog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa dgug pa la ni sbyor ba 'di nyid go bzlog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: For summoning a man, one should know that this application is reversed.

original: thag ring po nas dgug na bsgrub par bya ba gal te yongs su bskams par 'gyur ba yang srid pas /
analyzed: thag ring po nas dgug na bsgrub par bya ba gal te yongs su bskams par 'gyur ba yang srid pas /
translated: If one is summoning from a distance, it is possible that the victim will dry up completely.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to prevent that,

original: rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad ni //
analyzed: rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad ni //
translated: one should imagine Vajra Vairocana

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te bsams zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i mgo bo la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te bsams zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i mgo bo la'o //
translated: on the head of the victim.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “That” refers to the victim.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon te thag ring po nas dgug na bsgrub par bya ba'i mgo la zla ba'i steng na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad sku mdog dkar po bdud rtsi 'bab pa bsams la dgug par bya'o zhes pa'o
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon te thag ring po nas dgug na bsgrub par bya ba'i mgo la zla ba'i steng na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad sku mdog dkar po bdud rtsi 'bab pa bsams la dgug par bya'o zhes pa'o
translated: This is the teaching: having mounted upon the wind mandala, if one should summon from afar, one should imagine the Blessed One Vairocana on the head of the one to be summoned, white in color, with nectar flowing, and one should summon.

original: // rdo rje dkyil 'khor las byung ba //
analyzed: // rdo rje dkyil 'khor las byung ba //
translated: Arisen from the vajra mandala,

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rnam par bzhugs par bsgom mo zhes shugs kyis sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rnam par bzhugs par bsgom mo zhes shugs kyis sbyar ro //
translated: one should meditate on the Blessed One as dwelling on the vajra moon mandala, as the force of the text indicates.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu sku chen @225b po //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu sku chen @225b po //
translated: The vajra hook, the great body,

original: zhes bya ba ni yi ge dza: las byung ba'i lcags kyu 'bar ba phyag na bsnams pa'i rang gi lha'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yi ge dza: las byung ba'i lcags kyu 'bar ba phyag na bsnams pa'i rang gi lha'o //
translated: is one's deity, holding a blazing hook arisen from the syllable JRA.

original: 'di ni bu mo dgug pa'i sbyor ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ni bu mo dgug pa'i sbyor ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: This is the special application for summoning a girl.

original: gzhan dag na re /🔽rdo rje dkyil 'khor las byung ba //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re / rdo rje dkyil 'khor las byung ba //
translated: Others say:🔽Arisen from the vajra mandala,

original: rdo rje lcags kyu sku chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu sku chen po //
translated: the vajra hook, the great body,

original: zhes bya ba rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs su yongs su gyur par bsgoms la de la bskyon nas bu mo dgug par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs su yongs su gyur par bsgoms la de la bskyon nas bu mo dgug par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Having meditated on this as the form of the vajra wind mandala, one should mount it and summon the girl.

original: rdo rje gsum gsungs khro bo ni //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gsungs khro bo ni //
translated: The wrathful one is said to be the three vajras.

original: zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i yi ge las byung ba zhal gsum pa mi bskyod pa'i gtsug gi nor bu can /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i yi ge las byung ba zhal gsum pa mi bskyod pa'i gtsug gi nor bu can /
translated: The three vajras are the body, speech, and mind vajras. The three faces are the crest jewels of Akṣobhya.

original: sku mdog sngo ba rol pa'i stang stabs kyis bzhugs par khro bo rdo rje sa 'og bsgom mo zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sku mdog sngo ba rol pa'i stang stabs kyis bzhugs par khro bo rdo rje sa 'og bsgom mo zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The blue body is the wrathful vajra subterranean, standing in the dancing posture.🔽The rest is self-evident.

original: gsal shing rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa yis //
analyzed: gsal shing rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa yis //
translated: The stake, vajra hook, and noose.

original: zhes bya ba ni gsal shing dang zhags pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas 'di skad ces bya'o //🔽de yang phyag g-yas pa gnyis na gsal shing dang lcags kyu bsnams pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsal shing dang zhags pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas 'di skad ces bya'o // de yang phyag g-yas pa gnyis na gsal shing dang lcags kyu bsnams pa /
translated: The stake, noose, and so forth are held.🔽The two right hands hold the stake and hook,

original: g-yon gnyis na rdo rje dang zhags pa bsnams pa yin par rigs so //
analyzed: g-yon gnyis na rdo rje dang zhags pa bsnams pa yin par rigs so //
translated: and the two left hands hold the vajra and noose.

original: nye bar mtshan pa 'dis na g-yas kyi cig shos la ni ral gri /
analyzed: nye bar mtshan pa 'dis na g-yas kyi cig shos la ni ral gri /
translated: Some believe that by this analogy, the other on the right holds a sword,

original: g-yon na dgra sta bsnams par la la 'dod do //
analyzed: g-yon na dgra sta bsnams par la la 'dod do //
translated: and the one on the left holds a shield.

original: drangs na zhes bya ba ni lcags kyus drangs nas zhags pas bcings la bsgyel ba'i tshul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: drangs na zhes bya ba ni lcags kyus drangs nas zhags pas bcings la bsgyel ba'i tshul du byas pa'o //
translated: To drag means to drag with a hook, to bind with a noose, and to make it fall down.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te rnal 'byor pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rdo rje sa 'og rnal 'byor pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor bas 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te rnal 'byor pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rdo rje sa 'og rnal 'byor pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor bas 'dug ste /
translated: This is what is being taught: The yogi/nī of the vajra underworld, as previously explained, sits in union with the maṇḍala of that [deity].

original: de nyid kyis snga ma bzhin du lha ma yin gyi bu mo 'gugs bzhin par bsams la ming dang spel nas de'i sngags bzlas pa'i sbyor bas dgug par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis snga ma bzhin du lha ma yin gyi bu mo 'gugs bzhin par bsams la ming dang spel nas de'i sngags bzlas pa'i sbyor bas dgug par bya ste /
translated: Imagining that the asura maiden is being summoned by that [deity] just as before, one should summon her by the yoga of repeating her name and mantra.

original: lha ma yin gyi bu mo dgug pa'i khyad par gyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi bu mo dgug pa'i khyad par gyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the special yoga for summoning the asura maiden.

original: gzas zin tshe na khar bcug ste //
analyzed: gzas zin tshe na khar bcug ste //
translated: When she is seized, place her in your mouth,

original: rdzas rgyal rdo rje lcags kyus bsgrub //
analyzed: rdzas rgyal rdo rje lcags kyus bsgrub //
translated: and accomplish the substance with the vajra hook.

original: ces bya ba ni gzas zin pa'i tshe na rdzas khar bcug la rdo rje lcags kyus dgug pa'i sbyor bas nam mkha'i khams thams cad na gnas pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa 'gugs pa la brtson pa rnams dgug pa la sogs pa byas te bsgrub
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gzas zin pa'i tshe na rdzas khar bcug la rdo rje lcags kyus dgug pa'i sbyor bas nam mkha'i khams thams cad na gnas pa'i 'phags pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa 'gugs pa la brtson pa rnams dgug pa la sogs pa byas te bsgrub
translated: when there is an eclipse, one should place the substance in one's mouth, and with the yoga of the vajra hook, one should summon all the Ārya-Yamāri and so on abiding in the realm of space, and having summoned them, one should perform the summoning and so on, and should practice.

original: par bya'o // 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: par bya'o // 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: rnal 'byor pas gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /🔽gzas zin pa'i tshe rdzas khar bcug la der 'phags @226a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste / gzas zin pa'i tshe rdzas khar bcug la der 'phags @226a * //
translated: the yogī, sitting in the center of one's maṇḍala of Yamāri and so on,

original: pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du dgug pa la sogs pa byas la zla ba'am nyi ma gzas zin pa la blta bzhin du ji srid gzas ma btang gi bar du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: pa gshin rje gshed la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du dgug pa la sogs pa byas la zla ba'am nyi ma gzas zin pa la blta bzhin du ji srid gzas ma btang gi bar du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: when there is an eclipse, should place the substance in one's mouth, and there, having summoned the Ārya-Yamāri and so on just as before, one should perform the summoning and so on, and should recite as long as one can see the moon or sun eclipsed.

original: de nas bsrung ba byas pa de ltar bsgrubs pa'i rdzas kyi rgyal po 'di nyid kyis drag po la sogs pa gang yang rung pa'i ming bris la rkang ba g-yon bas mnan te bsgrub par bya ba yang rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon te /
analyzed: de nas bsrung ba byas pa de ltar bsgrubs pa'i rdzas kyi rgyal po 'di nyid kyis drag po la sogs pa gang yang rung pa'i ming bris la rkang ba g-yon bas mnan te bsgrub par bya ba yang rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon te /
translated: Then, having performed the protection rite, one should write the name of any enemy, such as Rudra, and so on, with this king of substances that is to be accomplished, and trample it with one's left foot.

original: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams kyis lcags kyus drang zhing zhags pas bcings nas 'gugs bzhin par bsams la /
analyzed: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams kyis lcags kyus drang zhing zhags pas bcings nas 'gugs bzhin par bsams la /
translated: One should imagine that Yamântaka and so forth lead him, bound with a noose, and draw him in, placing him on the vajra wind mandala.

original: de bzhin du ming spel ba'i sbyor bas gsang sngags bzlas na khugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ming spel ba'i sbyor bas gsang sngags bzlas na khugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if one repeats the mantra with the application of increasing the name, he will be summoned.

original: bud med dgug pa la ni rkang ba g-yas pas mnan no //
analyzed: bud med dgug pa la ni rkang ba g-yas pas mnan no //
translated: For summoning a woman, one should trample with one's right foot.

original: sangs rgyas 'khor lo legs bsams te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'khor lo legs bsams te //
translated: One should visualize the wheel of the Buddha,

original: 'jam pa'i rdo rje rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i rdo rje rnam par bsgom //
translated: and meditate on Mañjuvajra.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su ji skad bshad pa'i 'jam dpal gyi skur bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su ji skad bshad pa'i 'jam dpal gyi skur bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This means that one should meditate on oneself as the body of Mañjuśrī as explained in the center of the mandala of Vairocana.

original: lag na rdo rje lcags kyu thogs //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje lcags kyu thogs //
translated: One should hold a vajra hook in one's hand,🔽and imagine that one is Vajrapāṇi.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag gnyis na rdo rje dang lcags kyu bsnams pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag gnyis na rdo rje dang lcags kyu bsnams pa ste /
translated: This is the mantra of Yamântaka, the Destroyer.

original: snying gar 'di nyid bsgom zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: snying gar 'di nyid bsgom zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: The distinctive feature is that he is meditated upon at the heart.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te 'jam dpal gyi rnal 'byor ba rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te 'jam dpal gyi rnal 'byor ba rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /
translated: This is what is being taught: The practitioner of Manjushri, sitting in the center of his mandala,

original: rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ji skad du gsungs pa'i gshin rje gshed kyi skur de'i gsang sngags kyis bsgoms la snga ma bzhin du legs par spros te /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ji skad du gsungs pa'i gshin rje gshed kyi skur de'i gsang sngags kyis bsgoms la snga ma bzhin du legs par spros te /
translated: meditates on the form of Yamântaka at his heart on a sun mandala, with his mantra, and emanates him well, as before.🔽He enters the heart of the yaksha lady who is to be harmed, and she is burned up like the fire at the end of the eon.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i gnod sbyin mo'i snying gar zhugs pa dang / de bskal ba'i me bzhin du sreg par 'gyur la rang gi mdun na bsil bar gyur pa'i lam yod pa la a'a gtstsha zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis 'jam dpal rdo rje la skyabs su 'gro bar mngon par 'dod par bsams la gshin rje gshed kyi gsang sngags yi
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i gnod sbyin mo'i snying gar zhugs pa dang / de bskal ba'i me bzhin du sreg par 'gyur la rang gi mdun na bsil bar gyur pa'i lam yod pa la a'a gtstsha zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis 'jam dpal rdo rje la skyabs su 'gro bar mngon par 'dod par bsams la gshin rje gshed kyi gsang sngags yi
translated: In front of her, on a path that is cool, he imagines her going for refuge to Manjushri Vajra with the mantra agaccha.

original: ge kshi dang spel bas sngags bzlas la dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: ge kshi dang spel bas sngags bzlas la dgug par bya'o //
translated: One should summon by the recitation of the mantra, combining the ge and kṣa.

original: phyag rgya gsang sngags spyor ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya gsang sngags spyor ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug ste /
translated: With regard to the verse beginning The application of the seal and mantra, etc., the yogī of Yamāri, etc., should sit in the center of his maṇḍala.

original: rang gi phyag rgya dang gsang sngags las byung ba'i gshin rje gshed la sogs pa grangs med pas nam mkha' kun du @226b bkang ste /
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya dang gsang sngags las byung ba'i gshin rje gshed la sogs pa grangs med pas nam mkha' kun du @226b bkang ste /
translated: Having filled the entire sky with countless Yamāri, etc., arisen from his seal and mantra,

original: 'khor lo dang rdo rje la sogs pa rang gi mtshan ma dang lcags kyu phyag na bsnams pas bsgrub par bya ba 'gugs par gyur par bsam zhing khyad par gyi sbyor bas dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang rdo rje la sogs pa rang gi mtshan ma dang lcags kyu phyag na bsnams pas bsgrub par bya ba 'gugs par gyur par bsam zhing khyad par gyi sbyor bas dgug par bya'o //
translated: he should imagine that the one to be summoned is drawn by the signs of his own wheel, vajra, etc., and the hook in his hand, and should summon by the special application.

original: 'di ni dgug pa spyi'i yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ni dgug pa spyi'i yin pas /
translated: This is the general summoning,

original: dgug par bya ba'i gnas su gsungs //
analyzed: dgug par bya ba'i gnas su gsungs //
translated: and is said to be the place of summoning.

original: zhes bya ba yin te dgug pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te dgug pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is the basis of all summoning.

original: gzhan du byas na 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du byas na 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: If done otherwise, it will not be accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te spyi dang khyad par gyi sbyor ba dag gis 'gugs pa la sogs pa mi byed na de'i tshe de 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te spyi dang khyad par gyi sbyor ba dag gis 'gugs pa la sogs pa mi byed na de'i tshe de 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not perform the summoning, etc. by means of the general and particular applications, then at that time one will not accomplish them.

original: de bas na gnyis kas kyang bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis kas kyang bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that both should be done.

original: rgyal po'i zhabs drung kun gnas pas //
analyzed: rgyal po'i zhabs drung kun gnas pas //
translated: All the kings reside in the presence of the king.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po ni sngags thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po ni sngags thams cad kyi'o //
translated: The king is of all the mantras.

original: kun gyi gnas la bzhugs zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid kyis lha thams cad kyi sku la rnam par bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: kun gyi gnas la bzhugs zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyid kyis lha thams cad kyi sku la rnam par bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Residing in the abode of all means that by means of nondual intuition itself, all the deities reside in the body.

original: yang dang yang du bskul par bya //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bskul par bya //
translated: One should repeatedly urge.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bdag la dngos grub bstsal du gsol zhes skad cig re re zhing bskul bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bdag la dngos grub bstsal du gsol zhes skad cig re re zhing bskul bar bya ste /
translated: One should urge again and again, moment by moment, saying, “Blessed One, please grant me powers.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na rgyal po kun gyi gnas la bzhugs pas bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na rgyal po kun gyi gnas la bzhugs pas bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because it is the duty of one who resides in the abode of all the kings.

original: gzhan dag ni dgug pa'i las rnams la bcom ldan 'das gnod mdzes nyid bskul bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dgug pa'i las rnams la bcom ldan 'das gnod mdzes nyid bskul bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that one should incite Bhairava himself to the rites of summoning.

original: ye shes kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ye shes kyis rnam par rgyal ba ni gdug pa'i rang bzhin zil gyis gnon pa ste zil gyis gnon pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ye shes kyis rnam par rgyal ba ni gdug pa'i rang bzhin zil gyis gnon pa ste zil gyis gnon pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: By the knowledge and so on. The one who is victorious by knowledge is the one who overcomes the nature of the wicked, and that which is the overcoming is called that.

original: ral pa gcig ma'o //
analyzed: ral pa gcig ma'o //
translated: This is the one-braided.

original: de nyid rdo rje ste dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: That itself is the vajra, the object, and so on. The meaning of this has been explained.

original: gsang sngags bzlas brjod byas pa yis //
analyzed: gsang sngags bzlas brjod byas pa yis //
translated: By the recitation of the mantra,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ral ba gcig ma'i rnal 'byor bas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la snga ma bzhin du klu'i bu mo 'gugs par byed par bsams la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ral ba gcig ma'i rnal 'byor bas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la snga ma bzhin du klu'i bu mo 'gugs par byed par bsams la /
translated: and so on. One who is in the yoga of the one-braided, sitting in the middle of her maṇḍala, imagines as before the summoning of the nāga girl.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i ming dang mdung can ma'i sngags spel zhing bzla'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i ming dang mdung can ma'i sngags spel zhing bzla'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra of Kṣetrapāla, augmenting it with the name of the one to be summoned.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas chags pa'i //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas chags pa'i //
translated: By the five objects of desire,🔽 and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la rjes su chags pas bdag nyid kyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la rjes su chags pas bdag nyid kyis te /
translated: One is attached to form and so on, and thus one is not liberated.🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di yang sku mdog sngo bo cod pan la mi bskyod pas brgyan pa /🔽ral gri dang lcags kyu dang rdo rje dang sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang khrag gis yongs su gang @227a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di yang sku mdog sngo bo cod pan la mi bskyod pas brgyan pa / ral gri dang lcags kyu dang rdo rje dang sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang khrag gis yongs su gang @227a * //
translated: One should know that this Bhagavatī is blue-colored, adorned with Akṣobhya in her topknot,

original: ba'i thod pa dang dgra sta phyag na bsnams pa /
analyzed: ba'i thod pa dang dgra sta phyag na bsnams pa /
translated: holding a sword, iron hook, vajra, threatening mudrā, and noose, with a skull-cup filled with blood, and a battle-ax in her hand,

original: rol pa'i stang stabs kyis legs par bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rol pa'i stang stabs kyis legs par bzhugs pa /
translated: standing in the pose of dancing,

original: yi ge h'um las byung ba mchog tu klu'i bu mo 'gugs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um las byung ba mchog tu klu'i bu mo 'gugs par shes par bya'o //
translated: arisen from the syllable hūṃ, the supreme summoner of nāga girls.

original: nam mkha' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nam mkha' ni go 'byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nam mkha' ni go 'byed do //
translated: As for great space, space is the provider of space.

original: chen po ni thams cad du khyab pa ste /
analyzed: chen po ni thams cad du khyab pa ste /
translated: Great means pervading everything.

original: sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir mgyogs pa'i shugs dang ldan pa'i sems kyis khyab par gang yin pa de la de la de skad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir mgyogs pa'i shugs dang ldan pa'i sems kyis khyab par gang yin pa de la de la de skad ces bya ba ste /
translated: That which is pervaded by the mind endowed with the speed of the wind for the sake of accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings is called that.

original: des na 'jug par dka' pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang chos mthun par gnas pa na skul byed ma la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'jug par dka' pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang chos mthun par gnas pa na skul byed ma la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is difficult to enter, it is called “oceanic” because it is similar to the ocean.

original: de nyid 'da' bar mi bya bas na dam tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid 'da' bar mi bya bas na dam tshig go //
translated: Since it is not to be transgressed, it is a vow.

original: de la dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The object of that, etc., is as before.

original: sbyor ba yis zhes bya ba ni spyi bor rnam par snang mdzad dgod pa la sogs pa'o //
