analyzed: sbyor ba yis zhes bya ba ni spyi bor rnam par snang mdzad dgod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “By union” means placing Vairocana on the crown, etc.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: skul byed ma'i rnal 'byor bas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la /
analyzed: skul byed ma'i rnal 'byor bas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la /
translated: The practitioner of Cunda, sitting in the middle of her maṇḍala,

original: klu'i bu mo la sogs pa rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon te /
analyzed: klu'i bu mo la sogs pa rdo rje rlung gi dkyil 'khor la bskyon te /
translated: places the nāga girl, etc., on the vajra wind maṇḍala,

original: 'phags ma tsun de'i sku nam mkha' khyab pa rnams kyis 'gugs par byed par bsams la /
analyzed: 'phags ma tsun de'i sku nam mkha' khyab pa rnams kyis 'gugs par byed par bsams la /
translated: and imagines that the forms of Ārya Cundā, pervading space, are summoning her.

original: de bzhin gsang sngags bzlas nas bkug ste nye bar longs spyad bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gsang sngags bzlas nas bkug ste nye bar longs spyad bar bya'o //
translated: Having summoned her with the mantra, one should enjoy her.🔽“Space,” etc.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thams cad khyab pas nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thams cad khyab pas nam mkha' ste /
translated: Space is all-pervading.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa chos nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa chos nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The pristine consciousness of reality, which is pure by nature.

original: de nyid mi phyed pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: Since it is indivisible, it is a vajra.

original: des rnam par rgyal ba ni gdug pa rnams zil gyis gnon pa la brtson pa yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste khro gnyer can no //
analyzed: des rnam par rgyal ba ni gdug pa rnams zil gyis gnon pa la brtson pa yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste khro gnyer can no //
translated: The one who is victorious by that is one who strives to overcome the wicked. He is called that.

original: de nyid mchog ste de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o /
analyzed: de nyid mchog ste de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o /
translated: The supreme one is the one who observes that.

original: chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos chen po lung dang rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos chen po lung dang rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The Dharma is the great Dharma, which has the characteristics of scripture and realization.

original: de nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi 'dren pas na bdud rtsi'o //
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi 'dren pas na bdud rtsi'o //
translated: Since that very [Dharma] is the nectar of non-dual pristine consciousness, it is nectar.

original: de nyid ni dam tshig ste rgyu rdzogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni dam tshig ste rgyu rdzogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That very [nectar] is the commitment, which is the perfection of the cause.

original: de yang 'dir rdo rje khro gnyer can gyi rnal 'byor bas de'i dkyil 'khor la gnas te nye bar longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir rdo rje khro gnyer can gyi rnal 'byor bas de'i dkyil 'khor la gnas te nye bar longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, here, by the yoga of Vajra-Bhrkuṭī, abiding in her maṇḍala, one should enjoy it.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la yang smos pas ni 'gog pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pas sam /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la yang smos pas ni 'gog pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pas sam /
translated: Or means that one should attain one-pointedness of mind by means of the vajra repetition of cessation, etc.,

original: rdo rje phra mo la sogs pa bsgoms pas sems rtse gcig pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phra mo la sogs pa bsgoms pas sems rtse gcig pa thob pa'o //
translated: or by meditating on the subtle vajra, etc.

original: skye bo med pa'i zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang la sogs par ro //
analyzed: skye bo med pa'i zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang la sogs par ro //
translated: In a place without people means in a temple, etc.

original: gsang sngags @227b bye ba bzlas nas su //
analyzed: gsang sngags @227b bye ba bzlas nas su //
translated: Having repeated ten million mantras,

original: zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i phreng ba bzlas pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i phreng ba bzlas pas so //
translated: means by repeating the rosary of syllables.

original: las rnams thams cad bya bar gsungs //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad bya bar gsungs //
translated: It is taught that one should perform all actions

original: zhes bya ba ni sngags de yis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngags de yis so //
translated: means by that mantra.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te lha'i bu mo mchog dgug pa la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa'i cho ga gang dag yod pa de dag thams cad la rdo rje phra mo la sogs pa bsgoms pas sems rtse gcig pa thob pa'am bzlas brjod bye ba byas
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te lha'i bu mo mchog dgug pa la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa'i cho ga gang dag yod pa de dag thams cad la rdo rje phra mo la sogs pa bsgoms pas sems rtse gcig pa thob pa'am bzlas brjod bye ba byas
translated: This is what is being taught: all of those rites that are taught, such as summoning the supreme celestial maiden, etc., should be performed by one who has attained one-pointedness of mind by meditating on the subtle vajra, etc., or by one who has repeated ten million times.

original: nas bya'o // bskrad pa la sogs pa ni bzlas brjod bye pa ma byas pa'am /
analyzed: nas bya'o // bskrad pa la sogs pa ni bzlas brjod bye pa ma byas pa'am /
translated: As for banishing, etc., one should perform those without having repeated ten million times.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ma thob pas kyang dad pa brtan por byas pas la la byar rung ba yod do //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ma thob pas kyang dad pa brtan por byas pas la la byar rung ba yod do //
translated: Even one who has not attained one-pointedness of mind, by means of firm faith, is fit for some of them.

original: gzhan dag slob dpon smod pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon spyod kyi yul gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag slob dpon smod pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon spyod kyi yul gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The others, those who revile the teacher, etc., are the objects of the rite of assault.

original: nye bar mtshon pa 'dis ni dkon mchog gsum la gnod par byed pa la sogs pa'ang bsdu'o //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa 'dis ni dkon mchog gsum la gnod par byed pa la sogs pa'ang bsdu'o //
translated: By this example, one who injures the Three Jewels, etc., is also included.

original: byang chub dngos grub legs par thob //
analyzed: byang chub dngos grub legs par thob //
translated: One attains the perfection of enlightenment.

original: ces bya ba ni mngon spyod kyi yan lag 'dis mngon spyod bya bar 'os pa la las byas la sems can thams cad 'dul ba'i thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi byang chub rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mngon spyod kyi yan lag 'dis mngon spyod bya bar 'os pa la las byas la sems can thams cad 'dul ba'i thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi byang chub rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of this branch of assault, one should perform the rite of assault on those who are fit for it, and one will realize enlightenment, which is the means of disciplining all sentient beings.

original: sku gsum ye shes las byung ba //
analyzed: sku gsum ye shes las byung ba //
translated: It arises from the gnosis of the three bodies.

original: zhes bya ba la sku dang gsung dang thugs las byung ba'i gsod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sku dang gsung dang thugs las byung ba'i gsod pa'o //
translated: It arises from the body, speech, and mind.

original: dgra la yang zhes bya ba la yang rgyud gzhan dag las /
analyzed: dgra la yang zhes bya ba la yang rgyud gzhan dag las /
translated: Even an enemy, in other tantras, it is said:

original: phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi //
translated: All sentient beings of the ten directions,

original: lus dang dag sems bsad par ni //
analyzed: lus dang dag sems bsad par ni //
translated: One should cultivate the special

original: khyad par dag tu bsgom par bya //
analyzed: khyad par dag tu bsgom par bya //
translated: meditation on the killing of the body and the mind.🔽There is no doubt that one will

original: dgra rnams la ni gdon mi za //
analyzed: dgra rnams la ni gdon mi za //
translated: overcome the enemies.

original: zhes gsungs pas 'dir so ma nyi mi bya ste 'di nyid kyis ni gcig tu bya ba bdag gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas 'dir so ma nyi mi bya ste 'di nyid kyis ni gcig tu bya ba bdag gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one should not be negligent here. This very verse teaches the nature of the single practice.

original: 'di ston pa yin te sems can thams cad gsod pa dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa rnam par 'jig pa dang / slob dpon la gnod par byed pa la sogs pa mngon spyod kyi yan lag bya bar 'os pa la lha'i bsrung ba dang bral bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ston pa yin te sems can thams cad gsod pa dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa rnam par 'jig pa dang / slob dpon la gnod par byed pa la sogs pa mngon spyod kyi yan lag bya bar 'os pa la lha'i bsrung ba dang bral bar bya ste /
translated: This is the teaching: One should deprive of divine protection those who are worthy of the rite of slaying, such as those who kill all sentient beings, those who destroy temples and so on, and those who harm teachers and so on.

original: bskal ba du mar dmyal ba la sogs par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes snying rje'i sems bskyed la mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bskyod par bya'o zhes bsams nas med par bya ba'am /
analyzed: bskal ba du mar dmyal ba la sogs par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes snying rje'i sems bskyed la mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bskyod par bya'o zhes bsams nas med par bya ba'am /
translated: One should think, “They will remain in the hells for many eons,” and generate compassion. Then, thinking, “I will lead them to the buddhafields of Akshobhya and so on,” one should deprive them of their protection.

original: bsad pa'i dngos po dmigs la gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas mngon spyod kyis bya ba'i las bya'o //
analyzed: bsad pa'i dngos po dmigs la gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas mngon spyod kyis bya ba'i las bya'o //
translated: One should perform the rite of sorcery with the yoga of Yamantaka, etc., visualizing the object to be killed.

original: khrag gam chu yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni cho ga gsungs pa yin te /🔽mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni bsrub @228a * //
analyzed: khrag gam chu yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni cho ga gsungs pa yin te / mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni bsrub @228a * //
translated: The blood or water, etc., is the declaration of the rite.

original: bar bya ba'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: bar bya ba'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: The sign is the effigy to be churned.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //
translated: The king of wrath is Yamantaka, etc.

original: gsang sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na //
analyzed: gsang sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na //
translated: Having recited the mantra one hundred and eight times,

original: zhes bya ba ni bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad byas pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad byas pas so //
translated: means having done the recitation one hundred and eight times.

original: sangs rgyas kyang ni nges par 'jig / ces bya ba ni sbyor ba phul du byung bar gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang ni nges par 'jig / ces bya ba ni sbyor ba phul du byung bar gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Even the Buddhas will certainly be destroyed means that the application is excellent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar de rnams la ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba ni mi srid la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar de rnams la ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba ni mi srid la /
translated: Why is that? It is because death is impossible for them.

original: 'dir de dag gis mngon spyod bya ba'i phur bu bshad pa la yang ma yin na ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'dir de dag gis mngon spyod bya ba'i phur bu bshad pa la yang ma yin na ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
translated: If it is not explained here that the rite of sorcery is the stake, why is it said?

original: de ni bden te de dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba mi srid pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bden te de dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba mi srid pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: That is true, but it is impossible for them to die.

original: 'on kyang sbyor ba 'di nyid la dngos grub mchog stsol ba las mi ldog ba la bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyor ba 'di nyid la dngos grub mchog stsol ba las mi ldog ba la bya'o //
translated: However, it is said that they are not turned away from the bestowal of the supreme power in this very application.

original: rgyud gzhan dag las /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dag las /
translated: In other tantras it is said:

original: 'ga' zhig sbyor ba ma thob pas //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig sbyor ba ma thob pas //
translated: Some, not having attained application,

original: sangs rgyas gsod pa'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsod pa'i bdag nyid can //
translated: are of the nature of killing the Buddha.

original: de la phan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de la phan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to benefit them,

original: dngos grub myur bar rab tu bsgom //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: dngos grub myur bar rab tu bsgom // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: the power is quickly and fully meditated.

original: chus brlan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i don nyid gsal bar bstan pas so //🔽khro bo'i mdun du bcings nas su //
analyzed: chus brlan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i don nyid gsal bar bstan pas so // khro bo'i mdun du bcings nas su //
translated: The words “moistened by water” and so forth clarify the very meaning just explained.

original: zhes bya ba ni khro po'i nga rgyal drag pos bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro po'i nga rgyal drag pos bya'o //
translated: “Having bound in front of the wrathful one” is done with the fierce pride of wrath.

original: khro bo 'khrugs pa yis zhes bya ba ni thams cad du khro bo'i lus 'bar pas khyab pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: khro bo 'khrugs pa yis zhes bya ba ni thams cad du khro bo'i lus 'bar pas khyab pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “By the wrathful one’s agitation” is the method of being pervaded by the blazing body of the wrathful one everywhere.

original: kha bzhin rnam par bsgyur byas te //
analyzed: kha bzhin rnam par bsgyur byas te //
translated: “Having transformed the face”

original: zhes bya ba ni kha bzhin rnam par bsgyur pa ni 'jigs par byed pa'i gzugs can te rnam par bsgyur ba des du mar rnam par bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kha bzhin rnam par bsgyur pa ni 'jigs par byed pa'i gzugs can te rnam par bsgyur ba des du mar rnam par bsgyur ba ste /
translated: The one who has a face that is transformed is the one who has a fearful form. By that transformation, he is transformed in many ways.

original: rang gi las kyi rjes su mthun pa'i stobs dang ldan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi rjes su mthun pa'i stobs dang ldan pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called that because he has the power that is in accordance with his karma.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyang 'jigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyang 'jigs par 'gyur //
translated: The element of space is also frightened.

original: zhes pa 'dis ni che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis ni che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches his greatness.

original: ma mo'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon spyod kyi gnas kyi nges pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ma mo'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mngon spyod kyi gnas kyi nges pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: The abode of the mātṛs, etc., is the rule for the site of killing.

original: gang na mo bdun po gnas pa ni ma mo'i gnas so //
analyzed: gang na mo bdun po gnas pa ni ma mo'i gnas so //
translated: The abode of the mātṛs is where the seven mātṛs reside.

original: shin gcig tu zhes bya ba ni shing gzhan gyi grib mas ma non pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin gcig tu zhes bya ba ni shing gzhan gyi grib mas ma non pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Alone means not shaded by the foliage of other trees.

original: de'i rkang rjes la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang pa rjes kyi sa'o //
analyzed: de'i rkang rjes la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rkang pa rjes kyi sa'o //
translated: His footprint is the ground of the footprint of the one to be accomplished.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu bo'i dogs gnyis kyis la sogs pa yang bsdus te de dag gis gzugs brnyan bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu bo'i dogs gnyis kyis la sogs pa yang bsdus te de dag gis gzugs brnyan bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The word also includes the two banks of the river, etc. One should make an effigy is the remainder.

original: mi rus las byas phur bu dag / ces bya ba ni mi'i rus pa las byas @228b ba'i phur bus so //
analyzed: mi rus las byas phur bu dag / ces bya ba ni mi'i rus pa las byas @228b ba'i phur bus so //
translated: With a dagger made of human bone means with a dagger made of human bone.

original: phur bu yis ni zhes bya ba ni lte ba yan chad stod bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i gzugs can la smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i dbyibs su byas pa'o //
analyzed: phur bu yis ni zhes bya ba ni lte ba yan chad stod bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i gzugs can la smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i dbyibs su byas pa'o //
translated: With the dagger means that the upper part above the navel is in the form of Amṛtakuṇḍali, and the lower part is in the shape of a single-pronged vajra.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa yang rung ba'i sbyor ba byas la /
analyzed: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa yang rung ba'i sbyor ba byas la /
translated: Having performed the yoga of Yamāntaka or whatever,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i phur bu blangs nas ngos bzhir yi ge h'um bzhi spyi bor gcig bkod la de nyid kyis ngur khrod du sna tshogs rdo rje bris la rkang rjes kyis dang dug la sogs pa rnams kyis de'i gzugs brnyan byas te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i phur bu blangs nas ngos bzhir yi ge h'um bzhi spyi bor gcig bkod la de nyid kyis ngur khrod du sna tshogs rdo rje bris la rkang rjes kyis dang dug la sogs pa rnams kyis de'i gzugs brnyan byas te /
translated: taking up the dagger as explained, one should arrange four HŪMs on the four sides and one on the top. With that, one should draw a crossed vajra in the charnel ground, and make an effigy of him with his footprints, poison, and so forth.

original: dug la sogs pa sems par byas pa'i ta la'i 'dab ma la sogs par de'i ming dang spel te gsang sngags bris la de'i khong du bcug ste sa la sogs pas kyang bkab la /
analyzed: dug la sogs pa sems par byas pa'i ta la'i 'dab ma la sogs par de'i ming dang spel te gsang sngags bris la de'i khong du bcug ste sa la sogs pas kyang bkab la /
translated: Having written the name of the one to be killed together with the mantra on a palm leaf, etc. that has been empowered by the poison, etc., place it in the heart of the effigy.

original: yi ge aa' sa bon las sngar bris pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng du lho phyogs su mngon du phyogs par bzhag la gnod mdzes kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i snying drangs nas gzhug pa dang bcing ba byas la /
analyzed: yi ge aa' sa bon las sngar bris pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng du lho phyogs su mngon du phyogs par bzhag la gnod mdzes kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i snying drangs nas gzhug pa dang bcing ba byas la /
translated: Having placed the effigy facing south on the variegated vajra previously drawn from the seed syllable A, summon the life of the one to be killed with Sumbha and insert it.

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i phur bu'i gsang sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa'i phur bus snying gar btab la nang gi yi ge pas mtshan pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje bris pa'i kham phor gyis bkab ste /
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i phur bu'i gsang sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa'i phur bus snying gar btab la nang gi yi ge pas mtshan pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje bris pa'i kham phor gyis bkab ste /
translated: Having struck the heart with a dagger that has been enchanted one hundred and eight times with the mantra of the dagger explained below, cover it with a bowl that has been drawn with a variegated vajra marked with the inner syllable A.

original: de yang sad bkab la de'i steng du rkang ba g-yon pas mnan te nyi ma phyed dam mtshan phyed na gsang sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sad bkab la de'i steng du rkang ba g-yon pas mnan te nyi ma phyed dam mtshan phyed na gsang sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Having covered it with earth, press it down with the left foot and recite the mantra one hundred and eight times at noon or midnight.

original: gdon gyi las thams cad la phub ma dang rdo ba dang ni ma pa'i lo ma dang skyur rtsabs dang / ske tshe la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'bras chan dmar po rang nyid khro bo'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas nang gi sbyin sreg gi cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gdon gyi las thams cad la phub ma dang rdo ba dang ni ma pa'i lo ma dang skyur rtsabs dang / ske tshe la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'bras chan dmar po rang nyid khro bo'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas nang gi sbyin sreg gi cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du bza' bar bya'o //
translated: In all the rites of the spirits, one should eat red rice together with chaff, stones, neem leaves, sour gruel, black mustard seed, and so on, with the pride of being a wrathful deity, in the manner of the rite of inner fire sacrifice.

original: dgra'i khyim sgor zhes tshig mang po snos pas ni grong rdal la sogs pa yang bzung ste phur bu zhes bya bar rjes su sbyar par bya'o //
analyzed: dgra'i khyim sgor zhes tshig mang po snos pas ni grong rdal la sogs pa yang bzung ste phur bu zhes bya bar rjes su sbyar par bya'o //
translated: In the door of the enemy's house also includes villages and so on, and one should supply one should drive in the dagger.

original: sbyor ba 'di dag la yang brkos te gzhug ces bya bar sbyar ro //🔽shes dang mi shes rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di dag la yang brkos te gzhug ces bya bar sbyar ro // shes dang mi shes rnam spangs pa //
translated: And one should supply one should dig and insert in these rites as well.🔽Abandoning the concepts of knowing and not knowing,

original: zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'am yang na gnyis su med pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i ye shes ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'am yang na gnyis su med pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i ye shes ni shes pa'o //
translated: means being free from the concepts of knowing and not knowing, or else, the wisdom that engages in nonduality is knowing.

original: mi shes pa ni de nyid mi shes pa ste de dang bral pas na mi shes spangs pa ste spangs pa ni dor ba'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni de nyid mi shes pa ste de dang bral pas na mi shes spangs pa ste spangs pa ni dor ba'o //
translated: The ignorance is the non-knowledge of reality; the abandonment of ignorance is the abandonment of that, i.e., the giving up of it.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te 'di dag thams cad ni sems tsam mo zhes nges par bsams la gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang rung pa'i nga rgyal gyis ji skad gsungs @229a * //🔽ba'i phur bus blangs la /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te 'di dag thams cad ni sems tsam mo zhes nges par bsams la gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang rung pa'i nga rgyal gyis ji skad gsungs @229a * // ba'i phur bus blangs la /
translated: This is what is being taught: having ascertained that all of this is mind only, with the pride of being any of Yamantaka and so forth, one should take up the kīla as taught.

original: las kyi rjes su mthun pa'i bskul tshig dang spel pa'i gsang sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas la /
analyzed: las kyi rjes su mthun pa'i bskul tshig dang spel pa'i gsang sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas la /
translated: Having recited the mantra of increase, which is in accord with the rite, one hundred and eight times,

original: dgra'i khyim sgro la sogs par brkos te gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dgra'i khyim sgro la sogs par brkos te gzhug par bya'o //
translated: one should dig in the enemy's house, and so forth, and insert it.

original: thod pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thod pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The complete skull is one that has all the characteristics as taught.

original: 'am gyi sgra ma rnyed na gzhan dag kyang rung pa'o //
analyzed: 'am gyi sgra ma rnyed na gzhan dag kyang rung pa'o //
translated: The word or indicates that if one does not find that, another is suitable.

original: rdo rje'i tshig gis zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i tshig gis byin gyis brlabs pas na rdo rje'i tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig gis zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i tshig gis byin gyis brlabs pas na rdo rje'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase with vajra words means that the words are vajra words because they are blessed by vajra words.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: che ge mo skrod ces bya ba dang spel ba gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i gsang sngags ji skad du bshad pa'i thod pa la dug la sogs pa rnams kyis legs par bris la /
analyzed: che ge mo skrod ces bya ba dang spel ba gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i gsang sngags ji skad du bshad pa'i thod pa la dug la sogs pa rnams kyis legs par bris la /
translated: One should write the mantra of any of the wrathful deities, such as Yamāri, with the addition of expel so-and-so, on a skull cup with poison, etc., as explained.

original: rdo rje'i tshig gis brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas te dgra'i sgo khang la sogs par pas na grong la sogs pa skrod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig gis brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas te dgra'i sgo khang la sogs par pas na grong la sogs pa skrod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having recited the mantra one hundred and eight times with vajra words, one should bury it at the threshold of the enemy's house, etc., and the village, etc., will be expelled.

original: 'chi ba'am bskams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sod cig pa'am skoms shig ces bya ba spel ba'i gsang sngags bris pas so //
analyzed: 'chi ba'am bskams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sod cig pa'am skoms shig ces bya ba spel ba'i gsang sngags bris pas so //
translated: Death or drying up means that one should write the mantra with the addition of kill! or dry up!

original: nye bar mtshon pa 'dis na skrod cig ces pa la sogs pa yang yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa 'dis na skrod cig ces pa la sogs pa yang yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: By this example, one should also include the addition of expel, etc.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te khro bo gang yang rung ba'i nga rgyal du byas nas /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te khro bo gang yang rung ba'i nga rgyal du byas nas /
translated: This is what is being taught: having done the pride of any wrathful one,

original: lha chen po gcer bu skra bshig ba lho phyogs na gnas pa 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sngags dang phyag rgyas de bkug la /
analyzed: lha chen po gcer bu skra bshig ba lho phyogs na gnas pa 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i sngags dang phyag rgyas de bkug la /
translated: one should summon the great god Mahesvara, who is naked, with disheveled hair, and who resides in the south, with the mantra and mudra of Kamadeva.

original: rdo rje 'di ni rdo rje che //
analyzed: rdo rje 'di ni rdo rje che //
translated: This is the vajra, the great vajra,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis byin brlabs pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis byin brlabs pa //
translated: blessed by all the buddhas.

original: dam tshig 'das na myur bar ni //
analyzed: dam tshig 'das na myur bar ni //
translated: If you transgress your pledge,

original: rigs rgyud bcas pa thal bar byed //
analyzed: rigs rgyud bcas pa thal bar byed //
translated: it will reduce you to ashes together with your lineage.🔽Om hana samaya hum phat.

original: aom ha na sa ma ya h'um phat ces brjod la sngar bshad pa'i khro bo ti r'i nti ri'i dam tshig byin la kha zhing tsha ba'i bkra mi shis pa'i me tog rnams kyis mchod la de blangs nas de yang rang gi las bya bar bsgo ste slar
analyzed: aom ha na sa ma ya h'um phat ces brjod la sngar bshad pa'i khro bo ti r'i nti ri'i dam tshig byin la kha zhing tsha ba'i bkra mi shis pa'i me tog rnams kyis mchod la de blangs nas de yang rang gi las bya bar bsgo ste slar
translated: Having said that, one should give the pledge of the previously explained wrathful deity Tiritantriri, and having offered him the inauspicious flowers of the mouth and the tongue, one should command him to do one's work.

original: btang na grong ngam grong khyer gyi lho phyogs kyi 'bus zos pa'i ta la'i 'dab ma la sogs pa la bdag nyid mngon par 'dod pa'i las dang rjes su mthun par bsgrub par bya ba'i ming dang spel pa'i spyod pas gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang
analyzed: btang na grong ngam grong khyer gyi lho phyogs kyi 'bus zos pa'i ta la'i 'dab ma la sogs pa la bdag nyid mngon par 'dod pa'i las dang rjes su mthun par bsgrub par bya ba'i ming dang spel pa'i spyod pas gshin rje gshed la sogs pa gang yang
translated: If one is going to cast it, on a leaf of a palm tree or the like, which has been eaten by termites in the southern direction from a village or city, one should write the name of the person to be killed, in conjunction with the rite that is desired, with the conduct of augmenting, and with the mantra of any of the Yamântaka deities.

original: rung pa'i gsang sngags mi rus la sogs pa phyag rgyas gtor pa'i tshul gyis sam yi ge phyin phyogs su bris la dug la sogs pa dang ni ma pa'i lo ma la sogs pa dang mi gtsang bas bskus te gsang sngags brgya rtsa bzlas la me tog de
analyzed: rung pa'i gsang sngags mi rus la sogs pa phyag rgyas gtor pa'i tshul gyis sam yi ge phyin phyogs su bris la dug la sogs pa dang ni ma pa'i lo ma la sogs pa dang mi gtsang bas bskus te gsang sngags brgya rtsa bzlas la me tog de
translated: One should write the mantra in the reverse order, with a stylus made from a bone of a human being, and so forth, or with a leaf of a poisonous tree, and so forth, smeared with impure substances, such as feces, and so forth.

original: lan bdun mngon par bzlas pa byas nas /
analyzed: lan bdun mngon par bzlas pa byas nas /
translated: Having recited the mantra one hundred times, one should enchant the flower seven times.

original: de'i @229b 'og tu ta la'i 'dab mar sbyar te me tog lhag ma rnams kyis dkri'o //
analyzed: de'i @229b 'og tu ta la'i 'dab mar sbyar te me tog lhag ma rnams kyis dkri'o //
translated: Having enchanted it, one should place it on the palm leaf, and wrap it with the remaining flowers.

original: de nas dgra'i sgo khang cog bus dong byas la nyi ma phyed dam mtshan phyed na sba bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dgra'i sgo khang cog bus dong byas la nyi ma phyed dam mtshan phyed na sba bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having dug a hole in the threshold of the enemy’s door, one should bury it at noon or midnight.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi rim pas sgrub pa la lan bdun zhugs pa'i sgrub pa po la dngos grub mi stsol na phur bus gdab pa 'di mngon par
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ji skad du bshad pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi rim pas sgrub pa la lan bdun zhugs pa'i sgrub pa po la dngos grub mi stsol na phur bus gdab pa 'di mngon par
translated: The one who is called Tathagata and so forth: if all Tathagatas do not grant power to the adept who has entered the rite seven times by the procedure of the rite as explained, then he should drive in the dagger.

original: 'dod do // de rnams kyi sku gsum ni sku dang gsung dang thugs te ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: 'dod do // de rnams kyi sku gsum ni sku dang gsung dang thugs te ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The three bodies of those are the body, speech, and mind, which are the essential body, the beatific body, and the emanation body.

original: de rnams kyi phur bus gdab pa'i phyir rdo rje phur bus te bdud rtsi thab sbyor la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi phur bus gdab pa'i phyir rdo rje phur bus te bdud rtsi thab sbyor la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: For the purpose of driving in the dagger of those, there is the vajra dagger, which is the form of Amrtakundali and so forth.

original: de nyid ye shes rdo rje ste de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid ye shes rdo rje ste de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: That is the knowledge vajra, and the meaning of observing that and so forth has been explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad phur bus gdab la thogs ba med pa'i gsang sngags gsung pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad phur bus gdab la thogs ba med pa'i gsang sngags gsung pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that all Tathagatas should drive in the dagger, and should one-pointedly set their minds on the utterance of the unobstructed secret mantra.

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la khams gsum po thams cad kyi ste khams gsum byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i ye shes ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid can te sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la khams gsum po thams cad kyi ste khams gsum byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i ye shes ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid can te sku gsung thugs so //
translated: All and so forth. The wisdom of all the three realms, that is, of the three realms, of the Tathagata and so forth, is the nature of wisdom, that is, body, speech, and mind.

original: de rnams phur bus 'debs par byed pa'i snying po gang yin pa de nyid ni rdo rje ste ming de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams phur bus 'debs par byed pa'i snying po gang yin pa de nyid ni rdo rje ste ming de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is the essence of their being struck by the dagger is the vajra, called by that name.

original: phur bu spyi'i sngags la ni sarba du sht'a na sarba p'a bam zhes bya ba bton pa la bsgrub par bya ba'i ming gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: phur bu spyi'i sngags la ni sarba du sht'a na sarba p'a bam zhes bya ba bton pa la bsgrub par bya ba'i ming gzhug par bya'o //
translated: In the general mantra of the dagger, one should recite sarva duṣṭān sarva pāpān and insert the name of the one to be accomplished.

original: a'a dzny'a pa ya ti zhes bya ba la 'og tu lha sbyin gyi zhes bya ba la yang gzhug go //
analyzed: a'a dzny'a pa ya ti zhes bya ba la 'og tu lha sbyin gyi zhes bya ba la yang gzhug go //
translated: Ājñāpayati and below, Devadatta should also be inserted.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' mnyam gzhag ste //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' mnyam gzhag ste //
translated: Having equipoised Vajrasattva

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po bcings pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po bcings pa'o //
translated: means binding the great seal of Vajrasattva.

original: sku gsum rdo rje'i mthar thug pa //
analyzed: sku gsum rdo rje'i mthar thug pa //
translated: The three bodies, the ultimate of the vajra

original: zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i mthar thug pa ste bsgrub par bya ba'i zhal gsum zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i mthar thug pa ste bsgrub par bya ba'i zhal gsum zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The three faces are the three faces of the accomplishment of the ultimate of the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: sbyang zhes bya ba ni mi rus la sogs pa las byas pa'i phur bu'i dbang du byas nas gdab po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyang zhes bya ba ni mi rus la sogs pa las byas pa'i phur bu'i dbang du byas nas gdab po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The purification is in terms of the dagger made of human bone, etc. The meaning of one should plant is understood.

original: khro bo nas 'bras nyid du ni //
analyzed: khro bo nas 'bras nyid du ni //
translated: From the wrathful one, up to the fruit.

original: zhes bya ba ni yi ge h'um las byung ba zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa sku mdog nag po rol pa'i stang stabs kyis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yi ge h'um las byung ba zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa sku mdog nag po rol pa'i stang stabs kyis bzhugs pa /
translated: The one who arises from the syllable hūṃ has three faces, six arms, and a black body, standing in the pose of dance.

original: mi bskyod pa'i gtsug gi nor bu can /🔽phyag na ral gri dang lcags @230a * //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i gtsug gi nor bu can / phyag na ral gri dang lcags @230a * //
translated: He has Akṣobhya as the crest jewel.

original: kyu dang / 'khor lo dang / zhags pa dang / dgra sta dang / rtse gsum pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: kyu dang / 'khor lo dang / zhags pa dang / dgra sta dang / rtse gsum pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: In his hands he holds a sword, a goad, a wheel, a noose, an axe, and a trident.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi phur bu bsam //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi phur bu bsam //
translated: One should think of the dagger of the three vajras.

original: zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi phur bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi phur bu'o //
translated: The dagger of the body, speech, and mind.

original: bdag nyid chen po stobs po che //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po stobs po che //
translated: The great being, Mahābala,

original: zhes bya ba ni stobs po che'am rdo rje h'um mdzad chen po la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stobs po che'am rdo rje h'um mdzad chen po la sogs pas so //
translated: This is with the great powerful one, or with the great vajra hūṃkāra, and so on.🔽The vajra of the amṛta-cauldron, etc.

original: bdud rtsi thab sbyor rdo rje dang // zhes bya ba la sogs bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi gzugs can gyi phur bus so //
analyzed: bdud rtsi thab sbyor rdo rje dang // zhes bya ba la sogs bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi gzugs can gyi phur bus so //
translated: The dagger is in the form of the amṛta-cauldron.🔽With the vajra yoga, etc.

original: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i sbyor pa dang ldan pas 'di la phur bus gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bsam pa brtan pos so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i sbyor pa dang ldan pas 'di la phur bus gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bsam pa brtan pos so //
translated: One should drive in the dagger with the thought, “I will do this with the yoga of wrath, with a firm thought.

original: steng du 'ang dam tshig de nyid ni //
analyzed: steng du 'ang dam tshig de nyid ni //
translated: And above, that very commitment.

original: zhes bya ba ni thugs ka nas brtsams te ji srid dbu'i bar rdo rje phur bu de nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thugs ka nas brtsams te ji srid dbu'i bar rdo rje phur bu de nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should think of that very vajra dagger, beginning from the heart up to the head.

original: dam tshig ni nges par bsgom par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig ni nges par bsgom par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the commitment is to be meditated on.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te gang gi tshe rnal 'byor bas bsgrub pa bdun gyis kyang ma grub na /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te gang gi tshe rnal 'byor bas bsgrub pa bdun gyis kyang ma grub na /
translated: This is what is being taught: When the practitioner has not accomplished [the deity] even with the seven means of accomplishment,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' 'am gang yang rung pa'i nga rgyal du ji lta ba bzhin du byas la snga ma ltar mi rus la sogs pa las byas pa'i phur bu thogs te sa la sogs pa las byas pa'i rang gi lha mdun du bzhag ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' 'am gang yang rung pa'i nga rgyal du ji lta ba bzhin du byas la snga ma ltar mi rus la sogs pa las byas pa'i phur bu thogs te sa la sogs pa las byas pa'i rang gi lha mdun du bzhag ste /
translated: Having done just as before, with the pride of Vajrasattva or whatever, taking up the dagger made of human bone, and so on, one should place one's deity in front, made of earth, and so on.

original: der gnyis pa yang dgug cing gzhug la bcings nas phur bus yang dag par btab ste des kyang dbu nas brtsams te /
analyzed: der gnyis pa yang dgug cing gzhug la bcings nas phur bus yang dag par btab ste des kyang dbu nas brtsams te /
translated: Having summoned and caused to enter the second one, and bound it, one should strike it with the dagger, and also imagine that it is pierced from the head down to the feet.

original: ji srid zhabs kyi mthar thug gi bar du phrug par bsams la sdigs mdzub bya ba la sogs pa'o gnas bshad pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid zhabs kyi mthar thug gi bar du phrug par bsams la sdigs mdzub bya ba la sogs pa'o gnas bshad pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish it with the yogas explained in the abode, such as the threatening gesture, and so on.🔽By this, one should accomplish the supreme feat,

original: bsam gtan rdo rje'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: bsam gtan rdo rje'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: with the yoga of the vajra of concentration.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi phur bu nyid gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi phur bu nyid gsungs pa'o //
translated: This declares the dagger of concentration.

original: rgyal chen po rdo rje sems dpa' dang / zhes bya ba la ni thugs rje'i rnal 'byor ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal chen po rdo rje sems dpa' dang / zhes bya ba la ni thugs rje'i rnal 'byor ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The great king Vajrasattva is the compassionate one who is called by that name.

original: sangs rgyas kun kyang phung bus 'debs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun kyang phung bus 'debs //
translated: Even the Buddhas are nailed by it.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyang de'i phur bus 'debs zhes bya ba bsdam dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyang de'i phur bus 'debs zhes bya ba bsdam dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: spyi'i gsang sngags kyis de bzhin gshegs pa phur bus 'debs pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid gtso bo nyid de phur bus gdab pa de la ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i gsang sngags kyis de bzhin gshegs pa phur bus 'debs pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid gtso bo nyid de phur bus gdab pa de la ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yin no //
translated: The nailing of the Tathagatas by the nail of the general mantra is the Blessed One himself, the principal one, and the nailing is by the Tathagatas.

original: lha lhag ma rnams bur bu gdab pa la ni rang gi bdag po rnams kyis bya'o //
analyzed: lha lhag ma rnams bur bu gdab pa la ni rang gi bdag po rnams kyis bya'o //
translated: The nailing of the remaining deities by the nail is to be done by their respective lords.

original: khyad par gyi gsang sngags kyis thams cad kyis phur bu gdab pa la ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: khyad par gyi gsang sngags kyis thams cad kyis phur bu gdab pa la ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The nailing of all by the nail of the special mantra is to be done by Body Vajra and so forth.

original: myur du 'chi @230b ba 'am bskams par 'gyur //
analyzed: myur du 'chi @230b ba 'am bskams par 'gyur //
translated: He will quickly die or dry up.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyang zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyang zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te sku rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bas rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa mdun du bsams la de la gnyis pa yang dgug cing gzhug la bcings nas de'i steng du h'um las phur bu ji lta ba bzhin du bsams la
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te sku rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bas rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa mdun du bsams la de la gnyis pa yang dgug cing gzhug la bcings nas de'i steng du h'um las phur bu ji lta ba bzhin du bsams la
translated: This is the teaching: the practitioner of the Vajra Body should imagine the Tathagata to be accomplished in front of him, and having summoned him, caused him to enter, and bound him, he should imagine the dagger just as it is from the syllable hum.

original: khros pas de la bka' bsgo pa'i tshul gyis phur bus gdab pa'i gsang sngags ji lta ba bzhin du zlos shing phur bus 'debs par bsams la /
analyzed: khros pas de la bka' bsgo pa'i tshul gyis phur bus gdab pa'i gsang sngags ji lta ba bzhin du zlos shing phur bus 'debs par bsams la /
translated: With wrath, he should imagine that he is driving in the dagger with the mantra of driving in the dagger just as it is, in the manner of giving an order to him.

original: phyag rgya dang tsham dam gyis phur bus gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang tsham dam gyis phur bus gdab par bya'o //
translated: He should drive in the dagger with the seal and the gesture.

original: sku la sogs pa'i phur bus gdab pa ni khyad par gyi gsang sngags gsungs pa la /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i phur bus gdab pa ni khyad par gyi gsang sngags gsungs pa la /
translated: The special mantras for driving in the dagger of the body and so forth are stated.

original: sku'i ye shes ni rnams par snang mdzad kyis ye shes so //
analyzed: sku'i ye shes ni rnams par snang mdzad kyis ye shes so //
translated: The gnosis of the body is the gnosis of Vairocana.

original: de'i rnam par bsgyings pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sku'i phur bus sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par bsgyings pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sku'i phur bus sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
translated: His dance is the performance of the benefit of sentient beings with the dagger of the body of the Tathagata and so forth.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje ste dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje ste dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: That itself is the vajra. The meaning of the term “object” has been explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sku'i phur ba'i gsang sngags gsungs pa'i rnam pa la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sku'i phur ba'i gsang sngags gsungs pa'i rnam pa la thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he focused his mind on the form of the mantra of the dagger of the body of the Tathāgata, etc.

original: rdo rje'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje'i sku ni rnam par snang mdzad de de nyid dam tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje'i sku ni rnam par snang mdzad de de nyid dam tshig go //
translated: The vajra body is Vairocana, and that itself is the pledge.

original: gnyis su med pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa las byung ba de'i phur bu yin la de'i don gsang sngags 'byung zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa las byung ba de'i phur bu yin la de'i don gsang sngags 'byung zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The dagger of that is the dagger of the nondual, which arises from the cause of the nondual intuition. The meaning is that the mantra arises from that.

original: stang stabs kyi phyag rgya gsungs pa ni phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: stang stabs kyi phyag rgya gsungs pa ni phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The gesture of the dance is stated by “intertwining,” etc.

original: phan tshun dkri pa'i tshul du bya ba ni lag pa g-yon pa sgrubs la de'i steng du g-yas pa bzhag ste /
analyzed: phan tshun dkri pa'i tshul du bya ba ni lag pa g-yon pa sgrubs la de'i steng du g-yas pa bzhag ste /
translated: The method of the mutual intertwining is to place the left hand below and the right hand above it.

original: g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung la sogs pas g-yas pa'i mthe'u chung la sogs pa bzung ste /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung la sogs pas g-yas pa'i mthe'u chung la sogs pa bzung ste /
translated: The left thumb and so on grasp the right thumb and so on.

original: phan tshun dkri ba lta bur byas la g-yon pa'i mthe bo g-yas pa'i lag mthil gyi dbus su bkug la bzhag ste /
analyzed: phan tshun dkri ba lta bur byas la g-yon pa'i mthe bo g-yas pa'i lag mthil gyi dbus su bkug la bzhag ste /
translated: Having made a mutual embrace, one should bend the left thumb into the center of the right palm and place it there.🔽The union of the thumbs is the union of the thumbs. With that one should drive in the vajra stake.

original: mthe bo dang sbyar ba ni mthe bo sbyor ba ste des rdo rje phur bu gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthe bo dang sbyar ba ni mthe bo sbyor ba ste des rdo rje phur bu gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should drive in the vajra stake.

original: snang mdzad zhabs kyis mnan nas su //
analyzed: snang mdzad zhabs kyis mnan nas su //
translated: Having pressed down with the foot of Vairochana,

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sbyor bas bzung pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sbyor bas bzung pa'o //
translated: one should hold with the union of Vairochana.

original: btab pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: btab pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
translated: Merely by driving in,

original: sku gsung ye shes las byung ba'i //
analyzed: sku gsung ye shes las byung ba'i //
translated: one should drive in the vajra stake.

original: zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang @231a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang @231a * //
translated: The Bhagavat Vairochana, arisen from body, speech, and gnosis,

original: mdzad do // dam tshig mchog gi bzhengs par mdzad //
analyzed: mdzad do // dam tshig mchog gi bzhengs par mdzad //
translated: arises in the supreme commitment.

original: ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje phur bu'i rnam par yongs su gyur par bsgom pa ni dam tshig ste de nyid mchog gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad rdo rje phur bu'i rnam par yongs su gyur par bsgom pa ni dam tshig ste de nyid mchog gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the pledge of meditating on the Blessed One Vairocana as the transformation of the Vajra Stake, which is the supreme origin.

original: gzhan du byas na brlag par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du byas na brlag par 'gyur //
translated: If one does otherwise, one will be destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te rdo rje phur bu 'byung ba ma bsgoms par sngags dang phyag rgya 'ba' zhig rab tu sbyar na de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te rdo rje phur bu 'byung ba ma bsgoms par sngags dang phyag rgya 'ba' zhig rab tu sbyar na de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is to say, if one employs just the mantra and the seal without meditating on the origin of the Vajra Stake, then one will lose the desired power.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas khros pas rang gis bsgrub par bya ba mdun du ji lta ba bzhin du bsams te tsham dam gyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas khros pas rang gis bsgrub par bya ba mdun du ji lta ba bzhin du bsams te tsham dam gyi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: This is what is being taught: The practitioner of Vairocana, with wrath, should imagine in front of himself the one to be subdued just as he is, and should form the seal of threatening.

original: de'i 'og tu phyag rgya bcings pa las byung ba'i 'khor lo 'bar ba yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje'i phur bu bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i mgo nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthar thug gi bar du gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du phur bus btab par bsam mo
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phyag rgya bcings pa las byung ba'i 'khor lo 'bar ba yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje'i phur bu bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i mgo nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthar thug gi bar du gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du phur bus btab par bsam mo
translated: Then, beginning from the beginning of the establishment of the vajra dagger which is the transformation of the blazing wheel arisen from the binding of the seal, one should imagine that the dagger is struck in the manner of a reflection up to the feet.

original: // yang na btab pa tsam gyis sems dpa' che //
analyzed: // yang na btab pa tsam gyis sems dpa' che //
translated: Or, by merely striking, the great being

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: is as before.

original: sku gsung ye shes las byung ba //
analyzed: sku gsung ye shes las byung ba //
translated: Arisen from the body, speech, and gnosis

original: zhes bya ba ni phur bu'i gzugs can gyi bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phur bu'i gzugs can gyi bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: is the Blessed One Vairocana in the form of the dagger.

original: dam tshig gis zhes bya ba la ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid tsham dam gyi phyag rgyas slar yang bsdu ba'i sbyor ba mchog gis cho ga bzhin du gnas ji lta bar slar bsdu'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dam tshig gis zhes bya ba la ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid tsham dam gyi phyag rgyas slar yang bsdu ba'i sbyor ba mchog gis cho ga bzhin du gnas ji lta bar slar bsdu'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By the pledge, the Blessed One himself is again gathered by the yoga of the supreme gathering with the pledge seal, and is gathered back into his own place according to the rite, as is taught.

original: bzhengs par mdzad ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la btab nas gyen du bzhud pa'o //
analyzed: bzhengs par mdzad ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la btab nas gyen du bzhud pa'o //
translated: He is made to rise up, having struck the one to be established, and he ascends upward.

original: gzhan du byas na brlag par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du byas na brlag par 'gyur //
translated: Otherwise, one will be destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni stang stabs rjes su ma bsdus pa'i nyes pas srin po la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar gnod pa byed pa'i glags rnyed par 'gyur bas gnod par 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stang stabs rjes su ma bsdus pa'i nyes pas srin po la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar gnod pa byed pa'i glags rnyed par 'gyur bas gnod par 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: This means that by the fault of not collecting the footwork, one will be harmed by the opportunity of being harmed by rākṣasas and so forth.

original: de yang / sngags pas gang yang rung bzung nas //
analyzed: de yang / sngags pas gang yang rung bzung nas //
translated: And also: The mantrin should take up anything

original: de la 'ang byams pa nyid du bya //
analyzed: de la 'ang byams pa nyid du bya //
translated: and also be loving toward it.

original: rdo rje gar la gnas nas kyang //
analyzed: rdo rje gar la gnas nas kyang //
translated: Dwelling in the vajra dance,

original: de nas phyag rgya legs par bsdu //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya legs par bsdu //
translated: then one should collect the mudra.

original: las kyi cho ga mthong ba yis //
analyzed: las kyi cho ga mthong ba yis //
translated: By the rite of action,

original: rdo rje gnas su gzhag par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje gnas su gzhag par bya //
translated: one should place it in the vajra place.🔽Otherwise, all the guhyakas

original: gzhan du gsang ba pa kun dang // srin po rnams ni gnod byed de //
analyzed: gzhan du gsang ba pa kun dang // srin po rnams ni gnod byed de //
translated: and the rākṣasas will harm

original: glags skabs tshol bar byed pa yis //
analyzed: glags skabs tshol bar byed pa yis //
translated: the one who seeks an opportunity.

original: gnod byed rnams ni 'tshe byed cing //
analyzed: gnod byed rnams ni 'tshe byed cing //
translated: The harmful ones will harm

original: glags tshol rjes mthun shes @231b nas ni //
analyzed: glags tshol rjes mthun shes @231b nas ni //
translated: the one who knows the opportunity to be sought.

original: sngags pa la ni rab gnod byed //
analyzed: sngags pa la ni rab gnod byed //
translated: The mantrin will be greatly harmed.

original: de bas rnam pa thams cad du //
analyzed: de bas rnam pa thams cad du //
translated: Therefore, in every way,

original: sgrub pa po ni blo ldan pas //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni blo ldan pas //
translated: the wise practitioner

original: rdo rje'i gnas ni shes byas la //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gnas ni shes byas la //
translated: Having understood the vajra site,

analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas srin lag gnyis po go bzlog ste gung mo'i nang du gzhug / mthe bo dang mthe'u chung dag sbyar gung mo dag kyang sbyar bar byas la gung mo gnyis dam por sbyar ba'i tshigs gsum pa'i gnas su mdzub mo bkug nas rdo

analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten dbang phyug nyid ni gsung gi ngo bo'o //

analyzed: de nyid dam tshig ste de'i rnam par bsgyings pa ni @232a * //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gsung gi phur bus sems can gyi don mdzad pa ste de nyid rdo rje'o //

analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //

original: rdo rje sor mo bcum pa yi //
analyzed: rdo rje sor mo bcum pa yi //
translated: The passion vajra is the Lord of the World.🔽 The foot is the foot of the Lord of the World.🔽 The three bodies are the three bodies of the Lord of the World.🔽 The wisdom is the wisdom of the Lord of the World.🔽 The dagger is the dagger of the Lord of the World.🔽 The form is the form of the Lord of the World.🔽 The foot is the foot of the Lord of the World.🔽 The passion vajra is the Lord of the World.

translated: The foot is the foot of the Lord of the World.🔽 The three bodies are the three bodies of the Lord of the World.🔽 The wisdom is the wisdom of the Lord of the World.🔽 The dagger is the dagger of the Lord of the World.🔽 The form is the form of the Lord of the World.🔽 The foot is the foot of the Lord of the World.

analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje'i zhabs kyis mnan //

analyzed: bde gshegs bka' yi rjes su byed //

analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' rjes su @232b byed pa'i don gyis na 'di skad ston te /

translated: Now, the mantras and activities of Marici, and so on, which are not included among the deities of the mandala, are taught beginning with all thieves, and so on.

original: chom rkun thams cad 'ching zhing ldongs par byed pa'i rdo rje ni 'od zer can no //
analyzed: chom rkun thams cad 'ching zhing ldongs par byed pa'i rdo rje ni 'od zer can no //

original: de la dmigs ba zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs ba zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the term observing that has been explained.

original: thugs ni dgyes shing mgu bar gyur //
analyzed: thugs ni dgyes shing mgu bar gyur //

translated: This is the mantra of the family that blinds all evildoers, and he sees that it has brought happiness to the realm of sentient beings, and so he has attained great delight.

translated: Application is merely an illustration, and so it also refers to striving in meditation and so forth.

analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi ngos thams cad la de'i grogs rnams der gnas par bsams la /

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kyis gzhal yas khang kha sbyar byas te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kyis gzhal yas khang kha sbyar byas te /

translated: The red light rays that arise from that completely transform into the form of the goddess Marici, holding a needle and thread, who sews up the mouths and eyes of the evildoers.

analyzed: lag pa g-yon par zla ba rdo rje zla ba la yang 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa de'i lte bar 'od zer gyi sngags nyid brtag go //
translated: On one’s left hand, on a moon, is a vajra, and on the moon of the vajra is an eight-spoked wheel. In the center of that is the mantra of light rays.

original: sngags de'i logs kyi rtsibs rnams la grogs kyi ming bkod la /
analyzed: sngags de'i logs kyi rtsibs rnams la grogs kyi ming bkod la /

original: dbugs mi 'byin par de'i sngags lan bdun brjod la /
analyzed: dbugs mi 'byin par de'i sngags lan bdun brjod la /

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes brjod nas /

original: rdo rje khu tshur gyis gos kyis g-yogs par byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gyis gos kyis g-yogs par byas la /

analyzed: de ma bkrol bar 'od zer can gyi gsang sngags zlos shing mi smra bar dogs pa med cing blo brtan pas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Go without speaking, without hesitation, with a firm mind.

analyzed: gdon par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa thams cad ni sems can mang po la 'khu @233a * //
translated: With respect to the one who is to be removed, etc., all the harmful ones are the many sentient beings who are hostile.

original: bar byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bar byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of one who is to be subdued and so forth is as follows: All those who are harmful are those who harm many sentient beings and so forth.

analyzed: de rnams 'dul ba ni rang gi nyes pa las bzlog pa ste de ni rdo rje padma dkar po'o //

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of visualization and so forth has been explained.

analyzed: dur khrod kyi ras la srin mo btsag gis bris nas zhes bya ba ni dur khrod kyi ras nyid la bri ba'o //
translated: Having drawn a rākṣasī with cinnabar on a charnel ground cloth, that is, on a charnel ground cloth itself.

analyzed: legs par sbas te zhes bya ba la dben par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya pa ni lhag ma'o //

original: rig sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas la zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par bsgrub par bya ba'i ming bskul tshig dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas la zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par bsgrub par bya ba'i ming bskul tshig dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Having recited the knowledge-mantra one hundred and eight times, that is, having accomplished the corresponding [rite], [including] the invocation with the name of the one to be subdued.

original: ming nas smos shing zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i ming brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ming nas smos shing zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i ming brjod pa'o //
translated: Having uttered the name, that is, having uttered the name of the one to be subdued.

original: phyir rgol pa dang dgra thams cad ces bya ba ni rdzas gcig mngon par 'dod pa las byung ba'i dgra bo ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol pa dang dgra thams cad ces bya ba ni rdzas gcig mngon par 'dod pa las byung ba'i dgra bo ni phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: All adversaries and enemies means that an enemy who arises from a single substance is an adversary.

original: mi mdza' ba'i phyogs su lhung ba ni dgra bo'o //
analyzed: mi mdza' ba'i phyogs su lhung ba ni dgra bo'o //
translated: Falling into the side of non-friends is an enemy.

original: bcing ba zhes bya ba ni ci yang mi byed pa nyid du byed do //
analyzed: bcing ba zhes bya ba ni ci yang mi byed pa nyid du byed do //
translated: Binding means making it so that nothing is done at all.

original: de nyid ni 'og mas bstan pa ni mnan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs te mi 'gul bar byas pa ni mnan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'og mas bstan pa ni mnan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs te mi 'gul bar byas pa ni mnan pa'o //
translated: That itself is taught by the next verse, beginning with pressing and so on. Making it so that it does not move is pressing.

original: tshig dang bral bar byas pa ni rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang bral bar byas pa ni rmongs pa'o //
translated: Making it so that it is devoid of speech is stupefying.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te rin la mi brtseg par nyes pa'am 'bad pa med las byung ba'i dur khrod kyi ras la bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba bzhin du bris la dben par bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te rin la mi brtseg par nyes pa'am 'bad pa med las byung ba'i dur khrod kyi ras la bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba bzhin du bris la dben par bzhag ste /
translated: This is what is being taught: Without regard for price, on cloth from a charnel ground that arises without fault or effort, one should draw the Blessed One as before, and place it in a secluded place.

original: dgug pa la sogs pa byas nas gu gul gyis bdug pa bsreg la nyin zhag bdun gyi bar du thun bzhir me tog dmar po la sogs pa mchod pa rnam pa lngas legs par mchod la /
analyzed: dgug pa la sogs pa byas nas gu gul gyis bdug pa bsreg la nyin zhag bdun gyi bar du thun bzhir me tog dmar po la sogs pa mchod pa rnam pa lngas legs par mchod la /
translated: Having summoned and so forth, having fumigated with guggula incense, for seven days in four sessions, having made offerings with five branches of offerings such as red flowers, and so forth,🔽one should recite the vidyā one hundred and eight times, with the words of the invocation “Give me, O god, stambhana”

original: lha sbyin stambha ya zhe'am /🔽dzambha ya zhes bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas par rig pa la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la ras ris blangs te nyi ma'i gung ngam mtshan phyed du dur khrod du song ste der tsog bus dong byas la /
analyzed: lha sbyin stambha ya zhe'am / dzambha ya zhes bskul ba'i tshig dang bcas par rig pa la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la ras ris blangs te nyi ma'i gung ngam mtshan phyed du dur khrod du song ste der tsog bus dong byas la /
translated: or “Give me, O god, jambhana.”🔽Having taken the painting, at noon or midnight, one should go to a charnel ground, and there, sitting cross-legged, one should dig a hole.🔽Having placed the painting between two skulls, one should cover it with earth, and having recited the vidyā one hundred and eight times, with the words of the invocation “Give me, O god, stambhana” or “Give me, O god, jambhana,” over white mustard seeds,

original: thod pa gnyis kyi bar du ras ris bcug la sas bkab ste yungs kar dkar po la rig sngags lha sbyin stambha ya zhes bskul ba'i tshig dang ldan par brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la /
analyzed: thod pa gnyis kyi bar du ras ris bcug la sas bkab ste yungs kar dkar po la rig sngags lha sbyin stambha ya zhes bskul ba'i tshig dang ldan par brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la /

analyzed: de'i steng du gtor la las grub nas bcom ldan 'das ma spyan drangs la ji lta ba bzhin mchod de slar gshegs su gsol lo //

analyzed: nad chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nad chen po thams cad ni rims la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: de sel ba ni med par bsal te des na rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba ste ri khrod kyi lo ma can la de skad ces bya'o //

original: @233b de nyid ni ye shes kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: @233b de nyid ni ye shes kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: That itself is the vajra of wisdom.

analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase with the visualization, etc., has been explained.

analyzed: brgya byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brgya byin gyi mngon par mtho ba ni bsgreng ba'o //

translated: The one who has generated the power of this meaning, the special ability, is the one who has the supreme victory banner armlet. He is called that.

translated: The vajra is the Victor, and he is the holder of the vajra, hence the name Vajradhara.

translated: The mudra of threatening means that she has the mudra of the threatening forefinger for threatening the wicked who are in their own directions.

analyzed: bsdigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni bsrung ba'i bdag nyid can no // rdo rje ro langs phyung ba yis //

analyzed: rgyal bar gyur cig rgyal bar gyur cig ces brjod cing gsang sngags gdon par bya'o //

translated: “In the three worlds” and so forth: the three worlds are the abodes, and the wicked who dwell there are destroyed and removed.

analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni legs par byang ba ste rgyal mtshan mchog gi dpung rgyan la de skad ces bya'o //

analyzed: de nyid ni mchog ste sangs rgyas rnams kyi rtse mo yin la de nyid rdo rje'o //
translated: That itself is supreme, the peak of the buddhas, and that itself is the vajra.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “object” and so on has been explained.

analyzed: mngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bud med thams cad kyi mngal yang dag par bskyed pa ni mngal chags pa sta /
translated: In the womb and so on, the “womb” is the generation in the womb of all women.

original: don de spros par mdzad pas na so sor 'brang ma chen mo la de skad ces bya ste de nyid rdo rje'o //
analyzed: don de spros par mdzad pas na so sor 'brang ma chen mo la de skad ces bya ste de nyid rdo rje'o //
translated: The Great Amulet is so called because it elaborates on that meaning.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “object” and so on has been explained.

original: 'jigs pa dang ni skrag pa yis //
